Reviews.Title: “Same excellent quality as before”
Reviews.Author: Hutchvol
Reviews.Content: I originally reviewed this property in 2011. Subsequent to that review, this hotel changed its name from the Elysian to the Waldorf Astoria. I was concerned that the quality and service might change with new ownership. I am happy to report that the hotel in all aspects is as excellent as it was under the Elysian name. One of the small issues that makes this such a wonderful place to stay is the "No Tipping" policy. This policy remains the same. I will not be redundant with my comments from last time. You may review it or comments left by others regarding the consistency in quality that makes the hotel stand above all others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely A Gorgeous Property!”
Reviews.Author: Wende L
Reviews.Content: Just finished a night here with my last Q4 FN certificate. Outstanding property and terrific staff. This is the hotel you would like to stay entire time of your stay without even thinking about going out. Checked in and was greeted as a diamond member. Room was assigned to original booking (King Deluxe), but after politely asked about upgrade, the front desk lady was unsure and went back to check with her manager. When she came out, I was told upgraded to a Waldorf Suite on east side of the 26th floor! As a reward stay, I didn't expect too much but this hotel has surprised me in every possible aspects. The staff is trained with top notch courtesy and professionalism; the details of decor are flawless. The best and yet the most unbelievable part: no tips accepted everywhere in the hotel, except Balsan (restaurant on 3rd floor) that automatically adds 18% gratuity to your entire bill. The house car offers a convenient transportation alternative, with only three restrictions: (1) only drop off, no pick up; (2) first come, first serve, no reservation can be made beforehand; (3) only drive within 2-mile radius of the hotel. Now the downside, the room itself is just a junior suite (anyway, this is a free upgrade for a reward stay and I am totally okay with it), but if you want to throw a party by counting on a "spacious" upgrade to a Waldorf suite, you may have to think about it again; the hotel is surrounded by skyscrapers so that the lake view is minimal, if there is any. Other than that, no wonder it is the number 1 hotel in Chicago (by TA) and totally worth your every point/buck!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Heaven in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Pulling into the elegant courtyard you know you are in for a special treat. This small boutique hotel offers unparallelled luxury and service with a great location, just off of the Mag Mile. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and QUIET! The Spa and Restaurant - RIA make this location difficult to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownGuy2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and wanted to make it more. Service and amenities were top notch. Used a free night certificate from Hilton and was upgraded to a suite as a diamond member. Spacious suite had a fireplace and I loved the TV in the bathroom mirror (this is March Madness you know). Didn't eat in the restaurants or take advantage of other hotel amenities because we were out enjoying the city but for a great place to stay (and just blocks from Michigan Ave) this can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly R
Reviews.Content: What can I say? The best hotel my hubs and I have been to. Stayed here for my birthday. Our first time in Chicago. Wonderful place. Beautiful and fast service from check-in to check out. Spa was the best part. The

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: CanCookWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I love the Elysian-- now that it's the Waldorf Astoria Chicago, I expect the trend of excellency to continue. The service is WAY above any hotel I have ever stayed at... and the rooms are tasteful, quiet, and luxurious. The spa is a MUST-- really amazing and comfortable even if you just visit the steam room or whirlpool-- tho the services are AWESOME (i have had a facial + a few massages-- WOW!) The bar is small + dark-- feels like you are at a friends kickass library room... service can be slow tho-- so give yourself some time to enjoy. The restaurants are great too-- the fine dining one gets excellent review tho I have not eaten there myself. Great location for fancy shopping too-- bring your pocketbook!

Reviews.Title: “Quoting Ferris Bueller "If you have the means, I highly recommend picking one up"”
Reviews.Author: GE1972
Reviews.Content: Oh what a night. Spent my 40th birthday downtown and stayed the night at the Waldorf. Hands down best urban hotel experience. Fantastic service from check-in all the way to check-out. Received complimentary upgrade to a Waldorf Suite with luxurious amenities including a gas fireplace, deep soaking tub, and Gi-Normous shower. Wonderful linens and bedding made for peaceful slumber after a late night out on the town. Room was opulent, cozy, and comfortable. Complimentary hotel car service to our dinner location - driver wouldn't accept a tip. Neither would the bellman who helped us with our bags. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious - and great service. Easy to understand why this hotel is tops in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KittyBV
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend in Chicago and found this hotel to meet and exceed our expectations. The food was excellent and especially Sunday brunch. My daughter joined me in the spa and it was lovely, very attentive staff and well laid out. They were offering a "stay 2 nights and get one free" which was an unexpected bonus. We traveled with our 6.6 pound dog and she was given a great bed and food dishes. The only thing that would have been perfect was to have a dog area outside closer than one block away as true to form, Chicago was windy and cold. Highly recommend the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted a late checkout”
Reviews.Author: creining
Reviews.Content: Like, until the next day. I have had the Elysian, now the Waldorf Astoria, on my short list since I first heard and read about it. It currently has the top spot for Chicago on Trip Advisor and was named number one hotel in the US, number seven in the world, by Conde Nast. STAFF: everyone we came in contact with was very polite, helpful, and a pleasure to deal with. There were always a handful of staff at the front desk ready to assist with whatever was needed. I found that they were a joy to deal with but yet not overbearing; a nice blend. Also, a no tipping policy which I like. ROOM: the room - a king bed suite #1410 - was impeccable. An understated but luxurious overall tone. Fireplace is a nice touch. Couch, although little used, was comfortable. Balcony would be great in the summer. The bed and linens were a dream. The iPod/Phone speaker was nice to have for music. The bathroom was elegant with beautiful tile work on the floor and in the spacious shower. The soaking tub was perfect and used for a late night bath. Toiletries high quality. And the robes, super comfortable! AMENITIES: we never made it to the restaurant or bar, unfortunately. Room service breakfast was decent and arrived in less than 20 minutes from the time it was ordered. The coffee and croissants were the highlight. It was great to be able to get the Times on Sunday. The Spa was out of this world! We went for an early morning swim in the lap pool. A few minutes into our swim a gentleman brought in two cups of tea on a platter for us because he thought it would be a nice way for us to wake up. Completely unexpected and a nice touch. Afterwards, we spent some time in the relaxation area - separate women and mens - where the whirlpool, steam room and sauna are. I chilled in the steam room for a bit then headed into the whirlpool; it was so comfortable and elegant I could have spent all day there. OVERALL: I would say my experience with the Waldorf Astoria was top notch. I stayed here for my birthday and I received a very delicious chocolate bar made by the pastry chef and a hand written note from Martin (one of the managers) wishing me a happy birthday. These are the little things I expect when I am paying for a hotel of this caliber. The Waldorf Astoria did not disappoint in any area; it exceeded all my expectations and I would be thrilled to stay here again. Lastly, now I am curious to see how The Trump, The Peninsula, The Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, and Park Hyatt stack up. I have a feeling the Waldorf Astoria is on top for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Jhiggi
Reviews.Content: My family travels quite a bit, and I am super-picky about where we stay. I can sum up the hotel, location, staff, and everything about our stay with one word- Awesome. The only negative I had was that the bed was a tad hard for my taste. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Go on and book your reservation with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: alvalady
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a very nice hotel, however I probably would not visit again. Like others, I enjoyed the gas fireplace and balcony. However, I found the suite floor plan somewhat awkward. I could not get comfortable in the long, narrow sitting room. My husband didn't seem to mind at all. The bed was very comfortable and the towels and bath products first rate. The suite even had a powder room in addition to the full bath. Room service breakfast was good but not memorable -- we had hoped for a better in-room dining experience due to the excellent reputation of the restaurant. Service was very good, especially from room service staff. Front desk was very apologetic about not having our room ready at check in. While we were waiting, they offered us a drink at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria Chicago”
Reviews.Author: frankdiandrea
Reviews.Content: One of the most amazing hotels I have ever stayed in. Service is phenomenal, rooms are spotless, roomy and extraordinarily set up with a great layout. There is a no tipping policy that is strictly adhered to no matter how hard I tried!!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to check back in ...”
Reviews.Author: JJWLW
Reviews.Content: Top-rated in Chcago and perhaps the US, and well-deserved. We wanted to delay going home and check back in. Service impeccable, room extraordinarily nice, apparent tipping policy interesting and appreciated. Health facility very good, and ths sauna and steam room were great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is not only a beautiful hotel with a wonderful location but delivers world-class customer service. When we arrived, there had been some mistake with the room booking - it could have been the computer and it could have been mine - they quickly and without any drama corrected it by putting us in a huge suite (second in size to the Presidential). The room was huge and beautiful. They also did all of the little things right from delivering an apple, to great shoe shines and a general attitude of "sure, we can do that" around every turn. This was our first stay after many nights at the Peninsula and we will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wisconsin Respite”
Reviews.Author: Bob1561616
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this wonderful hotel in Feburary 2012. From the time you are greeted in the diveway to the time you leave, you are treated like you are the most important person staying at this fabulous hotel. The location and rooms are excellent...immaculate and elegantly furnished. I cannot say enough about the staff of this hotel. They should all be commended and the new corporate entity should use this location as the example of how to treat guests. This hotel was rated number 1 in the country by Conde Nast last year and the staff is the reason why. We throughly enjoyed our stay and everyone should be able to enjoy this type of luxury at least once in their lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: sinbob
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most amazing hotels we have ever stayed in. From the moment you step through the door you are treated like royalty. The room was absolutely beautiful, complete with fireplace in the living room area which was beautiful. We had a balcony which allowed a great view over the city, even though the 54th floor was pretty cold in February. We would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Name Has Changed - Hope The Hotel Doesn't”
Reviews.Author: RelaxWithMax
Reviews.Content: Checked into a Premier Gold coast suite with the wife on Feb 10th 2012. - We actually checked into the Elysian and had Elysian room keys, but by the time we checked out on the 14th we were checking out of the Waldorf Astoria. - So, i guess we were amongst the last of the "Elysian Mohikans" ! We selected this hotel due to its No. 1 rating on trip advisor for Chicago hotels and we were not disappointed. As you would expect with any fine five star hotel the front of house culture and service was excellent. - What i didn't expect when researching the hotel was the relatively low room rate for their top suite compared to similar sized suite's in other major US cities. Premier Gold coast suites are lovely and have a large lounge dining area as well as spacious bedroom and bathroom. - Nice touches included the gas open fire place which we enjoyed as it was snowing outside and the balcony is also a nice touch too, we didn't use it much due to the cold, but we thought it was nice to have in our 23rd floor apartment. - Another nicety at this hotel is that you can open wondows in master bedroom if you prefer to get some fresh air in as distinct from A/C being on all the time. - Obviously, this would be nice in warmenr months. The views of lake Michigan are limited due to the other buildings blocking most of the view, so don't book here expecting lake views. Location is excellent and the best of shopping is just around the corner a brief 2 minute walk away. The hotel is situated very close to Michigan Ave. and the "Golden mile" of shops. - Plenty of restaurants and bars close to the hotel as well. The hotel has a house limo which you can use as many times as you wish on a complimentary basis, but you cannot reserve it and its first in best dressed! - That being said, it has a small radius of travel so you don't have to wait long for it if you wish to use it. First night there we ate at RIA - The signature restaurant of the hotel. - What an experience !!! - High end cooking at its finest, but you will need to book about one month prior to your stay to ensure you get in. - Do it if you love fine food and wine, you won't be disappointed ! - We had the degestation menu and asked the Sommellier to upscale us with the best wines in the house. - Unlike some degestation meals the portions are not too big so you don't get half way through and call for the stomach pump ! - The staff are very polished and knowledgable as well as being very upmarket in the manner in which they conduct themselves. Wife and i were very happy with everything and this is one of the best restaurants we have eaten in anywhere. - The dinner is an experience and an event not just a meal and this is what makes it really special. We also tried the spa and once again you will need to book in advance to try this yourself as we just scraped in booking a couple of days out. The concierge ( Al) is very proficient and helpful and assists with everything you need with a minimum amount of fuss and a maximum amount of professionalism. On this trip,so far we have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas, The Park Hyatt Washington DC and the Elysian ( Waldorf Astoria) Chicago. At the moment, i think line honors must go to the Elysian for pure "bang for bucks" and this is what i think really gives it an edge. We paid 1/3 of what we paid for our suite in the Mandarin Oriental and 20% of what we paid for our suite at the Park Hyatt in DC, but there was no compromise on service or quality. ! Shhhh, don't tell them or they miay adjust rates ! Now owned by Waldorf Astoria chain, i also was the first to receive Hilton Honors points for this hotel when i checked out on 14/2 so that was just another nice bonus. Don't know what other 5/6 Star hotels in Chicago are like, but hey,based on this experience i wouldn't bother trying to find out. - We will definately stay here on next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay with the Elysian”
Reviews.Author: Foodlover9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Elysian. The hotel and rooms are very elegant and stunningly beautiful. Even though I am rating the hotel average, there is no denying how beautiful the property is. We arrived and check in was quick and easy. The staff was very nice and welcoming. They asked what newspaper we would like to receive each morning of our stay. We asked for USA Today and were told that they do not have it so we decided on the Tribune. We stayed in a Deluxe Suite (same as our last stay) very spacious and on the 21st floor. I was going to pour us a cocktail from the mini bar and picked up a half empty bottle of tonic that was in the minibar. When I went to call the front desk to let them know, there was a partially eaten bar of chocolate that had "happy birthday" written all over it sitting next to the phone. After a night out on the town, (a very cold night) I decided I wanted to warm up and take a bath. I started to fill up the tub and noticed that it was filthy. There were little black hairs all over and it was dirty. The hotel itself is very clean but my room was not. We were also celebrating a birthday and I had let the hotel know prior to our arrival that it was a special occasion. It went completely ignored by the hotel. Considering there was a "happy birthday" chocolate bar in our room from the previous guests, I know that they do acknowledge guests birthdays. We never got a newspaper on either morning of our stay. If I am staying at a luxury hotel and paying luxury hotel prices, these oversights are not acceptable. Even though the hotel is beautiful I will not be returning. There are better hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Could Have Stayed Forever!”
Reviews.Author: Anesthetist55
Reviews.Content: Everything has already been said in reviews of this grand hotel! At every step, our expectations were exceeded! We arrived very early (7:30 a.m. due to this being the only flight from our town), and were quickly checked into a beautiful Gold Coast Suite (1402). One could not ask for more in room accomodations. The suite was large, well-laid out, with opulent marble baths, superb shower, comfy beds, convenient lighting controls, and a superb fireplace! The service by everyone was first-rate and personal. For example, Roy was happy to print boarding passes and deliver them our room the night before our departure. This is a no-tipping hotel, yet the staff outperformed our expectations each time! The spa was relaxing and first-rate! We hardly left the hotel for food, as the restaurant/room service were excellent (though not inexpensive). For example, when we ordered toast, it was not warm bread, nor burnt edges, but perfect toast. Every detail of the fruit plate, berry bowl was equally perfect! The friendly driver took us to the Art Institute of Chicago in the hotel's Lexus at a moment's notice. The hotel had booked transportation from O'Hare prior to our arrival, and that went off without any trouble (like always happens in NYC). Housekeeping was non-intrusive, and there was not a water spot or dust particle to be found (I am picky)! After looking over the negatives cited by Tripadvisor reviewers (very few, I must say), I found the elevators to be very fast, and the room service speedy and perfect. Yes, it is possible that the square footage is exaggerated, and there wasn't a towel hook by the shower. So what? Everything else more than made up for that! If you want a really extravagant stay in Chicago, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond wildest dreams ... Complete hotel utopia!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSpy
Reviews.Content: Hotel just changed from Elysian to Waldorf Astoria Chicago this month. We were worried that its reputation wouldn't carry over. Not only were the reviews accurate but the rooms were slightly discounted with a suite upgrade! No complints only rave reviews for the location, service, amenities and value.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever been to!!”
Reviews.Author: DaniWatson1010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian on our wedding night and the night after. We couldnt have started our honeymoon at a better place. I'm an interior designer and am a little snobby about hotel atmosphere. The only disappointment you have here is having to leave. I must say I am a little saddened that they were bout out by a Hilton company. It seems to take away from the exclusivity of the Elysian name but I'd still go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in Chicago sets a new high watermark for excellence.”
Reviews.Author: HughK1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 stars all the way. I travel extensively and the Elysian is as good if not better than my favorite hotels in Asia. The staff are fabulous and the service is a standout. From the greeter, front desk, gym, room service everyone was warm and responsive. My room was huge with a drawing room with open fire, double bathroom big enough to hold a ball in and bedroom to match. We had dinner in the bistro which was very well expecuted and breakfast there in the morning was just as good. The gym was modern, clean and very well equipped. My only gripe is that we only had one night!

Reviews.Title: “the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: lizzybradberryfan
Reviews.Content: The best in the world!! Just terrific service, quick room service, wonderful conceirge. The design of the hotel is so stylish and beautiful!! Pure luxury, to my oponion. I checked out today, and I really don't want to leave Chicago because I love staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf-Astoria or Elysian?”
Reviews.Author: lgaynor
Reviews.Content: This was our third time back to the Elysian. Our first night it was the Elysian and our second night it was the Waldorf-Astoria. Good news: You now get Hilton Honor points. Bad news: No one knows if the name will remain and you get Hilton Honor points. Service is still impecable and the spa is the cities best. If you love a good whirlpool, they have perhaps the best in the USA. And if you love a good rain shower, they are #1 in this category as well. Love the lap pool and pilates studio but wish they had more free weights and space for the gym. Fresh fruit abounds along with small bottles of Evian. All rooms are pretty much suites and well kept. Every convenience is available including two pull out refrigerator drawers filled with goodies along with an ice maker drawer. The bar is intimate but they pour very small drinks. Wine is your best bet. And pass on the housemade potato chips unless you want to eat several bowls. The casual restaurant is OK and could use some improvement in food quality and prices. We have yet to dine at their fine restaurant. Overall, still the best place in Chicago. No tipping policy is enforced and hope it stays that way. Service is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Service is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: MilanNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elysian for a corporate event in Chicago. Fantastic hotel with an incredible staff. From the moment you walk in the doors they cater to your every need. Very nice property - rooms are spacious, double sided fireplace, spa-like bathroom. The food for all of the events was incredible. Cannot say enough about this great hotel! Don't think twice.. Stay at this hotel when visiting Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: TLNDEAMiller
Reviews.Content: It's no surprise to hear that the Elysian is soon going to be the Waldorf Astoria of Chicago. This place is first class. Elegant, spacious rooms have wonderful extras like a fireplace, refrigerator drawer full of beverages, freezer drawer with ice, a tub & shower, and TV in the bathroom mirror. Customer service was top notch. Location was great - two Starbucks, Walgreens, Gibsons Steakhouse and other great restaurants within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “August Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKimG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our 3 year anniversary trip. The hotel was so comfortable and luxurious I now wish to emulate the decor in my own home. The view from the 19th floor was phenomenal and the service was top-notch. I now recommend this hotel to anyone I know who plans on visiting Chicago. The food in both restaurants was delicious. We had out anniversary dinner at Ria, which was a dining experience. I missed out on dining at other Chicago fine restaurants due to how easy it was to just go downstairs for a good cocktail and dinner. My husband appreciated the variety of good beer available. This hotel has earned all of the accolades it has accumulated since it opened.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: needaceilingfan
Reviews.Content: The moment you drive up to The Elysian you feel like you're visiting a home. The circle drive makes the hotel feel tucked away. Beautiful lobby, 5 star service. All the amenities without added cost. Blown away!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago and the Ritz Carlton Chicago over several years. This was my first stay at the Elysian Hotel and I was pleasantly surprised with every aspect of the hotel. I even have a free hotel voucher to stay at the Ritz Carlton in Chicago but decided to try the Elysian out and I'm glad I did. The attention to detail is superb. They currently offer free chauffeured service in brand new Lexus vehicles within 2 miles of the hotel complimentary. The staff was helpful but un-intrusive which is hard to do. It was so nice to not hear a robot voice say "it was my pleasure" a hundred times like I'm so used to hearing at Ritz Carlton locations. Instead the staff is very fresh and energetic and VERY personable. I think the Four Seasons and Ritz of Chicago are no longer the "A" game in town. Only thing I missed was turn down service. It would have been nice to walk into the room after a late night and have the ice replenished and water ready by the bed.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireWesties
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel, we were taken to Chicago for our 60th birthdays in May 2011 by our son and daughter in law and we stayed at the Elysian for 3 nights. The suite was just wonderful, by far the best we have stayed in. Loved it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any better than this!!”
Reviews.Author: Rene C
Reviews.Content: Can not think of anything that would of made this hotel any nicer. People/service was outstanding, rooms are amazing, location is perfect, house car is such a treat and overall, this was a five star experience. I can not comment on the food or spa because we did not get that experience. BOOK NOW!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves Its Number 1 Rating”
Reviews.Author: ChefJoshua
Reviews.Content: I have spent my entire life traveling on business...I am truly George Clooney in "Up In The Air" - In one year, I flew to Europe 40 times, Japan multiple times. This is a lovely hotel, the service is just amazing, as is the location. This is a great hotel for business, and for romance, and since I am here for both, what an amazing experience. It competes because of its personal, "Abu Dhabi" like service. I struggled to imagine that it could out-perform the Peninsula around the hotel, but the Elysian locks it down on infrastructure and service. Top scores from a frequent traveler - maybe the Elysian can bring the Concorde back...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The service is amazing and the rooms are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “50 th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Ann P
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful ! We celebrated our 50 th with our family ......children,spouses, and grandchildren. Servive was great....staff warm and welcoming...we were 15 , ranging in age from 10 mos to 81 years.....so enjoyed every moment. Being close to everything, plus having this beautiful hotel , made for a most memorable time !

Reviews.Title: “Room and Location Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: bebusy
Reviews.Content: My daughter recently treated us to a girls weekend at this hotel. The suite was a perfect place to relax and and yet be close enough to the action that we never missed a beat. Tremendous spa with reasonable charges for services. Great bar, house car to take you for free within a 2 mile radius of hotel- huge plus over taking a cab, and very upscale furnishings including a fireplace. There are great restaurants nearby - tons of them- and we had fun exploring Michigan Ave, Lincoln Park, took a cab to a cool, new church in the West Loop called Soul City Church, enjoyed drinks on the top of the Hancock Bldg., visited the Art Institute Impressionist exhibit and took a stroll down Lake Shore to the Lincoln Park Zoo. What a hotel and what a city!!

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: richardpeace
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to many hotels across the globe,I conclude as many this is a fantastic hotel and experience. The service is outstanding in all operations of the hotel warm welcoming yet not pushy.The room was comfortable clean warm .I had breakfast several days and the choice although limited was freshly prepared and very tasty,the spa and gym is very speacil and should not be missed outstanding facilities and one of the best massages I have had. I can not say enough positives about the Elysian...Guys you are doing a great job if you go I am certain there will be no disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for one night... we wish we could have stayed longer! The room was luxurious, clean, and spacious. The staff was wonderful and the restaurant was delicious. I could not say enough things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style and Comfort at a Price”
Reviews.Author: Mike699
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is perfectly situated in the luxury brand shopper's are of the gold cost. Near Walton, State and Rush street it is on a block with Prada, Hermes and Barney's. The hotel looks and feels brand new. The design is contemporary giving a strong aura of luxury and comfort if you are the person who dresses chic and carries an air of sophistication when you breeze through the lobby. If that person is you then this hotel is your hotel and the exceptional price point will give you everything you are looking for and more. The employees are fantastic at service and not overbearing. They are the right amount of friendly, helpful and present when you need them but not obnoxious, snooty or rude as some high end hotel service can project. Our trip was the weekend after Christmas over New Years. We stayed 3 nights over a weekend. We stayed in the Executive Suite which was appointed with a Fireplace and seating area. We did not use the spa or work out area. The biggest criticism I have about the hotel is their partnership with iPrefer loyalty program. I am a member of iPrefer and booked my stay through their program. That program indicates I should be recognized as an iPrefer member upon arrival, be offered a free upgrade to my room if the hotel has availability and also be offered something in the room welcoming me from iPrefer during my stay. NONE OF THAT HAPPENED. When I checked in the front desk clerk had no clue what I was talking about although my booking and my confirmation had IPrefer and the terms clearly stated on it. None of that was relevant to the front desk. The good: The room was well designed, spacious. Our particular room - Executive Suite - had a bar area fully appointed with sink, ice maker, refrigerator, microwave and stocked with larger size bottles of wine, alcohol and snacks. The bathroom was fantastic. Very comfortable, new and fantastic amenities. The staff outside the hotel where very attentive for door opening, cabs, directions, etc. The building, the entrance and the lobby are super chic. This is an unusually addition to my comments but the cleaning staff did a great job on the room while we were out and about. Toiletries where arranged on a was cloth, clothes and towels where hung on towel bars. Everything was very tidy ever time we returned to our room. The once a day room cleaning and in the afternoon when they do the turndown service, the room was always tidied up when we came back. The bad: The room was warm / hot in the evenings. Our stay was at the end of December and the weather was fairly mild for Chicago. We turned the air down as low as it would go and baked in our room at night. Opening a sliding door we had was the only relief but that made the noise from the street much more apparent. I would guess they add something to the air flow for scent that at first was an interesting touch. So when you walk in your room it has a nice aroma. However I did notice when we first arrived the bathroom and shower area had a slight bad odor but that went away after our first use. Not making that a big deal by any stretch but the combination of the air scent and the bathroom scent freaked me out at first but again it was fine after the first use of the shower and I actually came to enjoy the freshener scent when walking into the room. Enjoy your stay if you go to the Elysian. I highly recommend it as a destination in Chicago. For the money, we thought it was worth it. I would return if I could get some restitution with my iPefer loyalty program and the hotel management. Otherwise the price point of this hotel and the Peninsula are comparable and they are different experiences but both very good for our style and taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Plinia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with excellent service staff! Highly recommend it. When we checked in we found some cute macaroons in our room. We had a slight problem with shower pressure but this was noted and taken care of right away. Very well trained staff. Too bad I had no time to try the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lnrogers1220
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our first anniversary here in April 2011, and all I could say was "wow"! Our suite was breathtaking, the decor, the super comfortable bed, and oh the bathroom! The service was impeccable! I would highly recommend this hotel before any other in Chicago! Also, the location is awesome, walking distance from upscale shops and restraurants!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the midwest”
Reviews.Author: val8112
Reviews.Content: The other reviews pretty much cover it! Worth every penny to stay at this hotel - I can't believe hotels like the Four Seasons are charging the same amount for a room when the Elysian is so superior. The spa is so peaceful, the rooms are perfect...even the minibar bottles are properly sized!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jeff s
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Elysian on New Year's Eve and couldn't have been more pleased. We have been die hard fans of the Park Hyatt Chicago for years, but thought we would try something new this year. The Elysian did not disappoint. I made our reservation on line back in October and bought a City Experience package, which included free breakfast and $25 hotel credit. I recommend that as we made the extra charge back on breakfast alone. A few days before our arrival, I received a call from the hotel to confirm our arrival and ask if there were any special services our arrangements we needed made. He also told me that they had already upgraded us into a suite, which was a wonderful surprise. On arrival, the great service continued.....and never stopped. The entire team at the Elysian is amazing and friendly. The hotel itself is beautiful!! Our room had a full bar, fireplace, great sound system, amazing bathroom. I think every room in the hotel has a fireplace. We didn't have time to explore the spa, but the restaurants are amazing, but bring your big wallet. It's not cheap to eat and drink there, but if you can handle the price tag, it's worth it. Overall, it is a very expensive place to stay, but there were no regrets when the final bill came. This is a NO TIPPING hotel, which we found a bit odd at first. I had to verify at the front desk that it was true. At the restaurants, there is an 18% gratuity added on to everything, so no need to get out your calcluator. We did add on several more percentage points to the tip (which is allowed), as the service was well beyond 18%. We are still Park Hyatt fans and will continue to stay there as well, but the choice now will be hard as to which to pick when we are in the city. TRY THIS ONE OUT!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its no 1 Status probably one of best hotels in world”
Reviews.Author: CorkyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Great hotel from the front desk the bar fantastic Michelin star restaurant great wines somellier our suite was luxurious, ideal location, I have real trouble finding fault with this great hotel. I don't know if it's part of a group but I would go to any of these hotels if it is. The only thing is no tipping policy very strange in USA

Reviews.Title: “quite lovely”
Reviews.Author: LMK7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, first class property, centrally located for shops, lake and Michigan Ave....visited during the holiday season and it was very festive. Suite was impeccable (could just about see the lake from the balcony), enjoyed meeting my turn down room service person who had an inspiring personal story. Staff was pleasant and accommodating and seemed to love their jobs. Ate a late supper at the bar in the bistro and it was delicious. Just little disappointed with the spa, although it was well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sedonadann
Reviews.Content: While the Elysian bills itself as a 5 star luxury hotel, I encountered far too many problems with this hotel's staff to consider ever coming back. From a snippy waiter to no-show breakfast room service, this kind of service is inexcusable. I actually had to schedule a "talk" with the acting manager last Christmas in hopes improvements would be made to my stay. While the suite was small but comfortable, the view was the wall of the adjacent building. A breakfast room service never appeared but I did receive alot of apologies. I don't wish apologies - just proper service. Xmas light decorations in the courtyard slowly went out over the course of the week I stayed; never repaired. Restaurant food and presentation was excellent except the very snippy waiter ruined the meal for me and my family. Why the Elysian is rated #1 is beyound me especially when the Trump is far superior. I understand there has been a management shake-up at this hotel...maybe this will improve the service.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBobby77
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my partner and another couple to eat some specific restaurants and just be tourists, and we all stayed at the Elysian. This hotel is hands down one the best properties I've ever stayed at. The front desk staff to the doorman, everyone was genuine with their kindness and care of the guests. I really cannot say enough about the staff ALL of the staff from the maid service to even the fitness center - just stellar! There is truly an amazing culture that has been created among the hotel staff and makes a very positive impression on the guests. One of many highlights of this hotel is the fact that they don't nickel and dime you. Wi-Fi is free, fitness center is free, free water bottles in your room - everything is included in the price of your room! That drives me nuts when hotels tack on all the little fees, I love how the Elysian has you pay one price for your stay and includes everything! I wish other hotels followed in these steps! The rooms are fantastic and nicely decorated, they even upgraded us to a suite since space was available so we had a working fireplace and a huge balcony. It was the experience that all hotel stays should be. The Elysian deserves athe highest marks You are doing yourself a disservice if you do not stay here while in Chicago. P.S. bring your swimsuit if you're a swimmer - they have a really cool lap pool that is beautifully tiled. I enjoyed a morning swim each day before exploring the city!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great room, snooty front-desk service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah40Chicago
Reviews.Content: We actually live in Chicago just a few blocks away from the Elysian but had the opportunity to spend a night at the hotel. Although our room was on a low floor with a view of a brick wall, the room itself was spacious, beautifully furnished, with a very comfortable bed and superb bedding. The pool and workout area are also very nice; we didn't check out the spa. I thought the front-desk staff was a little snooty. When we got there, right around our check-in time, we were told our room wasn't yet ready and that they would come find us in the waiting area when it was. After waiting about a half hour and 10 minutes past the designated check in time, I went back to the desk to see if our room was ready, and alas, it was. So, no one ever came back to tell us that our room was ready, and I think a 5 star hotel should offer better service. The hotel itself is beautiful, however, and in a great location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “oustanding”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: Absolutely every last detail was oustanding. What more is there to say?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: TOM Z
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed two nights leading up to the Christmas holiday. When we arrived the staff was exceptionally accomodating and courteous. Our luggage arrived in the room moments after we did. The staff went out of their way to make our teeenagers feel welcome. If you enjoy first class service and amenities this hotel will not disappoint. My wife and daughter tell me the spa is top notch. A single negative came to mind......although the fitness center was very nice there are several hotels in Chicago that offer a view. If you have to think that hard to find something to pick out ..... it really does qualify as a high quality experience. We have stayed at many high end hotels and rarely have we felt as comfortable as we did at the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “Haughty and Nice”
Reviews.Author: coach56
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms. If you need information regarding where to find something, don't waste your time with the front desk or the concierge, ask someone at the door! I waited for over an hour for both to get back with me with no callback. Finally got tired of waiting and asked on of the door men who sent me in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as possible!”
Reviews.Author: popolin77
Reviews.Content: First class from the moment that you walk through the front doors! The staff is pleasant, courteous and helpful. The rooms are large with a plethera of modern amenities including two flat screen tvs, a gas fireplace, a b&o iPod speaker system and even a tv mounted within the mirror in the rest room. Only room needs improvement was a slow drain the the shower! If you haven't stayed - would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated elegance”
Reviews.Author: Irreverent
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate property and one of the very best city hotels I have ever stayed in. Sophisticated public spaces, dining options, spa facilities, and a smart bar. At least 6 months in advance, I reserved an executive suite (for me) and a king room (for my business associate) for 3 nights to coincide with a major meeting we were attending at McCormick. The staff did a first rate job of arranging in advance my wine selections for an important client dinner at Ria as well as an in suite wine tasting and buffet for another client. Bravo! The fit and finish, and attention to detail in my suite were most appreciated. Sound perfect? Why not a 5 star review? There were just enough hiccups to hold me back from giving a perfect mark to the Elysian. 1) A few weeks before arrival, I received a confirmation email for my associated but not me. When I called the hotel they had mis-dated my arrival, even though the original confirmation was correct. They made the correction immediately and I was still able to secure an Executive suite for the correct dates, but if I didn't call to check, I might have arrived at the hotel without my reserved suite or a room at all. 2) The clock in my bedroom was off (in the wrong direction) by 10 minutes. I was using it as a guide as I prepared for a business breakfast off site the first morning. We discovered the issue as I arrived in the lobby 10 minutes late, with my associate pacing nervously. We were almost tardy for our meeting and felt rushed. 3) They ran out of potato chips in the bar during the after work rush and we were provided a martini up as opposed to over the rocks as ordered. They were a bit in the weeds, as they say. 4) Balsan breakfast was a weak link. Corned beef hash with poached eggs arrived with scrambled eggs after an earlier snafu by the kitchen (the plate exploded). Around the dining room & at out tables, dirty plates were very slow to be cleared at numerous business breakfast tables. 5) Despite a very comprehensive mini bar (w/ microwave), there is no way to make hot water for morning tea or coffee in your room. You must order from room service or make it to the lobby by 8:00 am for the coffee service. I'll refrain from further nit picking. Go, stay.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Hotel in River North”
Reviews.Author: Carmen1318
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night with family. the hotel lobby is very contemporary and covered in artwork. the entire staff is very friendly and attentive. we had an executive suite, complete with a bathroom, 1 king bed bedroom, and a living room with a sofabed and flatscreen TV. the room even had a fireplace which made the room very cozy. the room was a little pricy at about $500/night, but if you utilize a lot of hotel services, bellhop, concierge, the best part is you don't have to tip because all the services are included with the price of the hotel, so feel free to take full advantage of their services.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly the best of everything”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: When you arrive, there is no doubt that this is a Luxury property. I had read the glowing reviews on this website and knew that I had to stay here. The lobby is minimalist chic and our room (or should I say suite) was fabulous, large and very comfortable. It had a lovely fireplace which unfortunately, we didnâ€™t need over the Labor Day weekend. There is a flat panel TV in living area and the bedroom and in the bathroom mirror (my favorite). Housekeeping was never seen but our room was spectacularly maintained during our stay. As is not unusual over a long holiday weekend, there were 2 wedding parties staying at the hotel during the weekend of our stay. The first night I heard booming music until the wee hours of the morning. I thought it was from some nearby club, but I was told by the front desk that it must have been the wedding reception. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast, but since we were otherwise so comfortable in our room, we declined, but thanked them for the gesture. In addition, Bernardâ€™s (that I have read so many nice things about) was closed on the last night of our stay at the hotel (Sunday) so we decided to have a nightcap at Balsan. Big mistake â€“ the service was horrible. It was only semi-crowded but it was like amateur night behind the bar. This hotel can do so much better than that. We like to blend in with the locals when we are out-of-town and this hotel makes that a very easy thing to do since it is away from Michigan Avenue but within close walking distance to all of the high-end shopping and many great restaurants. Even with the problems, I would jump at the chance to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ctinaluca
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is a superior hotel as far as luxury, comfort and location. It is discretely located in the heart of the gold coast far enough from the busyness of Michigan Ave yet close enough to walk just about anywhere. The rooms are perfectly decorated, extremely clean and literally are cozy enough to feel like home. From the fireplace to large soaking tub you can't go wrong with this hotel. Customer service was exceptional, we had room services a couple of times and we felt like the staff brought the restaurant to our room!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, outstanding restaurants, I'd still give a slight edge to the trump”
Reviews.Author: someflipster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is physically beautiful and well laid out, excellent access to courtyard from walton street. A walgreens across the street and a supermarket 1.5 blocks away are very convenient. The restaurant RIA is out of this world. Staff are highly helpful and polite. Internet speeds were outstanding, better than Trump. A few issues. The housekeeping people were often not very thorough. Perhaps this has to do with the no-tip policy? Once for turndown service they tried to just make up the bed and drop off bottles of water. As they were leaving I asked if they could put new towels in the bathroom, empty the trash cans, etc. The lady asked me "Was this room already made up today?" I said "Yes, but we've been using it since then." They skipped corners on cleaning up during regular room cleaning, too. Also the light management system is irritating. Instead of simple switches and dimmers for the lights, they put in a space age system with up to 5 buttons for all the rooms with various presets. The big problem is that pushing "all on/off" in a suite affects all lights in all rooms of the suite, bathroom, bedroom, and living room. I really hated it when I was trying to sleep in the bedroom and someone in living room hits the "all on" button. Or when bathing with the lights off or low, and someone similarly hits "all on". What is the purpose of this system? If people wanted their lights to work this way, then people would have this system in their houses. Anyway I dont want to gripe too much. An excellent stay, beautiful rooms. Overall I would still give the trump a slight edge in luxury. The kitchens at the trump are far larger and much much better appointed, no comparison. This hotel has better lighting in the rooms, though. I found it impossible to get enough light in Trump at night even with extra lights. Overall this is a great property. I liked the no-tip policy, made things easier and I dont like having to worry about managing a small bills supply all the time. A great addition to the chicago hotel scene.

Reviews.Title: “We Wish We Could Stay Longer...”
Reviews.Author: et49589
Reviews.Content: Everything was more than perfect, it was a true Paradise. The only thing I would recommend to check in clerk to be sure before surprising guests with upgrade. We were told that we were upgraded by 4 categories up when indeed it wasn't an upgrade at all, not even by one category, we stayed in the Executive Suite the exact accommodation we booked with hotel. Therefore, we didnâ€™t stay in Premier Gold Coast Suite, or even Gold Coast Suite which would have been nice to have been upgraded to. Sorry, but I always do my homework and was familiar with all rooms' pictures and layouts. I inquired about our suite 3 times if this was indeed upgrade by 4 categories up and was told yes. I only hope that the check in clerk didnâ€™t have the knowledge or perhaps innocently wasn't aware and merely read what was in the profile. In such situations, I prefer to remain silent and concentrate on all the good. Nevertheless, we were happy with the floor we stayed on, with the view which is very important to me, and I didn't tell my husband that we were not upgraded just not to spoil the momentum as one little thing like this can through you offâ€¦ The Executive suit was more than enough: specious, plenty of closets for our designer clothes - one big near the entry door and 2 individual closets across from bathroom. The bathroom was huge. The room was very clean every day. The furnishings/furniture, decor were in calm tones and all blended perfectly without any pieces outstanding the other thus creating pleasant atmosphere. I am not a picky type and never look for needle in the hey to find imperfections and instead see things beautiful and they were. The room had two true HD flat screen TV and 1 TV in the bathroom mirror, if you had stayed in new or refurbished hotels then you probably have seen TV in the mirror already, but in this hotel the picture was clear compare to other hotels we stayed in. We had gas fireplace which shots off by itself in case you foll a sleep. If you are cold at night there are down comforters in the closet. The art in the room was OK. The bathroom had good size sunken bath, separate shower with not see through glass in case some worry, nice vanity counter and sink. Marble all over. Finally comfortable bed and pillows. We loved everything about our room. Anyway, we were told if we were not happy with the view or room to let the desk know and we would be offered another room, which is incredibly nice gesture; however, we were pleasantly happy to find out that our accommodation was already held for us and had a personal touch and care put into making it especially for us. In all, our stay was beyond our expectations. Thank you for early check in, we needed it as we slept only 2 hours. Thank you for late check out as due to my disability, it took me quite longer to pack than I anticipated, plus the living area was so comfy that it made us lazy during our stay. Thank you to every door person for kindness/hospitality and addressing me by my name from the moment we arrived that's what you call service with class. Thank you Dominique in Balsam the best waiter ever, we miss you already. Thank you to (forgot name) for the greatest facial ever - Age defying facial - I am back looking great again. Starting my vacation spending 3 hours in the spa was the greatest thing I have ever done for myself and highly recommend to all, because later you will not have time for the spa. Sorry I fell asleep during facialï�Š The entire spa experience was more than 5 stars: very clean, assistance from stuff and so much more, all in all thatâ€™s how the spa should be. By the way the lap pool and pool area looks much better than on the picture. Just so happy that I finally was able to visit Chicago and stay in the hotel of such caliber. No tipping is excellent idea. Less headache and many may not realize, some people manage to drop things during tipping, happened to my mom once, she left money pouch in the taxi. The service was even better than in tipping hotels. The benefits of non tipping is refluxing, puts your mind at ease - once again great idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: 4states
Reviews.Content: Every single member of the hotel staff (excluding restaurant) we met during our stay was friendly, extremely professional and helpful. What was really impressive was the way that an individual owned a request instead of passing it off to others - e.g. when we were checking out the young lady who took the call for the luggage cart was the one who brought it to the room and helped pack the car. The hotel has a young staff who obviously take immense pride in their hotel - they always looked happy and came across as very enthusiastic. The rooms and linens were sparkling clean however the towels could have been softer / fluffier. The beds were comfortable, however one side was very well used and it won't be long before the mattress will need replacing. The elevators were small and there were only two which resulted in a very long wait at busy times. We thought the parking was good value and cheaper than a number of other hotels in the city, especially as they park the vehicles on site so they're available at a minutes notice (at other hotels it can take at least 15 minutes to get your car) The location is very good - less than 5 minutes slow walk to the best shopping on Michigan Ave, but on a quiet street with a park only a block away. Room service provided great food and it always arrived at the exact time it was ordered for. The only disappointment was the day we ate breakfast in the restaurant - the room itself was dark, tables were very very close together, and the server was unfriendly, rude and disinterested. The food was also poor compared to room service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Renffoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves the reviews it gets. The rooms are exceptional. If you have the opportunity, stay at Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: Deon46
Reviews.Content: Having read a few positive reviews on the Elysian, I decided to make reservations during a business trip to Chicago. To say I was pleasantly surprised, would do no justice to this hotel. My whole experience was an absolute pleasure. From the time I checked in I was aware of a professional but warm and friendly disposition of the staff, the very well appointed rooms, the location. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. For me this hotel offered very good value for money too; I have stayed in establishments that would charge double and still not leave me with the level of satisfaction as the Elysian has.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: cgbash
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is unbelievable. The staff is attentive, eager and polite and the accommodations are incredible. We stayed in a suite which was wonderful complete with a fireplace. 1 full bath and a powder room was fantastic for 3 people. Can't beat the location. On several occasions the staff actually turned down our tips stating, "It's my pleasure". Uh...okay...never heard that before at a hotel this nice...I'm usually out of small bills in a day or two. Had a complaint about service in one of the restaurants and they remedied it satisfactorily and immediately. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience !”
Reviews.Author: mkattan35
Reviews.Content: The best stay ever. I celebrated my Birthday stay in Chicago I can't believe that they made it the most pleasant experience ever. I think other Hotels should thrive to be like what we've experienced from outstanding service to the nice restaurants and spa services.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Robmon80
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Elysian. Great service, fantastic room, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucgevers
Reviews.Content: Very luxurous hotel, in a nice shopping area of Chicago, staff is very kind and helpful, rooms are very big and nice decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: LeonaBlack
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Elysian and it will not be the last. The property is absolutely gorgeous inside and out. The service was phenomenal. We never had to open our own doors in the lobby which speaks to the level of service they provide. They go above and beyond. They made sure to provide us with beverages and a nice note that said "Sleep Well" each night. It was the small touches that made our stay exceptional and ensured our return whenever we come back to visit Chicago. As a native of Chicago, I was very happy to find that it was central and walking distance to great restaurants, bars, and entertainment. It was a lot easier to navigate and show my husband around. It is close to Rush St, Michigan Ave, and State St which is great because that is where all of the great Shopping is! The Elysian is the standard for luxury in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: kbank66
Reviews.Content: Just finishing a quick 3 day trip to visit a friend. She recommended the Elysian and boy was she right. This is a beautiful boutique hotel in a fabulous location. I was upgraded to a corner suite which was amazing. The room is comfortable, tastefully decorated and extremely well appointed. Lots of lovely little touches that make a difference - a welcome note and macarons my first night, and a bottle of water with evening turndown service. The staff are all friendly yet professional - I was frequently addressed by name. The available car is a nice perk. While this was a short trip that I took by myself, I hope to return with my family soon. I hadn't been to Chicago in many years and would love more time to explore this great city, and then rest my head at the Elysian. I've stayed in many top-notch hotels and this ranks right up there.

Reviews.Title: “Redemption”
Reviews.Author: TeamW4
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I took our first trip to Chicago after college, we left on a lark. With no plans, no reservations, and little money, we got turned around and ended up at the Calumet City Econolodge. Nowadays, I plan better. I research more and have a few bucks, so when we returned this summer for the U2 concert, I was determined to redeem myself for that misstep years ago. I went to TripAdvisor, started with #1 and never looked further. I am now redeemed. We were extremely pleased with the Elysian. Everyone was helpful without being pretentious. The standard King room was outstanding, and the simple touches like cookies and a note for our anniversary was memorable and appreciated. The neighborhood is very walkable, with many nice restaurants within walking distance. Would gladly stay here again when in town.

Reviews.Title: “A few minor problems. Otherwise a good stay”
Reviews.Author: trip_man4
Reviews.Content: First off was not able to get into room until more than an hour after check in. Room type was changed to an ADA room. Which was fine except the shower head was a foot below my head. The shower head handle was also held together by electrical tape and kept falling down on my wife. Strange that this would not be fixed in a $700 a night room! The door staff was more than helpful as well has the house transportation. Would stay again but would likly try a few others first.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: TKUCH
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel and the service was amazing. The only issue was the expectations I had from reading some of the previous reviews. Many people talked about the complimentary upgrades if you belonged to preferred hotels (which I do). When I asked about this, they said all they could do was certain upgrades for a fee. I maybe had my expectations to high for that extra service & other little things from what I've read. I found the overall service great, especially the concierge & service staff. So take this review with a grain of salt, but I can say I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacMMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Elysian was the third hotel we stayed in during our visit to Chicago, and it made our visit special. The hotel is in a nice area. The hotel staff are beautiful people who obviously love working there, and the service was top class. Our suite was lovely, the spa and gym were terrific, and we frequented the bistro which was great too. Our first hotel was Ritz-Carlton (small room, small gym, no atmosphere, overpriced) and the second was the conference hotel which was drab but convenient for a few days...so glad we found Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “new addition to chicago luxury hotel market in great location”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago frequently and are regulars at a nearby hotel, but decided to try the Elysian this time.Very light, pretty new hotel in a great location. Short walk to highest level Chicago shopping and restaurants. Grand driveway entrance that is easy to pull in and out of - rare in that area of the city. Lobby is small and intimate compared to Peninsula or FS. We stayed in a Superior one bedroom suite with a terrace which was an upgrade. Bathroom was great, with Asprey amenities and TV behind the mirror was fun to have for morning news. Internet service was good and free. Parking is $50/ night which seemed high as it was equal to our BMW rental. Good sound system in the bedroom. We had a nice view of Hancock with partial lake view.We were told that this was one of the best views in the hotel. If that was the case both the FS ( equally good location) and even Trump ( closer to the loop) where I have stayed on prior trips have far superior/more dramatic lake/river/city views. I had booked the suite that was one room with a fireplace in the middle which definitely gives a more open feel and would recommend that room type. Spa/ gym/ locker area were excellent, pool is a one lane lap pool. Much bigger indoor pools at both the FS and Peninsula. Service is supposed to be great at this hotel. We were a a little disappointed. Two of four days we had trouble with the fireplace in the room and engineering had to come three times to fix it. The concierge was difficult to access by phone and we had to wait for them to return calls several times. They also left at 7 30 at night which was before our dinner hour made it difficult for dinner arrangements, adjustments in time, directions etc where we ended up working with the phone operator or calling for ourselves. In general they have a policy that anyone can help you with everything but that is not always the case in fact. Getting things like a plastic bag were more of a hassle than they should have been. They seem to try and want to help, but a phone operator or front desk staff is not a concierge or housekeeping. They are helpful and nice on the phone but don't always know what you want or if they have it so simple things take several calls. We went to the bar twice and the room was full. We waited 35 min for a drink and it came completely wrong ( martini instead of highball on the rocks as requested) with the waitress gushing about how great it was. After waiting so long we just paid took it and went up to the room in order to get out of a very small crowded space. Really not a great bar to bring another couple for drinks b/c on every night we were there it was difficult to seat for and get drinks. There are many nearby hotels that have great bars to host guests. Room service bkfst was fine. In the restaurant we had a very surly waitress who dropped a plate on my glasses, brought creme fraiche instead of sour cream with berries and insisted there was no sour cream in the hotel though we had it two prior days with room service and brought out 2 omeletes of 4 for the same table about five minutes apart and when asked about the others said she only had two hands. There is a great low-key neighborhood brkfst spot around the corner though - Tempo. We did not try the Michelin starred Ria b/c we were told by the concierge on the first of four nights that it would be difficult to get in between 7:45 and 9:00. We were surprised hotel guests don't have priority access to the restaurant so if you want to go, book at the time of your reservation. We requested and were told we could have a late checkout at 4:00 when we checked in. Then when we confirmed they asked if we could move it back to 3:00 b/c they had lots of other check-ins. We found this a little unusual but when we called back and asked if they could honor the original check-out time so we could shower before our flight in the room they were agreeable. We travel to Chicago frequently and may return to the Elysian b/c of the convenient location, depending on rates etc. However, there are nearby properties with much more seasoned staff, more available concierges for longer hours, easier access to restaurants etc that just seem to make things flow much more seamlessly.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in a luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelinluxury54
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Elysian for 4 fabulous days. We were indulged in every way. The staff are warm, friendly and wonderfully accommodating. The room - we were in a gorgeous suite - was very luxurious. The windows actually open so you have fresh air as opposed to the continuous din of a fan. The Balsan restaurant was really good. Very close to everything and there isn't anything more you could ask for in a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent!”
Reviews.Author: thescottvanatta
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top-notch! The rooms are beyond beautiful, the service makes you feel like royalty, and the amenities are unparalleled! They do a great job. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excels in every way”
Reviews.Author: MichelinFoodie
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago a few times a year and used to stay only at the Peninsula. I tried Four Seasons Chicago once and it was far below The Pen standards. But now I've stayed at the Elysian my last 3 visits. Rooms are incredibly spacious, beautifully appointed. The service is even more exceptional than the Peninsula. The staff is genuinely friendly and so accommodating, able to anticipate your needs. Can't find a flaw in this place, it's one of the best in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Elysian - an hotel with real style”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own at the Eysian, for a self-indulgent trip to the Windy City - and was not disappointed. From the moment the cab pulled into the lovely courtyard, to the minute that I got into the limo to drive me back to O'Hare, the Elysian experience was truly excellent. Staff are charming, friendly and incredibly helpful. The Gold Coast suite I stayed in was beautiful, with one of the best bathrooms I've seen - and huge! (I think I've owned apartments that are smaller!). The hotel facilities are also superb - the Michelin-starred restaurant, Ria, way exceeded my expectations, with again faultless service. My one criticism, and it is only tiny, is that I would have liked a coffee-maker in my room. But that was truly the only thing I can think of - and, instead, I took full advantage of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in accommodations and service”
Reviews.Author: Riper40
Reviews.Content: The Elysiian was everything we wanted and more. My business partner and I had a meeting in Chicago to attend. We chose not to stay at the host hotel but at the Elysian. OMG What a phenomenal experience. I have traveled the world and have never had such a luscious experience. T First no tipping policy was fantastic. Your not always worried about tipping every second. The rooms were beautiful and tastefully appointed. My business partner is as particular as me and we loved it. We laughed and had a great time and had some minor regrets about returning to the hectic life of husbands and children. A fantastic experience and I am returning in December. thanks Sharon

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: BethA448
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a wedding and the wedding guests stayed at Elysian. Seriously this is the most amazing, outstanding hotel. My room was so luxurious I actually wished I had more time to spend in it! I had a great living room area. The bathroom was gorgeous too with a great tub & shower & the TV in the mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and luxurious environment complemented by staff who is friendly and attentive. Staff attitude is so refreshing. All services were top shelf. "No tipping" policy seems appreciated by guests and staff alike. Coming back from an intense meeting or coming off the hustle of Chicago streets into the hotel creates the feeling of putting on your slippers and sitting down in your favorite chair! New favorite!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurenkarl
Reviews.Content: I look forward to traveling to Chicago just to stay at this hotel! The staff could not be more helpful (God forbid you have to open a door on your own) and the rooms are beyond gorgeous! I am sitting in front of the fireplace as I write this lamenting that I need to leave tomorrow :( If you can, stay here....you will not regret it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Desiree1234
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel with amazing service. The staff members are all lovely and helpful. I got there a little early because of my flight and they had a room ready right away. The staff was very helpful with suggestions and directions. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The bar area of the room has ice in a freezer so you don't have to call up every time you want ice (I love that.) Turn down service and they leave water bottles on your nightstand. While I was there for business (while my husband was home with the kids) I called him while watching TV in the bathroom mirror from the tub. He said "That really sounds like you are working hard." Haha! Great area, feels very safe for a solo traveler, easy to walk around the city. Close to lots of shops and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I would love to come back for pleasure instead of work next time and bring my husband.

Reviews.Title: “By far probably the nicest hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Owen J
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and stayed at the Elysian. It has been the best hotel experience I ever had. Everything from the room to hotel staff was better than first class. Let me start with the room. I was staying at the gold coast suite (the least expensive suite). Everything about the suite was done to the perfection from decorations to linens to accessories. Every room has fireplace (which would be great in the winter). I loved the balcony. The bathroom had to sinks, extra large soaking tub, large shower, and even a TV build into a mirror. The list of nice amenities in the room can go on and on. As far as the service, it was nothing but first class. Starting from arrival to recommendations, all the way to follow up. Everyone that I interacted at Elysian was nothing but helpful. As I was checking out I mentioned that for some odd reason the maid opened and set up a sofa bed (I was staying alone and didn't ask for it). It was not a big deal at all. Just a little oddity. The day after I checked out I received a call from one of the managers apologizing for misunderstanding. The hotel is on expensive side but experience is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great part of the city”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the lake, the neighborhood has tons of great shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is wonderfully appointed. I stayed in a Gold Coast suite which was beyond spacious complete with a fireplace, living room, bar, massive walk-in closet, huge bathroom with separate tub, and 2 TV's. The staff is warm and welcoming. The spa, pool, and gym were great. Internet is free. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: rtvg
Reviews.Content: All the excellent reviews are correct as this hotel excels in every level. My husband, 8yr old daughter and I were pleasantly upgraded to a larger suite than the one we booked and the ambience and decor of the rooms in this hotel are gorgeous! We have stayed in 5* hotels all over the world so it is a big call to say this is now our number one choice of hotels ever! From the staff who are friendly, helpful and genuinely nice to the bedlinens, bath ammenities, iphone docking station, attention to detail in the decorating...everthing they have done is top class. The hotel is also in a great location and handy to the best shopping. We have just finished a cruise on a 6* Seabourn line and I can honestly say that the staff at this hotel are a step up from the ship. My husband has badly injured his back on the ship and the hotel staff at the Elysian have been excellent with helping us with an in house doctor, Dr Richard K, who was equally professional and nice, and with all our faxing and paperwork dealing with our travel insurance. Nothing seems to be too much bother for them. Also like to thank the hotel for the special touches with our daughter, such as the freshly baked cookies and milk before bedtime. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers and cannot wait to return when we visit USA next time.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: lindsay221
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip to Chicago for his 30th birthday. I noted this when I made the hotel reservation. We arrived at The Elysian at about 9am Friday morning. Upon checking in, several members of the staff actually made it a point to say Happy Birthday to my husband. Our room was ready right away and we were told we'd been upgraded to a Deluxe Suite! One of the staff members met us at our room to show us around. All I can about the room is WOW! So gorgeous. Everything about the hotel exudes a classy, timeless quality. Our room had a huge terrace with a fantastic view of the city. The bathroom is beyond words. The bed and bedding......heaven! After being in our room about an hour, a member of the staff delivered a handwritten note and a chocolate bar from the General Manager wishing my husband a Happy Birthday. They really do think of everything here! Every member of the staff is so polite and respectful. They have a way of making you feel like you're the only guest. The location is perfect.....just a couple blocks from Michigan Ave., etc. If you're traveling within a 2 mile radius of the hotel, the hotel offers use of a complimentary Lexus.....so convenient! Overall, we had such a wonderful experience. Thank you to The Elysian for making my husband's birthday weekend so special! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: keweenawfree
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with saying that we've never stayed in a five star hotel before. We can only compare the Elysian to hotels with fewer amenities. We were looking for a hotel with a great location and one that was more than a place to sleep. This was our first ever family vacation together and we wanted it to be special and unforgettable. We looked at four star hotels and were going to book one of those. They were more in our price range yet still had adequate amenities. Then I looked at the Elysian and read through almost every review on TripAdvisor. At that point, I was hooked. This was the hotel for us. We prepaid in advance and received a substantial discount on our room (Executive Suite). I also signed up for iPrefer (iPrefer.com - free membership) in hopes of a complimentary upgrade. We arrived to the hotel quite early, but were able to drop off our luggage. We were even offered a ride to our first destination in the complimentary Lexus (it is available for trips less than 2 miles). After sightseeing for a while, we returned to the hotel to see if our room was ready. It was about an hour before normal check-in time and it was ready. We also received a complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe Suite and our luggage was already in our room. Shortly after settling ourselves in our room, the doorbell rang.
