A gentleman presented our son with a welcome treat and also presented all of us a note from the general manager of the hotel. My son already loved the hotel, but the treat sealed the deal forever. The room was fantastic. Since I heavily researched the Elysian in advance, I knew what to expect but actually being there exceeded every expectation of the rooms. The Deluxe Suite was very large with plenty of room for the three of us. I have stayed in Chicago a few times before in other hotels and did not sleep well due to outside noise. That was not an issue with this hotel. The room was nice and quiet. We were treated with respect and courtesy by the Elysian staff everywhere we went. I have to admit that I was a little nervous to stay at the Elysian since we've never stayed at a hotel of this calibur before. That nervousness was eased with every interaction with the staff. Every service-related business should strive to have employees such as those at the Elysian. They are truly special and top-notch! We ate at the Balsan one night and had room service one morning. Both meals were great and again the service was first-rate. My only regret is that we didn't eat at the hotel more often during our trip to try more of the offerings. The Elysian has so many wonderful things going for it. It deserves every accolade it has received thus far and I expect it to receive many more. Our stay was unforgettable - exactly what we had hoped. If we ever find ourselves in Chicago again, we will definitely stay at the Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chloee45
Reviews.Content: Great place! Polite, accommodating staff, very attentive !! Close to Rush St., great restaurants, jazz bars, just couple blocks from Mag Mile. Spotless rooms. I would stay here again, in a heartbeat. We had a Girls Getaway to Chicago ! Hope to bring the boys the next time!!

Reviews.Title: “The definition of luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Aleqeuo
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days in Chicago and had the pleasure of being a guest at the Elysian. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the accommodations are designed to pamper. The room had a magnificent view of downtown Chicago, was modern in a very refined way and felt very residential. The spa and fitness facility was the best I have experienced. All the equipment was state of the art and included Pilates and Gyrotonic programs. The indoor lap pool was treated with saline instead of chlorine and featured a beautifully serine lounging area. The mens locker room was unparalleled. The staff was very attentive and genuinely interested in making you comfortable in any way possible. Chicago is my favorite city and this made a fabulous trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “More like staying in a fine home than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: The moment you enter this hotel, you can tell something is different. It doesn't feel like a hotel. There is little of the lobby craziness of most hotels, and there is only a small desk. They take your luggage and provide you with at tag that states, "don't worry, we will treat your luggage like it is our own." There is an elegant European feel to everything. The staff is extremely friendly. We were fortunate to get upgraded to a small suite, which was beautifully appointed, in an elegant an contemporary style. Great fireplace to keep warm in the cold Chicago winters. During our stay, we truly felt like we were living in a condo on the Gold Coast with great service. Te mini-bar is unlike any we have seen with drawers that are refrigerated (and one that is a freezer for ice (very nice). We have stayed at both The Four Season, and The Talbott (among other downtown Chicago Hotels). This hotel is our new favorite. The perfect combination of service and quality in an outstanding location. The hotel also has a no tipping police (which staff members informed us of - or a gratuity was included and notated on the bill...in the bar for example). We tipped a few of them anyhow, but it was not expected. All in all, this is one of the finest hotels we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most functional, good food, friendly service & beautifully decorated hotel in the last two years”
Reviews.Author: Dh2100
Reviews.Content: Need to try it for once in a life time experience. Fabuloushotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Venue”
Reviews.Author: Ecojojo81
Reviews.Content: I was at the Elysian for an event and it was amazing. I didn't get to stay here overnight, but spent an evening in their Hemingway Room. It was a beautiful space with great staff. They were so friendly and helpful and really made you feel like nothing was too much trouble. The food was FANTASTIC, too. I'd love to go back and spend a weekend. Beautiful spot.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe Best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CSB_Edina
Reviews.Content: The Elysian scored on all factors for me. The staff was extraordinarily polite and helpful; the property is clean, beautiful, quiet and comfortable; the location is excellent; and the value was extraordinary (~$225 for one night). On the value side, I think my firm negotiated an exceptionally good price because we had a number of people staying there, so readers of this review should not consider my rate indicative of what they can secure. My room was extremely spacious ... a suite on the 7th floor that had a very generous sleeping area, with a small cluster of upholstered chairs and a functioning gas fireplace at the end of my bed. There was a small bar area that had cubed ice stocked in the ice freezer. The mini bar was well-stocked and not overly expensive compared to some. The bathroom was very spacious and had a cool TV in the mirror that went undisclosed when turned off. Temperature in the room was easy to adjust, and the king bed and linens were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this for business travelers and for a romantic couples weekend in the Windy City. By the way, it was refreshing that the staff would not accept tips under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago luxury advanced another notch...”
Reviews.Author: IndyGuynside
Reviews.Content: We needed a stress break from life and planned a trip to Chicago to unwind over Labor Day. Our normal stays have been at the Four Season, Ritz Carlton and Penninsula, but this time we decided to try the Elysian as it's new and based upon the reviews. The hotel exceeded our expectations by providing prompt efficient service by staff members who, while all very young, demonstrated on a routine basis that they had been very well trained. Our junior suite was exceptional with a cozy sitting room, wonderful bedroom, dressing area and large bathroom. Ammenities included a wet bar with cook top, pull out refrigerator and freezer, wonderful bathroom products, cozy robes, full strength wireless signal compliments of the in-room router antenna, and a small but adequate balcony with two chairs and a table. Two flat screen TV's, one in the bathroom mirror and a working fireplace. We both used the exercise facility which inclused Pilates equipment and new cardio and weights. The SPA was excellents as were the treatments. The only drawbacks were a bit of a lighting issue in the bathroom. The female half of the party commented that it was not make-up friendly. And, upon check-out I opted for the email invoice which I never received. We were so relaxed we carried in food one night and enjoyed excellent room service the next. Arrival and departure experience was excellent despite the hotel accommodating a large wedding party. While not an inexpensive place to stay, it is one of those properties you will remember and which was ultimately worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Urban City Retreat”
Reviews.Author: mmstravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was thoroughly impressed by: -the service and pleasant nature of all hotel staff. -the quality of the design, layouts, and details in each hotel room. AMAZING! -the super high end bathrooms - with a TV screen embedded in the bathroom mirror. -the salt water lap pool on the Spa floor. Complimentary for all guests. -location: easy walk to Lakeshore Drive for a run along the edge of the city, or Gold Coast high end shops, or a neighborhood stroll. Since returning from our stay, my colleagues and I continue to speak of our Elysian experience as exceeding all of our expectations. Elysian is planning on rolling out this hotel as a brand, so be on the lookout for their next location. Their debut in Chicago is stellar. I would recommend this hotel to people traveling for business or leisure. It will be memorable!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staycation”
Reviews.Author: pantone808
Reviews.Content: We won a 1-night stay in a Gold Coast suite. The service was outstanding the entire time, and unknowingly we were upgraded to a larger suite. On arrival we found a note w/ macaroons, since we were celebrating a birthday. Dinner & brunch at the Balsan were excellent. The spa has wonderful amenities, however the steam room has some rust stains & whirlpool/tile looked worn. Our room was stylish, but a few scuff marks, or paint touch ups needed. Lampshades were all askew, & shower didn't drain well. I would have expected a bench or handshower, and more hooks for towels. Terrace was great, but plants would help. I look forward to going back and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel. A pure pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: bosmom
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a shopping trip and stayed four nights at the Elysian. Clearly, it's an exclusive hotel and you feel that from the moment you arrive at the off-street, discreetly hidden courtyard entrance. To blend seamlessly into the picture there, and for other reasons, I recommend hiring a private car to drop you off. There were very few taxis dropping off guests. I was one of them and I quickly noticed that black Town Cars were the car of choice for Elysian guests. Also, the taxi was dirty with poor heat and bad air freshener. I had to give the driver directions to the hotel, one of the most famous in Chicago. I regretted the taxi decision on many levels. So my advice is spring for the Town Car. Once the taxi stops, two doormen whisk you out of the car with great cheer and an enthusiastic welcome. They couldn't have known my name but I somehow remember being called by name by each member of the hotel staff I encountered during my stay. The check-in was seamless and I was quickly taken to my King room, which was huge and immediately pleasing. Entering the room there's a large closet on the right with safe, robe, all the amenities. Then a wet bar with sink, glasses, treats, etc. On the left is the bathroom, quite spectacular. Beautiful marble, walk in shower, large tub and a feature I've never seen before. There's a TV in the mirror. You just lie in the tub or put your makeup on while watching CNN or a movie in the lower right-hand part of the mirror. Very cool, very trick. Also, you just have to wave the room key over a sensor to unlock the door. (You don't even have to take it out of its envelope.) None of that pushing in, pulling out, getting the dreaded red light, trying to get the timing right. The room is decorated in neutral colors, black, brown, gray, ivory. The furniture is modernist and minimalist. I wasn't entirely keen on it. I found it a little cold. Perhaps a splash of color somewhere, something fanciful would help. It was luxurious but austere. There's an enormous full length mirror in the bedroom that was splendid. It was wide and covered a good bit of the wall between the windows. An unusual pleasure. There's a fireplace, a couple of sitting chairs, a desk, an iPod deck. My iPod deck didn't work. They fixed it within 10 minutes. They left a bottle of water at turndown, very welcome, but they didn't leave a chocolate, which I missed. A small point but it seemed out of step for a luxury hotel. The bed was supremely comfortable, loads of pillows and lovely linens. The location of the hotel for downtown is perfect. A story about the level of service at the hotel: On my day of departure I returned late, rushing for the airport with far more purchased items that I had room to pack. I was in a panic. The staff jumped into action, helped me quickly condense my packing (discreetly in the lounge no less since I had checked out of my room earlier), throwing away excess packaging, finding a box, tape and so on. I did make my flight, but only because the staff helped me. It was really extraordinary. They were so efficient and so kind about it. That's a true five-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A phenomenal experience!”
Reviews.Author: wyn455
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to Chicago at the end of August for the first time and booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews we had read on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! We arrived at the hotel to find that there had been a mix up about our reservation; however, the hotel immediately apologized and upgraded us to a beautiful lake-view suite. The service at this hotel is second-to-none. From the moment you arrive in the courtyard and are greeted by the doormen to the friendly front-desk staff, to the maids who service the room, you are made to feel like a special guest. We made use of the courtesy hotel restaurant shuttle, and were assisted in making reservations for attractions and dinner reservations by the concierge. The hotel is only a couple of blocks (and within very easy walking distance) from the Water Tower Center and the other stores on Madison Avenue. Great location! The rooms are decorated in a classic modern style. The bathroom was huge, with a large shower and separate tub. The amenities were very luxurious and there was a lovely balcony overlooking the lake. If you are looking for a first-class hotel with fantastic service and great food...look no further.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: ruchan23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in his hotel from 9/03/11 thru 9/06/11 for 4 nights. My husband had been to Chicago, but I had never been to Chicago for vacation. Therefore, we had decided to visit Chicago to go to see Cubs & Reds baseball games & to do other staff. We booked this hotel, because it was ranked #1 at the Tripadvisor site. We booked a room (with 2 double beds) thru the Prefered Hotel Group. We requested early check in. We arrived at the hotel at about 10:30am. The room was nor available after lunch hour. At around 1:00pm my husband went to the front desk again to inquire if a room is available for us. My husband is a tall (6'4") guy and it seemed that the front desk lady was a little bit intimidated by him? - we don't know exactly, - but they gave us a suite (for handicapped person) - living room with fire place (above that a 42" TV) & wet bar+powder room+ patio, a bed room with 2 queen size beds & soaking bath tub & shower + behind mirror TV. We had a great time. The suite was very clean and beautiful. I like their bed linen better than Ritz Carlton Hotels where we stayed in the past. Their staff were very friendly and helpful. They declined to take any tips from us when they provide services (deliver our luggage, or deliver ice to our room or get taxi for us). Their location is great and around this hotel, many wonderful stores restaurants (and other renown hotels) are located. A Mischerin 2 star restaurant is located in this hotel. We did not have a chance to eat there this time, but we will try it when we stay in this hotel next time. We had a great time in Chicago. Main reason why we had a such a great time in Chicago is we stayed in the Elysian Hotel Chicago. We will come back to Chicago with our grand children and their parents next summer and we will definitely stay in this hotel again. Jim & Rumi L.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: slhguys
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room, stunning bathroom, comy bed, excellentiPod dock from B&W (will buy one!). Staff were very pleasant, bar was friendly though not that exciting considering there are many good palce in the neighbourhood. Its lovely to walk around the area and to come back to the hotel to relax. Breakfast room service was a little disappointing but the Brasserie was fun for late night drinks and Ria, the Michelin starred restaurant is superb - will review seperately. We will return for sure. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful new boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa35805
Reviews.Content: great little secret in chicagos' gold coast - beautiful new hotel in chicago, great restaurant too!

Reviews.Title: “So many positives!”
Reviews.Author: sassymouthsue
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We visited over the 4th of July weekend to visit friends, celebrate an anniversary and attend a concert. It was very quiet, peaceful, subdued, relaxing, and we had plenty of room. The service was unobtrusive but attentive. I splurged and got a massage with Jenny. I think it was the BEST massage I ever had. Location is great, walking distance to great restaurants, Lake Michigan, and of course Michigan Avenue shopping. We did not eat at the hotel but the concierge had great recommendations. Breakfast at Starbucks three doors down seemed more practical. We really liked the fact that you could take the car in and out without extra charges, and the complimentary rides from the hotel came in really handy. I would definitely stay again. Oh, and loved the TV in the bathroom mirror! Nice touch. I think the one improvement I would recommend is that the staff who manage the cabs and other transportation at the front of the lobby could have been more knowledgeable. As you are standing there waiting for rides, I would think it is not uncommon to strike up a conversation about activities or things to do in the area. The people staffing the area were not very conversant or able to make good suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless experience in a gorgeous atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: David U
Reviews.Content: The Elysian Hotel in Chicago is hands-down the nicest hotel I've stayed at in any US city. Unbelievable service, atmosphere and amenities. Beats a Peninsula, Ritz or Four Seasons handily. The suites are gorgeous. The service is impeccable, I mean really and truly flawless. The hotel is not a penny wise / pound foolish -- meaning that all the "small things" are free like full use of the spa, wifi, gym, etc. Gratuities are not accepted by the staff -- this sounds minor, but it's really nice to know you don't have to constantly worry about keeping small bills in your pocket and constantly tipping the staff. There is a house car that will drive you anywhere you want within a couple miles. I've stayed all over the world, I travel for business and I've never had an experience like I had at the Elysian. The Peninsula, Ritz or Four Seasons could take some lessons from The Elysian Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Lezlie M
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel! Everything is top notch. Service is impeccable. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Elaine1953
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, no pretensions but everything was new and lovely. The kids were so content with the fireplace in the living room, the terrace and TV in the bathroom mirror, that they didn't really want to leave the hotel, though it was in a fun neighborhood, close to restaurants, the lake, and walk to Millennium Park. The health club made me sad to go back to mine.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ritzcarltongirl
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Elysian at the end of August. When we got there they told me that one of the rooms for my husband and myself was being upgraded to a suite. Both rooms were really beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The hotel opened two years ago, but looked as if it just opened. The staff was amazing and helpful at every turn. On the list of great features for this hotel is that they have a hotel car and driver that you can use in lieu of cab if you are going in close radius from the hotel. We were attending a wedding and had several activities in different places all within 10 minutes of the hotel and for each of the events we were able to take advantage of the car...it is a first come, first service basis. The other extraordinary feature was that tipping was not allowed! We tried to tip everyone and no one would take it! The hotel is also in a great location for walking to sightseeing, shopping and restaurants. Chicago is a beautiful city and now has this incredible 10 star hotel! Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but not always to my taste”
Reviews.Author: PittPanther
Reviews.Content: Took a solo trip to Chicago for Labor Day Weekend and stayed in a Deluxe Suite at the Elysian. Accommodations very nice -- clean and comfortable. Lighting system a little tricky to learn, but that makes it more interesting. Staff exceedingly polite and courteous, always ready to help, but perhaps a bit too prissy and outgoing for me. But I'm not everyone. Most guests probably love that type of fawning attention. To me, it's annoying. I certainly don't expect -- or believe -- Elysian staff should change its personable ways simply because I think it should! Furniture in suite very nice and comfortable, although bed was a little too soft for me. Plenty of closet and drawer space for at least two people. Bathroom very nice with two vanities, counter and drawers, very deep soaking tub and extra-large shower stall. Also a separate powder room. Water pressure good and hot at all times of day. No type of radio in the room -- just iPod docking system which would have been nice had I brought an iPod, which I didn't. Two TVs, both 42', although only one in living room was HD. No big deal. Good selection of channels. DVD player had been set up in living room per my request prior to arrival. Comfortable couch in living room, plus an easy chair and dining table that seemed somehow misplaced (awkwardly) in corner of room. Living room area most likely not large enough to place all chairs, tables, etc..., at most proper setting. Furnished terrace/balcony was nice, but view into parking garage and fire escape of adjacent building not exactly breathtaking! Bar has a couple drinking glasses, plus wine glasses, freezer drawer with ice cubes. Mini bar fridge has little room for your own items. Don't worry; no sensor to run up your tab if you so much as look at any of the items in mini bar. Fitness room a bit disappointing for me, a workout buff. Doesn't have the weightlifting machines a serious fitness guy would appreciate. Had Sunday brunch at Balsan, and should have taken advice of earlier reviewer who warned against the French Toast. Suggestion: if you do order it, close your eyes, take a few bites, and ask yourself: 'Is this French Toast!' In any event, service and friendliness of people working there very good. Judging by majority of reviews herewith, most travelers who stay at Elysian will be delighted. I would think this place would be especially attractive and comfortable during the winter months. It does have a cozy quaintness to it. To me, overall, maybe a little too personal and charming, if that makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service-but keep in mind the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: airbear1014
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying at the hotel with our family for a wedding. Service was great-staff was awesome-love the little extras (movie night in the room, complimentary roll aways, etc). Keep in mind the state tax is 15.4% (which I believe includes the city room tax), so our rooms cost us $42.32 more per night in taxes, and the parking fee is $50.00 per night for one vehicle. In the end, our room cost us $92.32 more per night. I understand that everything costs more when you are downtown and there are lots of extras that come included with the hotel, but we were a little shocked when we got the bill. Overall a good experience and loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy2
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about the Elysian? The location is very good, the bar is a hidden gem, the restaurants incredible, the rooms spectacular, etc. The Elysian truly distinguishes itself, however, by the quality of its staff. Every single staff member we interacted with during our stay was welcoming, helpful, cheerful, knowledgeable, personable. Nothing is too much effort and everything is done with a smile! I cannot praise them highly enough! The only slightly negative thing I have to say about the Elysian is that their public areas (like the lobby and the corridors) are a little cold/clinical. However, the hospitality experienced more than makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: ccnolan
Reviews.Content: I'm completely blown away by my experience at the Elysian this weekend. My husband and I enjoyed our 5 year anniversary with our 11 month old twins, another couple and their 18 month old, as well as our babysitter and her boyfriend. The families split the Elysian Suite and I got my babysitter a standard king room. We were all so impressed with the hotel's elegance and charm, and especially by the kindness of the staff. They were always smiling and came to introduce themselves to our kids. The rooms were so comfortable and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms were expansive and modern, and my husband couldn't get over the TV in the mirror. One of the highlights of the trip was the spa. It is one of the nicest hotel spa experiences I can remember, and quite possibly the best massage I've ever had. A few above and beyond things to note. I had asked if we could get high chairs in our suite to feed the kids. Not only were there three high chairs, but it was almost as if they went out and bought brand new ones that day. They obviously had never been used, and they went out of their way to suit our needs. They also brought all of the kids stuffed animals and juice. My babysitter's boyfriend had textbooks in his room and housekeeping accidentally dropped one of his books and tore a page. They called him to apologize profusely, and he wasn't worried about it. He did proceed to ask about a place nearby where he could find a cubs hat. Later that afternoon, they delivered one to his room as an apology for the minor incident. I am ready to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Suites square footage is inaccurate”
Reviews.Author: obiecon
Reviews.Content: The service is first class and begins as soon as the door is opened for you. There was absolutely no line at reception. I mentioned that I booked my room with Perfect Escapes, which offers an early check in, late check out, and free room upgrade. Since I paid for an Executive Suite, I was upgraded to a Gold Coast Suite. The young man at reception was friendly and efficient. The Gold Coast Suite (#1401) was certainly beautiful...elegant, understated and very comfortable. I noticed, however, that while spacious, it certainly did not seem like the advertised 915 square feet. I called down to the front desk to make sure that I was indeed in a Gold Coast Suite and they assured me that I was. Since I wanted more space, I requested an upgrade to a Deluxe Suite(1124 square feet), for an extra $75. An employee came up to my room, showed me my new suite, and got me a new key card. The Deluxe Suite (#2404) was on a high floor with a furnished terrace and a lovely view. The bathroom was beautiful, but smaller than the ones I've seen in other 5 star hotels. The fireplace didn't work...a minor disappointment. Once again, however, my Deluxe suite certainly didn't seem to be the advertised square footage...1124 square feet. Later that afternoon, I realized that I had forgotten one of my prescriptions at my apt here in Chicago. Out of sheer curiosity, I also picked up my tape measure. When I returned to the hotel, I measured every space; including all closets, hallways, foyer, and the terrace. Long story short: The Deluxe Suite is 905 square feet, NOT 1124 square feet. This may seem anal, but one expects a hotel the caliber of the Elysian to have accurate statistics on each of their room types. This realization was very disappointing, and put a damper on my birthday celebration. For this reason, I am forced to give the Elysian a 3 star rating. I'm sure the inaccuracies concerning square footage are not an intentional deception on the part of the hotel, but I sincerely hope that in the near future, the Elysian will publish accurate square footage statistics on its website. Had it not been for that one fact, I would gladly have given the Elysian a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: IwaRuggerBuggerIowa
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to stay in some great hotels in my day. This is the best service I have ever experienced. From the maid service to the front desk staff, the Elysian staff are incredible. PROS - everything. The workout facilities and spa are out of this world. The brunch was exceptional (don't order the French toast). The bed is heavenly. CONS - French toast at the brunch. Honestly, other than my experience with 'French toast' everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: needwospaces
Reviews.Content: I organized a get away to the Elysian for my sister's personal shower several weeks prior to her wedding. Nine girls stayed in one of the hotel's amazing suites. Service and amenities were over the top!! Would definitely return and definitely recommend. I did ask that two DVD players be hooked up prior to our arrival as we were doing girls' night in and wanted to watch chick flixs. The players were not present when we arrived but it was a quick phone call to have it taken care of while we were out on the town. Martin at the front desk was especially helpful. Thank you to all the wonderful staff for a fabulous weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: kfreitas
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite a bit for business and have had the luxury of staying at some very nice resorts. This hotel surpassed all of those! It is absolutely stunning and the staff could not be more friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite and it was bigger than our first house. Gorgeous decorating (we even asked the front desk for a list of the wall colors and they were able to provide it), spotlessly clean, great views from our room and very accomodating staff. It took us awhile to figure out the tv in the bathroom but it was very cool once we did! The location couldn't be more perfect - central to everything. One of the nights we spent some time at the hotel bar and the bartenders were so nice and served fabulous drinks! No question that it is a splurge to stay here but it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: mcristo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with superb service Rooms are large and cosy and bathroom ditto

Reviews.Title: “A New Experience in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: QueenofitAll
Reviews.Content: SPECTACULAR! The Elysian's website accurately describes the experience that our directors and key executives encountered during their stay, "The experience of luxury should be uncompromising and unexpected, warm and welcoming, modern and fashion forward, energetic and spirited." It was truly a pleasure to experience the uniqueness of the Elysian from its wonderful hotel accommodations and meeting rooms, to its friendly, helpful and energetic staff! One individual stated that on his return to the hotel from a morning jog, one of the staff greeted him at the door with a towel and bottle of water -- what attention to details!!! When we had to make several last minute adjustments in our meeting arrangements, the catering and banquet staff graciously accommodated our requests without any hesitation or question. The Elysian experience will be hard to beat whether in Chicago or another city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Bernard02
Reviews.Content: I'd never heard of the Elysian, but found it on TripAdvisor and stayed one night with other out-of-town friends. Everyone in our group (3 couples) was impressed: good value, extremely friendly and helpful staff (we almost felt like family), terrific room, bathroom, public spaces. Small things that added to our enjoyment were no-tipping policy and free WiFi: the aggravation of those "nickel & dime" charges at many nice hotels far exceeds the actual cost, but the Elysian was perfectly stress-free. The bar prices are pretty high, but not unexpected in Downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “"Best hotel I've ever stayed in"”
Reviews.Author: gfai2000
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, service was impeccable. The rooms were huge and luxurious. The location is amazing, 2 blocks from Michigan. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was great. It was such a great hotel that I think I will be disappointed the next time I stay somewhere else. Can't wait for another trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RBNY65
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in anywhere. The flat panel television in the shower was the best surprise feature! The area is not the liveliest in town, but still close enough walking distance that you can reach major sights within 15-20 minutes. All in all, a terrific place to stay. Even on a rainy night! The only drawback was the cost of breakfast. For 2 people, a simple Eggs Benedict with potatoes and coffee ran us an unbelievable $100!

Reviews.Title: “Not much to add”
Reviews.Author: 7huskie6
Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel. Location, rooms, and most definitely the staff makes this the best in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel I have ever stayed in, by far!”
Reviews.Author: geckogirlVirginia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived in Chicago at 7Am, went to the hotel expecting to leave our bags at the desk, and they let us have our room! The staff was so gracious and friendly and not a bit pretentious, as one would expect in a hotel of this caliber. Stay there if you have a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to see a great city.”
Reviews.Author: jack b
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Chicago this is a perfect hotel for location, amenities and information. It is a hotel that fits well with the city and celebrates the urban American landscape. We flew into O'hare airport and spend over a week here. The staff had plenty of good recommendations and there were many rests as well. The beds and the view were great and the room very spacious and quiet. Will stop here next time visiting Chicago U.S.A :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Becca N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Elysian for a 'stay-cation,' we both live in Chicago. From the moment we were picked up by the car service we were swept off our feet! The Hotel is beautiful, decorated with sleek modern decor, but also comfortable. All of the employees were extremely friendly, and not at all rude or condescending. I do not believe we are normally the clientale to stay at this pricey Hotel, but they made us feel as though we belonged there just as much as the richest person in the world. I mentioned to our driver that I wanted to go somewhere for dessert after our dinner, but no places would still be open....when we arrived to our room we were greeted with Four cupcakes from Sprinkles! We also went to the Hotel bar before dinner, and I fell in love with their salty chips, and I was given a bag of chips to take home with me! And last, but not least the best surprise...after arriving back to the room after dinner, we found a bottle of white wine chilling on the living room table for us to enjoy! The hotel was filled with wonderful surprises, and the whole experience is due to the wonderfully attentative staff! I hope to go back once every year for a romantic 'stay-cation!'

Reviews.Title: “Amazing surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rg G
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending three nights there. My husband and my 5 year could not have been more pleasantly surprised. Amazing service, food and room quality. Had previously stayed at the Peninsula and this is just as great. Highly recommend for business or pleasure. Spa was amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Luxurious, and Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: jordan1031
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night and although our stay was short, it wasn't short of amazing. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff was also friendly. I loved the privacy of the circular driveway that isn't really visible from the street which makes the hotel have a Parisian feel. The room was very contemporary, spacious, and had top of the line technology like flat screen tvs and the televisions in the bathroom mirror. The view from the balcany was also great. Since our stay was so short we did not get to enjoy the many hotel amenities, however, overall our stay was great. The hotel had an older feel so I wouldn't recommend it for younger groups.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boutique in Gold Coast Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleIllinois
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star newer hotel that exhibits service excellence without pretension. Very nice large rooms and suites with fireplaces and some with balconies. Large Vegas like bathrooms with every amenity. Minimalist modern classy decor in a tucked away residential feeling building near Michigan avenue shopping and Rush St. restaurants and nightlife. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - will not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: EGDoc
Reviews.Content: This has been my 4th or 5th stay at the Elysian, both with and without kids. There are many wonderful things about this hotel, many other reviewers have documented them. To me the standout portion of the hotel is the genuine care and friendliness that you encounter whenever speaking to the hotel staff. My favorite is chatting with the Lobby Staff. They are smart, charming, witty and ready to serve. What a treat! Each time I visit it feels like home. Business or pleasure, this hotel is a must try - you'll never go back to another. I was a Park Hyatt/Swissotel client in Chicago until the Elysian opened. I will never leave...

Reviews.Title: “Is the Elysian really THAT good?”
Reviews.Author: RulyTruly
Reviews.Content: So many positive reviews of this hotel from people who have never before contributed to TripAdvisor? You canâ€™t help but wonder if theyâ€™re written by never-stay college students for $5 a pop. So is the Elysian that good? Frankly, after our May stay, I would travel back to Chicago from Australia just to revisit this hotel. We still reminisce about our 5 night stay at the Elysian - a nostalgic conversation prompted this review. Fantastic location. Despite the rigorous â€˜no-tippingâ€™ policy, the service is extraordinary: consistently uber-friendly, helpful and efficient. Door staff offer umbrellas at the suggestion of rain, jump to provide the free hotel town car service whenever possible. Restaurant staff, noting the presence of a noisy group of diners, quickly offer a table in a quiet corner. The Spa delivered the best pedicure of my life. Gym staff offer Evian water as you rack up your treadmill miles. Our Premier Gold Coast Suite was subtle and gorgeous, with excellent flat screen TVs, cosy fire-place, fabulous wardrobe space and gi-normous marble bathroom â€“ only suggestion for improvement would be outdoor furniture on the terrace. Housekeeping was perfect, the bathroom always squeaky clean. Great free wi-fi. Room service menu was a bit minimalist for my taste. After a delectable Mexican dinner at Salpicon and hilarity at Second City, we stopped by the hotel bar for a night-cap. Snug, elegant, romantically dim, with generous yet non-intrusive service we enjoyed excellent cocktails at Bernardâ€™s Bar. (The next day I unsuccessfully tried to discover the ingredients of mine on the internet â€“ I think it contained lavender?) Absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: tcufaude
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel! most ideal location. perfectly maintained. spacious rooms. well thought out floor plans. all possible amenities. clean. superb service. definitely in my top three hotels in chicago i love. if you are looking for a very quiet, discreet hotel, this is it; however, if want something with a slightly higher pulse...my other two might better suit your needs. :) however, again, it is a perfectly luxurious hotel. also, the spa is splendid as well!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JRG10003
Reviews.Content: All suites (and huge ones at that -- 1.5 bathrooms), all fireplaces, all balconies, great amenities, great fine and casual dining restaurants. I'd trade my room for my Manhattan apartment in a heartbeat. And the staff could NOT have been nicer, more helpful, more accommodating (and this in a hotel with a no tipping policy....hmmm...).

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular experience at the Elysian”
Reviews.Author: michael152
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Chicago on business. I usually stay at the W or JW Marriott in Chicago. However, I stayed at the Elysian since a collegue strongly recommended this hotel. I was not dissapointed! The Elysian exceeded my expectations. The staff, room experience and cleanliness played a role in the overall experience. I stayed in an executive suite and it offered a living space, fireplace, great bathroom and much more. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff performed an exceptional job. Bottom line, I will be staying at the Elysian hotel each time I'm in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyyDreww
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week visiting Chicago, in a deluxe suite Room 2604, in part based on the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. The Elysian lived up to those reviews and provided one of the best lodging experiences we have ever enjoyed. We have had the good fortune to stay in some of the finest hotels in our travels. Places like the St. Regis in NYC and the Saint James in Montreal. The Elysian ranks with those kind of properties but provides a contemporary environment. The hotel's features are well documented in other reviews so I won't repeat them here. The design of the rooms and the amenites are absolutely first class and the small balcony was a welcome feature. The really impressive thing about the Elysian is the hotel staff. We often read about the quality of hotel staff in reviews and it is usually hard to quantify. Not so at the Elysian. The amazing thing at this hotel is that the staff is largely young adults. The management and owners have clearly developed a training and hiring system that selects extremely well educated and personable individuals. More importantly, the hotel then trains them extensively resulting in the most friendly, helpful, and efficient staff possible. It is a rare thing these days to find an organization that values the quality of it's employees so highly. It is an old fashioned approach to success that is as important as the quality of the product. The impressive thing about the Elysian is not tv's in mirrors or the no tipping policy. The reason we would return again in a heartbeat is that the ownership and top management have a plan, a very good plan, for delivering great hospitality, in a first class physical plant, employing state of the art design, all based on a foundation of extremely well trained and selected staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. It's location is just right for a weekend trip to Chicago as it's close to the downtown loop area but also close to Lincoln Park, the Navy Pier, and the lake. It's within blocks of the Hancock Building and Michigan Avenue but not in the super touristy Water Tower Place. The hotel itself is beautiful...new but with lots of character and interesting touches. It's a modern boutique style but softer and, I think, better done than a W. The room was large and extremely comfortable with great touches and a super comfy bed. The staff was extremely gracious and upgraded us to a suite when our room wasn't ready upon our arrival (we were a bit early, around 2). And, everyone we encountered on the staff was upbeat and helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely except for morning maid service & dirty balcony”
Reviews.Author: TVH
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely and friendly. No tipping and very courteous - conceirge service was exceptional and arranged our dinner reservations, looked after mailing our parcels, arranged great baseball tickets for us; took us to the L-train and showed us how to use it (we're not from Chicago). Hotel rooms were very spacious - we had 2 bedroom suite with balconies and 2.5 baths, & 2 living/sitting rooms. Great for 2 couples to share and still have together space/time, and private time/space. 2 issues: Maid came to our door every morning at 9am, and every morning we turned her away -- rather irritating on a holiday. And 1 balcony was dirty with old food during our entire stay - even after mentioning to maid. Expensive so these 2 irritants count against value. Otherwise, near perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: TexasLizH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the most blissful vacation we have ever taken and we have the Elysian to thank for that. To start with we sent some of our clothes to the hotel via UPS in advance so we could just take carry on luggage with us. The amazing staff at the Elysian called me when our clothes arrived to let me know that a bottle of sunscreen had spilled onto a few items of clothing. But, they were quick to tell me, they had cleaned it off and had the clothes, cleaned, pressed and ready for our stay. When we arrived they were hanging in our closet. Amazing. When we arrived, the manager had left us a hand written note welcoming us to the hotel. We also received notes each day reminding us of dinner reservations, spa treatments, etc. Every note was handwritten. The staff is amazing. Apparently the hotel philosophy is that each guest should feel like an honored guest in a friend's home. So, no employee will accept tips (that is already factored into each service), and they are encouraged to connect with guests on a personal level and to try to find ways to amaze and delight the guests. They succeed at every turn. One thing they thought of is to eliminate ice machines on guest floors because they tend to be loud. Instead, each room has a bar with an ice compartment - they keep it filled with ice for you. The room service menu is like none I have ever tasted....the food comes from the same kitchen that serves their Michelin 2 star restaurant in the hotel. Especially loved the breakfast and the pasta with bolognese (sp) sauce. The spa is incredible. Great service and every treatment is a pleasure. I had my hair done 2X by Christina and all I can say is that the next time I go I may not even waste space in my luggage by taking a hair dryer. She made me look and feel like a supermodel. I could go on an on with examples of Elysian's excellence but you should experience it for yourself. Top quality sheets, towels, and comfortable furniture. Oh, and my favorite was the TV-in-the mirror in the bathroom so you can watch TV while you fix your makeup or from the bathtub. So cool. One last thing, I have stayed at 5 star hotels all around the US and some globally and the Elysian is, by far, the most luxurious with the best service of all. I love that place and can't wait to go back for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property”
Reviews.Author: wellseasoned55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian for a long holiday weekend. We were so impressed. Everything about our stay was top notch - suite, staff, location, room service. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of its top-tier ratings here”
Reviews.Author: NSIInnerloop2
Reviews.Content: Had a tremendous experience here. Everything from start to finish was seamless and exceeded expectations. I booked a discount-rate room off Jetsetter, and STILL they gave me an upgrade to a Gold Coast Suite. The room was modern, sprawling, and was full of positive surprises. First surprise, looking for the mini-bar drinks, stumbling across the very convenient refrigerated drawer instead! Next surprise, after being a bit surprised at a lack of TV in the bathroom (and mentally noting that I would call that out in my review!) I notice a remote control on the counter. After a tenative click of the power button, voila, a behind-the-mirror large (for a bathroom) TV set is hidden away! Next surprise, tried out the gym - what great service, folks bringing water to you while on the cardio machines! Then, when checking out, the person grabbing the luggage refuses a tip not only during pick-up of the bags from the room, but again when picking up the car from valet. Insanity. The only nits I can find to pick - the parking rates are very high (but in line for the area), and the new-fangled electronic switching system is a bit slow to respond sometimes (resulting in extra & confusing presses) and also they missed the boat on putting some useful centralized switches near the bed to control night-light/room lights. For the amount they invested in the electrics & automation, this seems like a strange oversight. The inclusion of a small balcony was nice, as was the fireplace. But the location rocks (mid-way betwen Gold Coast shopping and Rush Street night-life), the Concierge recommendations were appropriate and not self-serving, the on-site restaurant is awesome. My new absolutely go-to spot for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: Demi-Sec
Reviews.Content: I want to go back to Chicago just to stay at this hotel again! Pulling in to the porte-cochere, you feel a little like you've just arrived at someone's mansion in Europe. The entry and check-in staff are completely charming and adorable! (...where did they find these people?) I just love a place that gives you the impression the staff wants to make your stay the best ever, and is ever so happy to do it. And never mind the interior! The hotel website provides good representation of this, but the pictures don't communicate how pleasant it is to actually be there. It's reminiscent of a beautiful classic European hotel, but with modern amenities and no "classic odors". The lounge/bar (Bernard's Bar) is quite small, but cozy (ok, so service was the tiniest bit slow...oh and they used beef fat to fry the french fries in...just saying...). My one night there was a cold windy snowy one in Chicago, so rather than venturing out into the blustery night, I turned on the fireplace, ordered a grilled cheese with fries and a bottle of bubbly, cranked up Frank Sinatra on my iPod using their docking station stereo system, and watched the snowflakes tumbling outside the window. Wrapped the evening up with an amazing bubble bath in the huge marble bathroom. What a perfect business trip...wonder if they have any availability next week...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGMaya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a mini-honeymoon after we got married last weekend. We are from Chicago, but decided to stay local, and we're glad we did. We got the room as a special, and were upgraded as well, which made it nice. We stayed in a room on the 25th floor that had one bedroom, and a separate room that with a fireplace that led to the balcony. Chances are if you're looking at this place, you've done enough research, so just go already! Service is great, it's no tipping so even if you try to tip they won't take it, food is excellent and Ria is the same kitchen as Balsan, so quality in both. We had brunch there on a Sunday and the consistecny or service was the same . . . great. Brunch is two courses, one is a series of mini breads, scones, and muffin tops with different spread and dips, the other is your choice of a series of entrees. We went for a run one morning and were told to "enjoy our run", then when we got back, we were asked "how was our run?", and then when inside the lobby, we were greeted by a nice young lady who said she hoped we enjoyed our run and handed us each a bottle of ice cold water. Seriously, just go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: windycityart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night this week and were super impressed. We booked there because of the TripAdvisor rating and we're surpised that the hotel lived up to all the hype. The property itself is outstanding. The rooms are wonderful with great beds. No tipping is such a refreshing change. But what really sets this hotel apart from all others is the service. Every member of the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. Even though we didn't require much and we know the city we were impressed at the number of itmes a staff member went that little extra mile. For example the bellgirl gave us a tour of the suite and showed up how everything worked (never happened to us before). Lots of little touches like telling us that we could use the refirgerator for our stuff and don't worry about their stuff. I mean somehow these people have taken all the little annoyances that most hotels spring on you and made them go away. Definitely world class, five star, five diamond. I doubt that it gets any better than this.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LUXURIOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: GameOnGal
Reviews.Content: We spent several days at The Elysian, it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and fresh but the people who work there make it stand out among Chicago's top notch hotels, and it has a few! Every accomodation was made for our 1 1/2 yr old daughter which made staying there Soooo much easier than at other hotels we have visited. Valet and check in were a breeze. Our bags were about 2 minutes behind us. This place has an endless supply of fresh ice and gratis cold Evian. The rooms are luxurious and have everything you need and the linens towels and toiletries are the finest. The very best thing about this hotel though, is that they are excellent at anticipating guests needs and their timing is ALMOST perfect. I only say almost because due to a malfunction on our do not disturb bell (it kept turning back to green when we set it to red) we had a few untimely doorbell rings by turndown service and bar stock/check while our daughter was sleeping. It was fixed immediately. Ahhhh, peaceful and quiet inside and lots of action right outside the front door, we walked all over the downtown hot spots. Amazing hotel, amazing service! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel I've ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: girlfromca
Reviews.Content: Run, don't walk, to the Elysian Hotel!!! Great location, impeccable service, astonishingly beautiful and state-of-the-art hotel rooms ... the entire hotel is a work of art! I would never stay anywhere else in Chicago. In fact, I found it hard to leave our room to tour Chicago ... found it harder to check out at the end of our stay. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A celebrity in my own mind”
Reviews.Author: EAPDallas
Reviews.Content: First I would like to thank TripAdvisor and all of the reviewers for leading me to this glorious hotel. My daughter and I stayed for two nights. Our trip was booked through the hotel directly at the low price of $225/night prepaid. They obviously knew we had paid a discount rate and that did not appear to have any influence upon how we were treated. They gave me the feeling that I was a celebrity. We arrived extremely early (before noon) and were taken immediately to our room. The double queen room had more square footage than our recently sold Printer's row apartment. Clean, calming, extremely comfortable in every sense. Fabulous bathrobes, thick luxurious towels (and plenty of them). Bathroom was outstanding with the double sinks, massive shower and huge soaking tub. The bar area was incredible with the refrigerator drawers completely stocked. My first regret is my daughter is underage and therefore, we had to pass on partaking of the myriad of tasty beverages provided. Next time..... The service was excellent. Our luggage was brought to our room by this tiny darling young woman. She heaved those 75 pound suitcases onto the suitcase racks without batting an eyelash. I am sure they weighed more than she did. I was politely informed that there is a no-tipping policy at the hotel. I must say, that did surprise me. We were greeted by name every time we went in or out. I contacted the concierge both nights to get a recommendation and reservation for dinner. We enjoyed fine meals at Pelago and Rosebud Steakhouse. I would not have chosen either of these places on my own. A pink envelope containing our reservation details was slipped under our door both nights. The room was technologically stunning: lighting panels, HD TV/DVR, TV in the bathroom behind the mirror, and WiFi that worked great. Departure was a breeze. We were running late returning to the hotel to check out, so I telephoned them to gather our belongings. When we got back to the hotel we were given ice cold water (temp that day in the Windy City was 102 degrees), and informed that our bags were loaded and a cab was waiting. Wow. My second regret is leaving this hotel and moving to Hyde Park. This was a college tour for us. Huge mistake. We should have stayed right there at the Elysian where we could have continued to be pampered and treated like a Royal and sleep like a rock. It was by far the best hotel experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “We visited Chicago to celebrate my wife's birthday and had the great fortune of choosing the Elysian Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wayne09toronto
Reviews.Content: The Elysian Hotel is truly five star. From the reception to the room, we were extended every courtesy possible. In our four day stay we did not hear the word "no". The room was beautifully done, elegant and very comfortable.The no tip policy was difficult because the service was so good it was hard not to reward the staff. However, as a result we felt we were in a residence instead of a hotel and it made the experience that much more comfortable. The hotel is in the heart of Chicago- they have a house car and they will drive you within a certain radius of the hotel. Benny, the driver, was delightful and very enthusiastic and a very helpful bonus. If you truly want to pamper yourself, I recommend this worldclass hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but not quite as billed”
Reviews.Author: CSherm72
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the Elysian is a very nice hotel, and is probably the nicest (physically) that I have ever stayed in. But I am fascinated by the apparently near-unanimous glowing support from prior guests, and accounts of beyond-the-call-of-duty service, that contrast so greatly with my own experience. My wife and I have three young girls at home, and we are both working professionals. Our family is always our first priority, and we donâ€™t get too much time to ourselves. But we try to take at least one long weekend together each year. Recently, Chicago has been our destination of choiceâ€”both for our coupleâ€™s get away and for at least one trip per year with the kids. In 2009 we stayed at the Peninsula and enjoyed it very much. We have also stayed at many other hotels in the Magnificent Mile/Gold Coast/River North area. When we were planning our trip last fall, however, we read about the Elysian and, based on the excellent reviews, booked a three night stay in early November. I thought about writing a review immediately after our stay. Not to bash on the hotel, which it certainly doesnâ€™t deserve, but to give readers a different perspective and perhaps reduce expectations to a reasonable level. Unfortunately, the demands of returning to work prevented that from happening and my energy for writing the review faded. We are now planning our next trip to Chicago (this one with our children). In connection with trying to decide where to stay, I encountered more stories of the Elysianâ€™s top notch service, and I felt obligated to share my experience. Here is my story: We arrived at the hotel about midday on Thursday. Like many others, we were immediately impressed with the hotelâ€™s lobby and exterior. As I recall, there were no other guests checking in at the time. There were two employees at the desk. One was on the pone and the other was looking at her computer screen or something else on the desk. They appeared to be busy with whatever they were doing. We werenâ€™t immediately helped or acknowledged while we waited at the desk. No â€œwelcome to the Elysian, I will be right with youâ€� or similar greeting. This wasnâ€™t really a problem for us, as we werenâ€™t in any particular hurry. But I am sure many people would have been bothered by the lack of acknowledgement. After a couple of minutes, one of the employees at the desk greeted us and proceeded to check us in. When she was done with the check in process it became clear that a mistake had been made, when she showed me a confirmation for a single room rate, rather than for the suite we had booked. After a while, we discovered that someone else with my same last name had a reservation too, and this had caused some confusion. This would explain why the lady at the desk referred to my wife by someone elseâ€™s first name when she looked us up in the computer. If my wife was a more suspicious woman, I could have been in some trouble. After learning that my wifeâ€™s name was not what showed up in the reservation that she was looking at, the clerk changed my wifeâ€™s name in the computer (but this was before she discovered that she was looking at the wrong reservation). I only hope that when she discovered the mistake, she went back into the other personâ€™s reservation and changed his wifeâ€™s name back. Eventually, the desk clerk found our correct reservation and we got things straightened out. But my wife (who was 6 months pregnant) and I waited 20 to 30 minutes during this whole process. The employee was polite and apologetic enough during this time, we werenâ€™t upset, and I canâ€™t say that the service was terrible. But based on all the accolades and stories of exceptional service, this was not the start to our stay that I had expected. You would think that someone might at least have offered my pregnant wife a chair to sit in while we waited. She was fine, and was probably happy to stand after sitting on the flight and the trip to the hotel. But, in any event, the offer wasnâ€™t made. When the recheck-in process was done, the employee handed us our room keys. I noticed that our room was three to four floors below where I thought we should be, based on what I had been told prior to placing my reservation. It has been long enough since my stay at the Elysian that I do not recall for sure what the room we paid for was called. But my recollection is that we paid for a premier suite. Whatever the room was called, I had contacted the hotel to prior to booking to confirm the difference between the various levels of suites, and was informed that the suite I was booking would be on or above a certain floor. But by this point I didnâ€™t want to go through the process of checking-in for a third time, so we just went to our room. The room itself was fantastic. And in that way (size, dÃ©cor, and amenities) the Elysian lives up to the hype that has been created for it. Our view, on the other hand, was of the top of a parking garage and the back of an adjacent building. See the attached photos. As I recall, we were facing to the southeast. We wound up keeping the shades closed pretty much the whole trip. If I had it to do over again, I would have gone back down and asked for a room on a higher floor. But we were tired and hungry, and I am not usually one to complain. I deal with confrontation all day at work. The last thing I need is more confrontation on vacation. And given the cool weather, we didnâ€™t plan on using the balcony much anyway. In hindsight, however, moving to another room might have solved the fireplace issue described below, and that would have been worth the trouble. When my wife and I returned from lunch that first day, there was a tray of fruit, cheese and meat of some kind in our room, along with an envelope with my last name on it. In the envelope was a gift certificate to the hotel restaurant and a confirmation for a reservation for four for that evening. I had not made the reservation, and had no reason for a table for four. The hotel had again mistaken me for the guest with my same last name. I had to call the desk to get this straightened out, and to make sure that they had the right person linked to our room in the hotel computerâ€”so that calls and other services would be directed appropriately. Because of the misunderstanding, my wife and I were never sure if the food tray was a check-in perk, or if it was something the other guest had paid for. Eventually we ate some of the food on the tray and left it for housekeeping. The tray (with its leftover contents) was with us for the entire stay, and became sort of a joke between my wife and I. Every time we left the room we would try to make it more and more obvious that we were done with it (wadding up napkins on top of the tray, putting it on the floor, etc.), and yet the tray would always be there when we returned to the room. This didnâ€™t upset me. It was just kind of funny and, again, seemed not in keeping with the hotelâ€™s reputation. This brings me to the fire place issue I mentioned above. The fire place, along with the bathtub (which did not disappoint), was one of the main reasons that we booked our room at the Elysian. It worked fine, but almost immediately filled the room with a gas-type smell. We got used to the smell in a few minutes, but when we returned to the room, even after being gone for a couple of hours (with the fireplace off), the smell was lingering. And if the fireplace was on long enough, I started to feel a little light-headed. On our way out on the first evening of our stay, we asked a gentleman at the desk if our experience with the fireplace was normal. Based on what I had heard about service at the hotel, I was expecting him to express some concern, have someone check it out, or perhaps inquire about whether we should be moved to another room. But he was dismissive of the issue, and informed us that the fireplaces do that if they run for a significant period of time. I donâ€™t know if all of the fire paces at the Elysian have that problem, or if he didnâ€™t appreciate the significance of the smell in our room. But we did not get any benefit from the fireplace during our stay. Before booking the room, I had heard about a guest at the Elysian who had forgotten to bring a charger for her iphone. After asking the hotel where she could get one, they offered to drive her to the Apple Store in the Hotel BMW. If I recall correctly, the guest wasnâ€™t ready to go to the store yet and, before she got ready, someone from the hotel went to the Apple Store, purchased a charger for her, and brought it to her room on a little tray. It was stories like this that led me to believe that my wife and I would be staying in Nirvana when we booked our room. As coincidence would have it, I too needed something for an iphone while I was at the hotel. And because Iâ€™d heard the story mentioned above, I thought I would see if I would get the same treatment. I stopped at the concierge desk, told them what I needed, and asked what would be the best way to get to the Apple Store to get it. Cab or walk was the response I received. I love walking around in Chicago, so that was okay. But, again, not the over-the-top service that the hotel is consistently noted to have. Sometime during our stay, there was a message on our phone, indicating that I needed to call the front desk. When I did, I was informed that the hotel had forgotten to run my credit card at check-in, to cover incidental expenses (I had prepaid for the room itself). I was then told that I needed to stop by the front desk to take care of it at my convenience. At that point, I believe my wife and I were in for the evening, so I had to make a special trip downstairs to take care of the hotelâ€™s check-in oversight. I was happy to do that, and it wasnâ€™t a big inconvenience. But based on the hotelâ€™s reputation for excellent service, I would have expected someone to offer to come to my room to get my card and then bring it back, or to simply handle the matter at checkout. Other than the issues addressed above, our stay was fine. We loved the room (other than the view and fireplace), and the restaurant let us take a dessert back to our room, even though room service was either not running at that time or did not offer that dessert. My wife appreciated that. That is my story. Nothing horrible. No cause for a two-star rating, or a warning not to stay at the hotel. We just didnâ€™t experience the exceptional service that so many others seem to have. No one at the hotel knew, or at least no one referred to me by, my name other than at check-in and check-out, or seemed to go out of their way to make us feel welcome. Again, for me that was not much of a problem. Many of the differences between a four and five star hotel are lost or wasted on me. I donâ€™t mind a hotel staff that is not interactive or over-the-top polite. In fact, sometimes that can be annoying. But a more discerning guest who had my experience may perceive that as poor service for a world class hotel. The contrast between the reports of exceptional service that I have heard, and my own experience, has led me to wonder what accounts for the difference. I have come up with two possibilities. The first is simply that by random chance or dumb luck, our stay was the exception that proves the rule of outstanding service. I assume that this is the case. The other possibility is that because I received a discounted rate through hotels.com (or some similar site) I was not recognized or treated as a â€œspecial guest.â€� I have wondered whether this is something that the hotel staff is aware of through the reservation process, and either consciously or subconsciously treats â€œfull-rateâ€� guests better than those paying a discounted rate. I know that certain guests will always get the star treatment, as they should. Someone paying for the presidential suit should be treated like a president. I just wonder whether the over-the-top service described by so manyâ€”as opposed to polite greetings, opening doors, and other service youâ€™d expect from any nice hotelâ€”is reserved for higher paying guests, or ones who at least paid full room rates. I hope and expect that such is not the case. But I do imagine that Lawrence Fishburn (who we had the pleasure of riding with in the hotel elevator) received the red carpet treatment that the Elysian is apparently noted for. Whatever the reason for our experience, we had a fine stay at the Elysian, but I cannot give it an exceptional review.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elysian!”
Reviews.Author: FreqL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elysian for 1 night at I was blown away by the quality and service of this hotel. I was upgraded (despite booking a special deal) and the room was amazing. The spa was a real highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - but then it should be”
Reviews.Author: uksa
Reviews.Content: Gosh - what is there to say about a hotel where all the rooms are suites, and the mid-size suite was bigger than my house? This hotel has a huge reputation, and really does live up to it. It is luxe without being over-designed or too clever for it's own good (see my review of the Andaz on 5th Avenue, New York). My company managed to get the room rate down to $225 per night for a big group of us, and it was worth every cent. Everything really was perfect. I only wish I could afford it as a tourist on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “small city hospitality in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cocogal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and had a wonderful weekend. The double queen room was large, clean and we loved the double vanity. Staff was very friendly and always asking if we needed anything . Had a massage and the elysian pedicure which was wonderful. Spa was relaxing, quiet. We went to get a cab and was surprised when they offered us a ride in the hotel's Lexus sedan! We felt so pampered! The bar was a perfect venue for a drink before we headed out for the night .Hotel has no tipping policy, which made the helpfulness of the staff seem more genuine. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Prodigious is all I have to say”
Reviews.Author: jladamany
Reviews.Content: My hats off and much applause to the Elysian hotel and staff. I've stayed at many hotels around the world. I have one word that sums up my experience....."Prodigious"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful comfort, outstandingly enthusiastic staff”
Reviews.Author: RushfanMI
Reviews.Content: Throughout our stay we experienced outstanding service - it seemed like there were always more hotel staff around than guests, each eager to fulfill our slightest whim. We actually needed very little in the way of service, but for someone of solidly middle class background, it was always a bit of a kick to be able to look at the nearest person in hotel livery, ask for someone to bring my car around, and hear, "Right away, Mr (real name)." I had to give my name or room number less than half of the time. I was routinely offered a bottle of water, the chance to discuss restaurants and attractions, or directions to wherever we were headed. The room was large, well-appointed, and above all, comfortable. I've stayed in many suites with uncomfortable furniture, poor lighting, and thin, rough towels. The Elysian features extremely comfortable furniture, adjustable lighting that could set a mood or illuminate every part of the suite for reading, thick towels, and comfortable robes. My only token complaint was the toilet paper, which is the same stuff every hotel uses. Some day I'm going to find a hotel that decides to afford Charmin. The Water Tower area of downtown Chicago features outstanding dining (Morton's and Le Colonial were within five minutes walk) and is only a few blocks from the lakefront and the Magnificent Mile. The drive to Chinatown and the Field Museum was under fifteen minutes even in traffic, and while the parking at the Elysian was not cheap, it was absolutely hassle-free. I don't like driving around downtown Chicago, but the Elysian's convenient valet parking made it as easy as it could be. The review guidelines suggest I should say what I liked best and least. Best: the staff. If staying at the Elysian was a fair sample of being rich, I want to be rich someday. Having so many people eager to find any way whatsoever to improve my day always made me smile. Least? The TV system features premium channels and DVR capability, but the TV tuner in the bedroom was so well hidden that the remote had trouble controlling it. I consider that a very minor nitpick. Overall, as long as I could afford it, I would stay at the Elysian every time I was in Chicago. Heck, if I could afford it, I'd live there.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: Debra12006
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Chicago hotels and this was the best. Loved the staff, the rooms, the spa and the pool. They even had kids toys and floats for the kids. We can't wait to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Surprising quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hutchvol
Reviews.Content: As our taxi drove into the alcove that is the driveway and entrance to the hotel, we realized that this wasn't just any hotel. My wife and I were amazed at the quality of service and friendliness that greeted us. This same ambiance continued with the staff at the reception desk and the concierge. We stayed 3 nights at the hotel and were treated as though we were the only guests. The smiles seemed genuine and the concern for our welfare came across heartfelt. I read the reviews of this hotel before we took our trip and I thought that these reveiws must be overstating the experience of the writers. I can tell you that they are not. Below is my review of various aspects of the hotel: Location: Excellent for shopping. The hotel is just two blocks west of Michigan Ave. The only drawback is if you take the rail in from O'Hare, the closest drop off from the Blue Line (the rail that you take from O'Hare) is about 1 1/2 miles away. However, if you are familiar with the rail system, you can take the Blue Line to Jackson and then switch to the Red LIne heading north, and get off at the Chicago stop. The Chicago Transit Authority system is very easy to learn. The hotel is approximately 12 -- 14 minutes, via walking, from Lake Michigan, depending upon the lights. It is approx. 8 -- 10 minutes to Lake Shore Dr. Once to Lake Shore Dr., turn right and walk about 4 minutes to the tunnel at Chicago that takes you under Lake Shore Dr. to the lake. Every day there was a cool breeze that helped to make the jogging/walking very pleasant in July. Rooms: Truly amazing. We were upgraded (without us requesting an upgrade) to a Gold Coast Suite. The suite was very pleasant. It had a fireplace (that was turned off -- I guess for the summer), a balconcy that was very comfortable, two flat screen HD TVs, not including the one in one of the mirrors in the bathroom. The bathroom was 15' x 15' from wall to wall and included a wonderful shower with a tall shower spout for us taller guys. The thermostat was accurate (this is important to me becuase I am normally hot and can never get the temperature cold enough for me to sleep well). The A/C controls had no problem holding the temperature at 66 for our entire stay. Spa/Fitness Center: My wife enjoyed the spa. I really can't say much about that. The fitness center had plenty equipment and room to workout. The hot wet sauna was very good. The hot dry sauna could have been hotter. I say that, but becuase of the temperatures above 100 that we have been experiencing in Texas, the hot sauna felt more like my home town of Dallas and not a hot wet sauna. The swimming pool is indeed one lane. But, don't worry, if you swim after the rush hour time when the members use the facilities, you will be just fine. I went to the Fitness Center around 10 a.m. or around 1:30 p.m. and there were normally 2 or 3 other men using the machines and I was the only person swimming. The lap pool is approx. 60' so it is a little shortter than the standard 25 meter pool. They keep the temperature of the pool at 82 so the water was great! There are plenty of towels around the facility and at the pool. Food: We didn't eat at the hotel; maybe next time. Suggestions: Two extremely minor suggestions: Breath wash in the bathrooms and purchase soap dishes with an elevated base upon which to place the bar of soap. The elevated base should have tiny holes to allow the water to drain from the soap. This will keep the soap from becoming messy underneath. Summary: This hotel received a 5 Start rating. I like to stay at a hotel where I feel comforatble spending the entire day at the hotel. If the Lord allows us to come back to Chicago, we will definitely stay at the Elysian.
