It is a destination point located in a destindation city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jenmc5490
Reviews.Content: Bar far the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff is first class, always making us feel warm and welcomed. Without a doubt we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Special Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: summerKs
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service at this hotel really stands above any we have ever experienced. The hotel is elegant, tastefully decorted, clean and comfortable. The staff, as mentioned, we all service professionals and met every need. We spent three nights here for a special anniversary and enjoyed every moment of our time at the Elysian. The Spa experience was wonderful, again meeting us at the elevator with bottles of Evian water, plush robes, etc. They provided beautiful chocolate covered strawberries, rose petals and champagne (of course at an extra cost) but stylishly presented, subtely managed. Lovely, lovely. Highly recommend for any special occasion getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every respect”
Reviews.Author: NoreenKB
Reviews.Content: Everything you have read here on Trip Advisor is true; this is a wonderfully designed and managed property. The employees are all sincerely helpful, every design detail has been considered, and the room is a quiet oasis. We stayed three nights in a Gold Coast suite. I didn't realize until I was home that this was an upgrade from the executive suite we had booked. Taking in the view of the city from our balcony added to our enjoyment of Chicago. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was perhaps the nicest hotel bathroom I have encountered. I am not a bath tub person and am sometimes disappointed when hotels dedicate significant square footage to a tub and then squeeze in the shower. The shower at the Elysian was huge with great water pressure. Added touches that I appreciated were the spacious bar area with freezer for storing ice, the large, well-lit shower with notched cut-out footrest, and the spacious desk. The entire spaceâ€”and there was a lot of space--was just well thought-out. The house car was offered when I asked for a taxi my first afternoon. The friendly driver provided engaging commentary about Chicago for this first-time visitor. He also persevered in finding the correct entrance to McCormick as I hadn't realized there were so many entrances. The ride was so much more enjoyable, and luxurious, than a taxi ride would have been. Room service and dinner at Balsan were both perfect. The wait staff are friendly, helpful, and approachable, as are all staff members throughout the hotel. The employees seems to like their jobs, like each other and like engaging with guests. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Elysian and have already told many friends about this wonderful new property. My only concern is that future stays elsewhere will never be able to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: MomofFoursons
Reviews.Content: We had reserved the standard room, but were given a room upgrade upon arrival. It was an incredible room with a bedroom, living room, 1 1/2 bath, soaking tub, fireplace and balcony. We were out late for the U2 concert and there were two bottles of water waiting for us when we returned. We ran the lakeshore late the next morning and it was very hot. We weren't in the door 10 steps and had 2 bottles of water each offered to us. So different from other hotels who sit out a bottle of water and then charge you $4 for it. The no tipping policy is very much appreciated. Everyone we came in contact with was very nice and helpful. I have been ruined for all other hotels in Chicago. Just for context, we've also stayed at The Conrad, The James, Hotel 71 (Presidential Suite - phenom room, but we only got it b/c they'd given ours away, so it was a one time thing), Hilton Towers, Palmer House and a couple others. I only wish we had been able to stay longer at the Elysian. The location was great for shopping and restaurants, including many alfresco options.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: carolgb328
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opulent with excellent service. The staff go out of their way to cater to your every need (one of the members of our party spilled food on his shirt and one of the staff members ran across the street to get him a complimentary tide-to-go pen). They are also very knowledgeable about the area and were full of helpful hints about things to do and places to go. The hotel is located in an area that's convenient to many restaurants and other popular attractions. We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade to one of their posh suites and we were blown away by both the size and elegance of it. My husband especially enjoyed the tv screen located in the bathroom mirror so he could get the news while he shaved. We also enjoyed dining at the hotel restaurant for dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: wherewillitstop
Reviews.Content: We took my inlaws for their 60th birthdays to Chicago for memorial day weekend. We booked the hotel based on feedback from trip advisor and you were all right it was amazing. We have stayed in hotels all around the world and this is one of the best nothing is too much trouble and all of the staff have to be commended. We stayed in a suite and the room was spacious and well equipped I particularly loved the giant tub which i spent many a happy hour in there. We had all never been to Chicago but will go back for nothing else but the Elysian. The hotel has a level of class that outshines the larger 5 star hotels but also tries to make you feel welcome and at home at all times. Go you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL HAS IT ALL. WE LOVE IT AND WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK.”
Reviews.Author: READY2GO05
Reviews.Content: The tip is......There are no tips accepted. This is the first hotel that offers incredible service and does not accept tips. The conceirge and the entire staff takes great pride in meeting all of your needs during your stay. We really enjoyed our stay, and will be booking another trip/room soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Best of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: jerry_kelley
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I travel to Chicago frequently becuase we enjoy the Magnificent Mile area and the local restaurants & shopping. For our anniversary we decided to stay here at the Elysian Hotel ( which was our first time) instead of where we normally stay which is also very nice Top 10-15 Hotels. The service and attention to detail is Great, I travel a lot and stay in a lot of so called 4+ star hotels and very few deliver but the Elysian practices what it preaches. The Hotel desk, the greeters at the door when you leave and arrive throughout the day are all very nice touches that make the experience very enjoyable and also makes YOU feel very special. My Wife left a pair of shoes in the closet, I called and CARL DALE took the responsibility to find her shoes and send them to us Next Day FedEx...how is that for providing great service. My Wife and I will now make this our preferred choice of Hotel when staying in Downtown Chicago. Because it was our Anniversary and I am a IPrefer member I was hoping to get upgraded to a Gold Coast suite with a Terrace but my Executive suite was very nice and roomy, they were totally booked so an upgrade was not possible, I can see why they were full.....SERVICE!!! Thanks Again Elysian, See you soon....... Jerry Kelley

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MandM_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysian to celebrate our anniversary, and it was the best hotel we've ever stayed in! The staff was completely professional (as expected), and as others have mentioned, they were also completely friendly and accommodating. No trace of pretention. Normally, I would start off with â€œthe goodâ€�, but for this hotel, I have to start off with â€œthe greatâ€�: - Wonderful, helpful staff, all with a great attitude - Everyone seemed pleased with their jobs and some wouldnâ€™t even take a tip when offered. How often does that happen? - Clean, modern spacious rooms, comfortable furniture, lots of amenities â€“ our room had two big screen tvâ€™s, a microwave, wet bar, and an ice-maker - Great location, close to everything, right downtown - Recognized our anniversary (without asking) with a personalized card and bottle of bubbly. The â€œgoodâ€� - Very comfortable beds - Bathroom had a tv built into the mirror - It rained one day while we were there, and they had umbrellaâ€™s ready to go at the front door, no need to ask, no hassle. - Very quiet hotel layout with surprisingly small hallways, no bowling alley sized halls to echo noise around in. The â€œbadâ€� Well, not really bad, but less than perfect - As at least two other posters have mentioned, we also had similar issues with the service in the restaurant (breakfast in our case), and funnily enough, one of the problems was with milk for tea as well! Maybe they donâ€™t like tea drinkers? - One other thing about the restaurant was the price. While one usually expects hotel restaurants to charge a premium, it was (in my opinion) a bit over the top to pay $45 for some fruit, a bagel, and two teas. In sum, this is a wonderful hotel with a wonderful staff - youâ€™re sure to enjoy your stay there! One tip if youâ€™re taking a cab/limo in from the airport, as the hotel is relatively new, they may not have heard of it (ours hadnâ€™t) so you might want to keep the address handy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: eatdrinklaugh
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago two or three times a year. We like to vary our stays and discover "new" hotels when we visit. This practice will probably come to a halt after having been to the Elysian. Great service, location, beautiful and quiet room. I've never felt compelled to comment on any other hotel we've stayed at in the city but this hotel truly deserves all of the accolades it is receiving.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...”
Reviews.Author: hdss379
Reviews.Content: One of the better hotel experiences we've had in a long time. This is a first class hotel and we hope they open many more around the country. Service, decor, service, food, amenities, did I mention service...anyway, thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Luxury, hip, chic and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Travel_diA
Reviews.Content: My husband invited me to join him in Chicago for a few nights while he was there on business. We moved to the Elysian from the hotel where his meeting was being held, boy was I glad we did! I booked some spa treatments during his meeting time. What a beautiful place, the spa is luxurius and I really felt pampered. It certainly put me in the mood for the romantic dinner we had planned for the evening. Our room was richly appointed with large bath, soaking tub, seating area with fireplace, luxury linens, the works. We loved our stay and will certainly be back the next time I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: deedeetoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary weekend in May, and truly enjoyed the hotel, from the service to the room to the location. We do plan to return to the hotel as soon as possible. The service at the hotel was fantastic â€“ we were addressed by name, and staff was courteous and friendly without being overbearing. From the valet who took our car to the man at the front desk who upgraded us when our suite was not yet ready, to the woman who brought our luggage to us, everyone was friendly and attentive. We ordered small items from room service (coffee, dessert, etc.) several times during our stay, and it always arrived promptly and with a smile. And I agree with other travelers â€“ in the case of the hotel, the no tipping policy does take pressure off both the guest and the employee. We did eat a late dinner at Balsan, the casual restaurant, and it was the one (slightly) negative experience we had during our stay. While we found the food to be excellent, the service was very, very slow. It was a Saturday night, so the restaurant was crowded, however it took us over 90 minutes to dine on a few small plates and a couple of drinks â€“ I think the casual restaurant is a case where service would be better motivated with tips. Our room was very nice â€“ we had a Gold Coast suite. As others have mentioned, the bath was lovely, the small patio was quite nice to sit on, and the beds and linens were heavenly. The room had a separate sitting area with a nice gas fireplace, which was nice to have as we could easily entertain friends who we saw when we were in town. The location is just fantastic. As a former resident of River North, it was so refreshing to be able to stay in a hotel that is really in a neighborhood, a little away from the very busy main tourist areas. The hotel is very close to Delaware Park, a beautiful little paradise in the middle of the city. On the other hand, it is not even a block away from Oak Street and some of the best shopping and dining in the city. As I mentioned before, we really enjoyed our stay at the Elysian, and will return again. It was a perfect way to spend our anniversary weekend, and we look forward to another fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ELP98
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and terrific service. I was in Chicago during a very warm week; each time I left the hotel, I was offered chilled water. The fitness center is state of the art. It is expensive but a great treat. I hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast Golden”
Reviews.Author: FastGirl39
Reviews.Content: Booked a Gold Coast Suite for weekend to celebrate hubby's b day. Hotel upgraded our room to Deluxe Suite. I booked a package deal on Elysian's website. Beautiful rooms with fireplace, veranda and the best bathroom ever. Bed is very comfortable and room dark and quiet. Tile in the bath is mosaic and memorable. Everything you could want in a room. Staff super friendly and accommodating. A bit pricey but I like to spoil my guy. Drinks in bar were tasty and food in RiA superb. Spa was wonderful with great massages. Really enjoyed our stay here and would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Special 25th Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: HB9508
Reviews.Content: I am very picky on hotels and my family can attest. This hotel is very nice, we even though the views are not that great. The staff makes up for any thing that you wouldn't expect. They go above and beyond what I expect from service and could not believe how nice everyone was and they seemed to really mean it. Room Service was very good except they had to come back since some of the order needed fixing. Now let me tell you about the restaurant RIA in one word....... WOW!!!! Brian (their General Manager) called to make sure that all would be ready for our special 25th Anniversary Celebration and it was incredible. We were there for over 4 hours of great food and awesome service...... I cannot wait for another occasion to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and service...the perfect combination”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer61
Reviews.Content: I chose the Elysian to celebrate a milestone birthday with friends and family. I wanted this stay to be memorable and it was. We loved the elegance and spaciousness of our suite. Every staff member we had contact with made us feel welcome. The level of service at this hotel was superb. It wasn't just the fast room service or the personal attention from the concierge, but the feeling that everyone working at this property truly wanted our stay there to be one-of-a-kind.

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jbychoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this beautiful hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed their top quality service from check-in to departure. We recommend this hotel to any international traveller who wishes to experience the highest quality stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Elysian is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: onehappytraveler_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. The staff was incredible, the suite was fabulous, the bed was comfortable, even the pillows were good! The balcony gave us a great view of the city. We were very comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Suite”
Reviews.Author: mlpinzur
Reviews.Content: I just got back from one fabulous night at The Elysian hotel in Chicago. Wow, what a beautiful hotel. The driveway and entrance reminded me of the old apartment buildings in New York. I had taken the redeye and arrived very early but they were able to accommodate me and i was checked in quickly so that i could go take a nap. I stayed in a Deluxe Suite and although i really didn't need all that room, i felt pretty special. The decor is just stunning and the layout is like being in my own private apartment, even has a terrace with furniture. First class all the way!! Looking forward to my next trip back!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mollymaguire
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Elysian Hotel and it was the best hotel we have stayed at in Chicago for the past few years. We have stayed at all the 5 star hotels in Chicago but find the Elysian to be superior to all the others. It is the staff and their accommodating attitude as well as the spaciousness of the rooms that were most appealing to us. The RiA restaurant had a very nice atmosphere and the food was excellent. We will definitely stay there again on our return trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Simply elegant”
Reviews.Author: BtwBlackandWhite
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical in the raving reviews I saw at first, but I decided to give the Elysian a try. After a night, I have to admit, the reviews are absolutely accurate. They are rated No.1 for a very good reason. I'm no stranger to luxury hotels, but Elysian is just outstanding in its uniqueness and elegance. The decor in the lobby and the guest rooms definitely have the touch of old time coco chanel but modern at the same time with its cleaniness and simplicity. In the guestroom, there is nothing more you can ask for, comfortable bed, quality toiletry, and even a lint brush. One note, the marble bath tub is among the largest and deepest I have seen in non-suite guest rooms of all high-end hotels. Staff members' friendiness and attention to details are noted everywhere. Once I told them that I had a really early flight next morning, they immediately suggested morning calls and hot coffee service. At 4 in the morning, the coffee they delivered was on-time and delicious. One thing I really appreciated, they anticipated that I was getting ready in the morning, so coffee was delivered by a female staff to avoid possible awkwardness, really impressive! The only regret I have is not able to stay there for a longer time to enjoy other things it can offer.

Reviews.Title: “High End Modern Chic Meets Relaxed Environment”
Reviews.Author: MyLaurels
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Elysian several times now and we truly enjoy the environment they have created for their guests. We are both professionals and work hard running a business, so when we travel, we want to enjoy ourselves in a luxury hotel. We are willing to spend the money for a five star experience, but expect the hotel to deliver. The Elysian has lived up to their reputation. Go ahead and take a chance and try something new, you won't be disappointed. Our room on this visit (Memorial Weekend) was the Gold Coast Premier Suite which feels like a mini-apartment. The balcony is a special treat when staying at a city hotel. The room is incredibly modern, clean and has anything you could want to enjoy your holiday. They have the most comfortable beds too. The staff is accomodating, friendly, and available. Their concierge was well connected and was successful at making a reservation at one of the city's top restaurants for us with little notice and we were not forced to eat at 10pm. Room service needs a little more attention, nothing serious, but, we ordered cappuccino and croissants two mornings and each delivery was missing something pretty basic (cream or sugar). We are frequent Chicago visitors and often stay at the Michigan Avenue location hotels; Peninsula, Ritz-Carlton, and Four Seasons -- you will be just as pleased at The Elysian--Rush Street is right outside the door and only 2 blocks from all the activity of Michigan Avenue. Travelers tip to those who drive--park your car yourself across the street for $15 less per day. The hotel charges $50/per day. It pains me to post this review because the hotel still seems like a well kept secret and I don't want that to change as the word gets out--but travelers need to be as free with the compliments when they are due, as they seem to be with the criticism. We will be back again soon Mr. Robinson. Williams Party

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: greeklaw
Reviews.Content: From entrance to departure the staff, facilities and dining is simply the best Chicago has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled. Period.”
Reviews.Author: Elainova
Reviews.Content: I am proud to join the throng of rave reviewers here to give my jubillant praise. I absolutely cannot say enough positive things about my stay at the Elysian. I was here for (sadly) just one night and I was absolutely amazed by the excellence in service and quality of the hotel. Despite the fantastic things to do in this incredible city (and the weather is wonderful this time of year!) I did not want to leave the hotel. I was treated like a queen from the moment I arrived. Despite my extraordinarily early check-in (arrived at 10 am) I was notified that my room was indeed already ready and that I had also been upgraded to a suite. Amazing. The facilities are gorgeous (the photos speak for themselves.) But what truly makes the Elysian stand out as a cut above is the unparalleled service WITHOUT the pretension or phoniness. I was greeted by name at every turn and given complimentary ammenities for so much as suggesting that I liked something (My glee over the pink envelope that the room key card came in brought the front desk personnel up to my room with an armful of pink stationery for my use!) Not a SINGLE detail was overlooked. The staff helpfully and happily squeezed in a spa appointment despite the last minute request, whereupon I was treated like royalty. A friend who was passing through Chicago whose plane flight happened to be cancelled needed a place to stay for the night. When I notified the staff of the emergency situation they were wonderfully obliging, helpfully suggesting sending someone up to make up the pull out bed and send any toiletries needed since she had no luggage. The staff will make you feel right at home, and the no-tipping policy reinforces that feeling. How wonderful to get such warm and helpful service without feeling like you're having to "buy it" from them in constant cash tips. There is no question that the price tag for a night's (or a week's) stay is worth it. I urge you not to think twice about staying here. I simply cannot believe there is any place in town which can top the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experiece and service!”
Reviews.Author: meagannm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Elysian was perfect! There was a slight wait for our room upon arrival but only because they were upgrading us to a larger room. And the wait was well worth it. The room was spacious, clean, and wonderfully decorated. The service all around was amazing. We had a slight issue and were locked out on our 24th floor balcony due to a faulty door lock. We had no phone and were very lucky there were workers in an apartment balcony on the next building over. After only 20 minutes the hotel staff rescued us and were highly concerned with whether or not we were okay. Everything was fine and once we returned later that evening the staff had left us a card and a bowl of fresh fruit appologizing for the inconvience. We were highly impressed with every aspect of our stay and the Elysian is our new hotel of choice in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Most elegant and luxurious weekend celebration”
Reviews.Author: DakotaLatte
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 60th birthday weekend with a friend at the Elysian in Chicago. From the moment I walked in the lobby to time when the hotel provided driver dropped me off at the train it was an extraordinary experience. I travel a lot for business and often stay in very nice hotels in many cities in the US. The Elysian is in a whole new class for warmth, elegance, personal attention. Everytime we walked in the lobby door we were greated by name. All the staff are courteous, gracious and go out of their way to make your stay special. This is particularly notible given their strict refusal of any tips. You really feel you have hosts and that they all take pride in their hotel. We had excellent massages in the spa and used their other spa facilities several times. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food though the concierge made a fantastic recommendation for nearby restaurants and by calling ahead, made sure we had personal attention there from the chef and owner as well. It was an expensive weekend but tremendous value for the price. So often you can pay a high hotel rate and get nothing better than a boring chain hotel. This is a special event worth repeating (and saving for)

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, don't bother looking anywhere else. This is the place.”
Reviews.Author: ForrestWright
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short as you, dear reader, is probably as busy as I am. If you can afford the Elysian, stay here. It is incredible. I did my due diligence comparing the Peninsula, Ritz, Hyatt, etc. The Elysian has the best of all of these, on a manageable, intimate, discreet scale. Not only is it centrally-located with impeccably appointed rooms, but it is a place where the staff make you feel at home. No pretense. No attitude. No posturing for tips. This is the best team I've met in years and they make it their mission to give you an exceptional experience. Make sure to meet everyone you can - you never know where you'll get a great local insight. Be sure to have a drink at the hotel bar and a nibble at Balsan. My only criticism is that their gorgeous high-end restaurant Ria was a bit too fussy. Balsan seemed much more in-tune with the vibe of the hotel and what I was looking for as a guest. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “This is how a hotel should be run!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTRAVELER1013
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending one brief evening here for a business trip and found myself wanting to stay a week. From the greeting at the door, to the check-in, to the spectacular room, every detail and all levels of service were outstanding. When I happened to mention upon check-in that I had a very early morning flight the next day, the front desk person asked what time I would like a wake-up call so that I would make my 6am flight. He even suggested I call room service and let them know, so that they could deliver a proper breakfast before my 4:30am departure. All I can say is - Wow. I travel the world for business and never have I been inclined to write a review. But this is wholeheartedly deserved and earned!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Andy Hayler
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay here in May 2011, and were very impressed by the quality of the room and the excellent service throughout the stay. Staff were helpful and polite, and the hotel is well placed for shopping. The bed was especially comfortable. RIA restaurant deaerves it's two Michelin stars.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best decors and a well established hotels”
Reviews.Author: supreeth007
Reviews.Content: stayed there on a short business trip.. the decor is wonderful, great customer service truly enjoyable. Would love to go there again. Their gym, spa and swimming pool is just marvellous..... you can also get private training lessons.... great place to stay after a hard days work......

Reviews.Title: “This is the best experience I have had in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Etsms
Reviews.Content: The staff is welcoming and very attentive. Absolutely luxurious accommodations at an exceptional value. Thanks to all staff for making our five year anniversary stay one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Aus-DC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a wonderful weekend away at the Elysian. I definitely plan to go back and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and accommodations. Our new fave hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beth4165
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite this past weekend to celebrate our anniversary. The service was perfection from the men at the door greeting us at the car with open umbrellas, to the front desk staff, to the excellent service in the bar and room service, including the very friendly cleaning ladies. Our room was stunning with every detail taken into consideration. We will be raving about it to our friends for a long time. This hotel will now be our favorite for an evening get-away. We didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: Mahler10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the world's top hotels and I rate this above all of them. The hotel is simply beautiful, so elegant and understated, glamorous but comfortable. The instant you step in you know you've arrived in the big city and will be treated like royalty. My room had a working fireplace, spacious seating and vast bathroom. The spa and gym facilities are off the chart and the lap pool perfect for serious swimmers. The cozy bar and restaurant were great. I left totally refreshed and eager to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulherin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian for five nights and overall enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel. However there were some minor housekeeping issues - things not being restocked in the room. Things forgotten on the breakfast order. Whilst not a big deal still needed a call to sort. In our first room there was a problem with the tv remote which, after a visit from maintenance could not be resolved. So I asked to move to another room and the following day we were upgraded to a Gold Coast Suite, which was very spacious and tastefully furnished. We were also given a bottle of wine for our trouble. The package we booked included tickets for the theatre and breakfast. The theatre trip we enjoyed very much but unfortunately breakfast each morning was very disappointing and not the standard I would expect from a hotel of this calibre. By contrast we ate two evening meals at the hotel which were very good. The concierge was very helpful recommending and getting us a table at Gibson's an excellent steakhouse, just a couple of minuets walk from the hotel.He also booked a river cruise which we really enjoyed.On the day of our flight home the reception staff were very helpful in organising a late check out for us, which we appreciated. The Elysian is a stylish hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: miccar3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at the Elysian three times so far and I can't say enough about it... Pristine hotel room, great amenities, AMAZING staff, prime location right off the mag mile... The only con I can think of (and this is a stretch) is that I was a little disappointed by the pool (primarily used for laps/exercise). But that's it! Had an INCREDIBLE time and will definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lisjoseph
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago alot and have always stayed at various hotels...the Elysian has become my favorite hotel in the City. Its new, clean, quiet and the service is unmatched. Great restaurants on site and perfect location - near Rush street....def rated #1 hotel in chicago for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Really without fault - ideal Chicago destination”
Reviews.Author: OBRZR
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Chicago on honeymoon and felt compelled to write a review here, so good was our experience. From the moment we stepped out of our cab on arrival right up to our departure, we received the highest levels of customer service and experience - smiling enthusiasm would be the best description. Whether in the bar, restaurant or spa, every member of staff seemed to know we were on honeymoon and made a point of congratulating us. We stayed in a junior suite, which was extremely spacious and immaculately designed. Very clean and elegant yet also cosy. The location of the hotel itself is excellent, two minutes from the magnificent mile and the John Hancock Tower and super restaurants around the corner. There is a wide choice of high-end hotels to choose from in Chicago. However, while many will focus on the needs of the business traveller, the Elysian is clearly focussed on the overall experience of the traveller. Luxurious. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds your expectations! for a GREAT price!”
Reviews.Author: trustedtraveler82
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, customer service is unmatchable, and the rooms were SO luxurious and the room was so affordable! For the price you are getting much more than any other hotel offers. Room service food was DELICIOUS! THey were so accommodating to our requests. I have traveled all over the world and stayed in many, many nice hotels around the world...in the nicest of destinations. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and its reasonable prices make it the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Klb022
Reviews.Content: Since we live in the suburbs we treat ourselves to several luxury weekends a year in the city. Having spent time at the Four Seasons,the Ritz Carlton, the Peninsula ,the Park Hyatt and others I can now say the Elysian outshines them all. We were upgraded to a suite upon our early arrival.The accommodations are luxurious -from the mirror in the bathroom that magically turns into a tv , to the ipod dock, to the oversized thick towels to the very comfortable bed. We recieved a happy Mothers Day loaf of bread and some delicious cookies for our anniversary. Their no tipping policy means just that- the valet cheerfully refused out tip and the waiter at the restaurant returned the cash we had left with our bill to slighty increase the added 18% gratuity. Rain wwas no problem as an umbrella was provided in our room. Service was always cheerful and excellent including at the wonderful spa within the hotel.My pet peeve of paying for wireless room Internet at an expensive hotel did not exist here-free wireless everywhere. You must stay here - worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute world gem”
Reviews.Author: firstclassflyer007
Reviews.Content: there is no words to describe how wonderful is the elysian , first time in chicago we feel in love with the city thanks to this hotel, we ve stay in executive suite big enough , with perfect fire burning, two lcd 47 inch , premium english king size bed with italian filli doro linens,absolut incredible mini wet bar, undercabinet refrigerator and freezer , first class!! micro oven, and a free gift french champagne with macarrons. bath with asprey toiletries separate tub and shower and of course all in white marble exquisite !!! perfect brekfast , all local and natural merchandise , cofee , milk, cheeses ,bread jam etc with no preservatives at all. and last the 2 house car to go around 5 miles , complementary !!! All is first class , no dubts one of the best hotels in the world

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: liaobuqi
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful hotel. Great location, amazing and perfectly designed rooms. Incredible, friendly and knowledgeable staff. This hotel does everything right. My girlfriend and I stayed there for the night before the Bears playoff game against the Seahawks. it was a bit of a stay-cation but was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: jbubly6
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of lovely hotels, and I'd have to say that this experience takes the cake. The hotel itself is lovely -- modern, understated, elegant. The staff couldn't wait to help us. Every one of them had a permanent smile on their face. The concierges were wonderful. Our room was gorgeous and enormous -- 1200 square feet! We felt completely pampered! The spa was outstanding as well. Loved the lap pool with mosaic on the bottom- incredibly 'zen' and refreshing! The pool room is set up like a solarium with lots of windows on walls and ceiling. Be sure you check out the 'waiting room' for your spa service - super nice, especially the snacks on individual spoons!

Reviews.Title: “Everything about my experience exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: kim5602
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at the Elysian. I enjoyed every aspect of this beautiful hotel. It is beautifully modern and elegantly decorated, the private rooms as gorgeous as the common areas. The people who work at this hotel are professional, friendly and efficient and there are always plenty of people available to answer a question or solve a problem. They are so pleasant to deal with, so interested and engaged. An all around delightful place to feel pampered and comfortable with an amazing city full of excitement right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel,first class food ,service and staff. A true 5 star Chicago gem”
Reviews.Author: Sue8888
Reviews.Content: The Balsan restaurant,excellent food and service,a great plce to meet for a cocktail and food.The RIA for a gourmet for a 2 star Michelin experience.Fabulous rooms with great friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abmilw
Reviews.Content: suite rooms are great: actually separted by walls and doors, not like other hotels. 2 tv's, fireplace and 1.5 bathrooms. staff is very friendly. great location - right off Michigan Avenue. Nice oasis in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: bumonvacation
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and the people are so friendly. The "no tipping" policy was strange to me at first but absolutely refreshing. The rooms are spectactular. The front desk actually apologized for not upgrading my room. This was not necessary since the room was more than adequate. The staff were warm and friendly. They were not pretentious at all. I plan to stay here every time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “It really is that good!”
Reviews.Author: LJK198
Reviews.Content: Have just spent the last 8 days here. Perfect location within a short walk of the Golden mile, the lake and Millenium Park. Rooms are fantastic and made very good use of the fire. Gym and spa lovely although if you want to swim go early in the morning as pool can get a bit crowded in the afternoon. Staff really friendly and Concierge desk very efficient. Very nice to have a no tipping policy as it certainly avoids awkward situations. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: BeforeSunrise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian for a quick anniversary trip and were delighted at every moment of our stay. To start, the service is second to none. Every where we turned, someone was offering to help in a genuine way. There was zero pretentiousness that you often find at hotels of this quality. Then, the room itself...wow! We stayed in a Gold Coast Suite and were swimming in decadence - large/separate living room with a fireplace and balcony, king bed, chaise lounge, iPad docking station, gigantic deep tub, fantastic lighting in the bathroom, personal full wet-bar, macaroon treats with the turn-down service, and I'm sure I'm missing highlighting many of the hundreds of details in the room. We both enjoyed the spa - my husband partook in the whirlpool/sauna/steam room and swam in their lap pool while I luxuriated with a massage. The location was in a safe area, just steps from high-end shopping and just a short walk to the subway. Our stay at the Elysian Hotel will be hard to top...until we return back and are in their care again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and superior service - 5-stars!”
Reviews.Author: gfruchtman
Reviews.Content: This French Chateau inspired hotel is just blocks off of Michigan Avenue. Great greetings from the time you pull into the courtyard drive. This is a "no-tipping" hotel which is really refreshing. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk is cheerful and professional. Not "too much" nor "too little" attention - professional and perfect for this level hotel. The rooms are beautiful and most have fireplaces. We did not have time to enjoy the spa, but hear that it is first rate as well. The bar was cozy and friendly - and again, excellent service. Try the potato chips that they serve. I don't even like chips, but I do like these! This hotel is very well located just off Michgan Avenue's "Miracle Mile" - an easy walk. Overall, when you arrive, you know that you are in a well run hotel that you will likely return over and over.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: olneymd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysian for 4 nights in April/2011. We were treated royally from the time we checked in until the time we left. We were upgraded to a suite with in room breakfest included. The room was spectacular with 3 TVs, 4 telephones, a balcony and more room than we needed. The spa was great and breakfast each day in the room was terrific. Everyone at the hotel seems totally dedicated to making your stay a wonderful experience from the desk clerks to the wonderful concierges (thank you Timo and Mark.). The hotel has a non-tipping policy which is interesting, but doesn't in any way detract from the service. A true 5 star experience - we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Cloak291
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and fabulous room. Used the spa. Kate was exceptional. Spa service was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: AWashington
Reviews.Content: I, like many others who have reviewed before me, am a picky traveller. The Elysian produced an experience BEYOND compare. The facilities are incomparable. But the staff really makes The Elysian as amazing as it is. My experience was "made" because of their hard work. It's not easy to staff an entire hotel with *happy* employees who love what they do and are willing to go the extra mile to make each person's experience a perfect one. Kudos to you all! And, as far as the review goes-- you have to see it to believe it. All that you read is true-- TVs in the bathroom mirror, plunge tub, terraces, fireplaces. I had my first single diner experience at 2* RIA. The food, staff, everything was fantastic. Again, entirely congruous with the hotel's standards and philosophy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ed_conwayCornvilleAZ
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 days. Service was exellent. Dined in Balsam which was very good. One spa session which was also very good. I would recommend this for business travellers and for people on vacation as it's a good location for shopping, dining and other Chicago attractions...

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maryann51
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many lovely hotels and this was one of the best. The suite was so comfortable and tastefully furnished. All rooms were nice and large with plenty of drawers and closet space. Our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute, unequivocal perfection.”
Reviews.Author: lbh2315
Reviews.Content: 2 1/2 hour delay into O'Hare. 1 1/2 hour trip in-bound on the Kennedy. Pure bliss upon arrival at the Elysian. Simply stated, one of my favorite hotels in the world. Service is wonderful. The suite was just that - sweet. Bathroom in the foyer is a nice touch, but the master bedroom bathroom is a sight to behold. The TV in the mirror is the kicker. I could go on and on, but let me say this - I travel all over and am very picky about hotels (very much a hotel snob) and this is one of the only hotels I have ever stayed at where I could find not a thing to quip about. I have found a new second home in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Picky traveler loved the Elysian.”
Reviews.Author: kimmi91
Reviews.Content: Love that you are acknowledged at this hotel. You never stand around waiting for someone to help you. Very friendly, not snobby. We have checked into hotels and gone to the room and immediately checked out. This hotel was very clean and the suites are good size. Bar was not exactly hopping but if your looking to relax and have a drink before bed, it's fine. Location was great for shopping and dining. If you like LuLuLemon or Barney's its right out the door. Also this hotel was quiet at night. When they bring your bags up they tell you this hotel does not allow tipping. Which is nice to not be looking for smaller bills when room service comes or they bring your car, but they add a percentage to your room service.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: pavlovsdawg
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is thoughtful. The lobby is large and clean with great modern art. Rooms are INCREDIBLE! Plush bed, Bowers & Wilkins iPod dock, fireplace in nearly every room, huge soaking tub, tv in mirror in bathroom, shower and tub separate, refrigerator separate from minibar, wet bar, great views. If you can think of it, it's probably set up here. Staff is incredibly friendly and the no tipping policy is great.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay with world class staff”
Reviews.Author: africajourneyman
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is perhaps the best hotel we have stayed in. We booked two nights in a suite on a special deal, still pricey but well worth it for a special treat. The staff were wonderful right from the moment we arrived, greeting us by name, dealing with all our bags and generally being incredibly professional and helpful whilst not being overbearing and maintaining a relaxed atmosphere. We've never experienced such wondeful service. The rooms were fabulous - beautifully decorated, unpretentious but very classy. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the bathroom huge and perhaps coolest of all an HD TV in the bathroom mirror! We didnt' eat in the hotel but found great places within a ten minute walk - Yolk for brunch, Pizzanos for Chicago style pizza, and then the John Hancock building so close by, along with all the shops of Michigan Avenue. Chicago is a brilliant city, with much of what New York and London have to offer, but much calmer and more relaxing and the Elysian reflected that. This hotel is one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ketchtwenty2
Reviews.Content: I need to stay in the West suburbs of Chicago for work. I have stayed at most of the major hotels in the Lisle/Downers Grove/Lombard area and this one is my new favorite. It has been beautifully updated and is very modern. You can still smell the new carpet. The rooms were very nicely appointed with a small fridge and a safe. I stayed in room 332. The pool and the gym looked very nice. I had dinner at the restaurant and it was a very nice meal. Great bed. Quiet. I will be back. The wireless and wired internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Competitive with Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel. A misunderstanding with reservations regarding room selection was promptly addressed to our satisfaction. This made an excellent first impression. The rooms were residential in feel. It was very nice to have access to a refrigerator and freezer stocked with ice. The bathroom had a large tub that allowed you to stretch out. The bed was comfortable! The technology is fantastic. You don't feel the "nickel and dime" attitude that you get in some hotels. I love the no-tipping policy. I find excessive charges for internet extremely annoying (often incompatible with Apple products), but The Elysian has a wide-open network that works flawlessly and does not cost a penny. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RCKWD
Reviews.Content: Best hotel stay in Chicago. The staff from the front desk to the door is the best. Spa is staffed with knowledgeable and very helpful people. The room was beyond all my expectations and the most quiet room I've ever stayed in.. Can't go wrong with the Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “The best experience in the best Hotel, Period!”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: I have a special place in my heart for this hotel. The staff was the greatest I have yet to encounter. There are no words nor description I can create to give you an idea of how amazing this place is. If you have the opportunity to stay here, do it. Make sure you eat in the restaurant, and go to the gym. Full size basketball court, amazing pool, rock climbing wall, you name it, the fitness ROOMS have it. The people I met in the elevator were A list celebrities, the Power players I met at dinner were heavy hitters, and being in the same room with these individuals gave me a great sense of pride. I could talk about this place for hours and compliment them, and when I see my colleagues, we still do.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: SB1981_28
Reviews.Content: There are not enough superlatives to rate this hotel - it is genuinely the best hotel experience we have ever had. The building was fabulous, the room amazing and the service impeccable. The staff all seemed to have bought into the concept of the hotel and are genuinely interested in how you are finding your stay. They all have a great nack of remembering your name and adding personal touches. Chicago was fantastic and if we go back then we will definitely be staying at the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the night at the Elysian, and you will find any excuse to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sweethomechicago21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the very first time on our wedding weekend in July of 2010. Our stay was so luxurious and amazing that we will be back again and again to celebrate anything and everything we can make an excuse for (even though we live in the Chicago area). We were already back again in March to celebrate hubby's birthday, and received a special birthday treat from the pastry chef (I didn't even ask for it)! Small gestures such as these, full of kindness and attention to detail, will keep us coming back to the Elysian for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “A new diamond in Chicago's crown!”
Reviews.Author: SLJ1
Reviews.Content: Every moment of our stay here was wonderful....the staff is very welcoming and helpful, the hotel in every detail is beautiful...we loved our stay here! They have a complimentary driver who will take you anywhere in the city you would like to go, which is a real treat! The rooms that we had adjoined and were very spacious (one had a fireplace) and the bathrooms were gorgeous; no detail has been overlooked! We also used the workout area which is also very well done with great equipment . Thank you, Elysian for coming to Chicago and giving us a world class place to stay...we will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Better luxury options in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: b1green
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this is a fine hotel and my rating is based on a comparison to other hotels at this price point. My qualm with recommending this hotel lies in the price point. For the rack rate, better options abound in Chicago. This hotel just seems to be missing the small details that make a luxury hotel luxury. The hotel desperatley wants to be a luxury hotel, but I find their efforts wanting. I much prefer the understated and confident luxury of other well known luxury hotels in the city-especially those with a longer track record who have proven year after year to be able to meet the expectations of a decerning traveller. There are two elevators servicing all floors, and they are s-l-o-w. I frequently waited upwards of 5-7 minutes per trip, and then had to stop at each floor to which other guests were travelling, making the total commute time from lobby to my room upwards of 10-15 minutes each leg. This adds up, particularly when you add in the unusually slow service at the front desk. And while the bathrooms are nice, there are no towel bars or even a hook on which to hang a towel when coming out of the shower. Details like this should not be overlooked in a hotel that charges this much. Again, I realize these are minute details, but when booking a luxury hotel, I expect these details to be noticed, not passed over. Overall, a very pleasant hotel, but not one that I will go out of my way to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Just...amazing”
Reviews.Author: 351pete
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is a very recent (2009) 60 story hotel. The premier gold coast suites feature a balcony, a fireplace on the living room, 2 HD TVs, and an incredible room with a very confortable bed and you can even choose the type of pillow that you want, simply 5*. There is also a very nice restaurant (Ria) and bar (Bernardâ€™s). The SPA (at least on the menâ€™s side) features a 20m pool, massage rooms, steam room, sauna, Jacuzzi, and is one of the best I have ever seen. And if youâ€™re feeling lazy and donâ€™t want to shave, there is a great barber service on the 4th floor that will make you feel. And a word for the staff, who were absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: LovesLuxury2011
Reviews.Content: If you're in need of feeling pampered, adored, and utterly cared for, or if you simply want confirmation that yes, you are the only guest on the planet, this is the hotel for you. Clearly the staff have had extensive training coupled with ongoing excellent leadership, as I felt warmly welcomed from the moment the driver (whom Conceirge arranged) met me at the airport. The Elysian team intuitively understand how a guest wants to feel (special), and they certainly made every effort to ensure I felt like the princess I know I am. My room was astonishingly large, gorgeous, and sound-proof. The main bathroom was surely designed and decorated by someone who appreciates bubble baths for two, a shower large enough to wash the kids and the dog at the same time (okay, I don't have a dog and I didn't bring my son, but the shower is a fabulous size), a private area for one's personal business, and double sinks spaced far enough away from each other that while I'm applying eye liner, my man isn't elbowing me while he shaves. And there are electrical outlets on the walls of each sink (often there is only one outlet). The large balconly off the living room and windows in the bedroom which open allowed for fresh air when desired. The food - Oh, the FOOD - was not only beautifully presented, it was "nobody-is-looking-so-let-me-lick-the-plate" delicious. The gym was sparkling clean with state-of-the-art equipment, and the business centre was extremely helpful. My "drug of choice" dealer (Starbucks chai latte) is right around the corner; all the very best shops are within 5-7 minutes of walking, and yet you're off the beaten track of tourists (a huge plus). I could go on, but you get the idea. Seriously, what are you waiting for? Book your stay with this exquisite boutique hotel, and get ready to be welcomed with love.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: richardpost
Reviews.Content: Excellent service & accomodations, from the 2 flat screen TVs to the gigantic bath & shower rooms. Also, the staff was very helpful in every regard, including providing information on the top sights of Chicago. My wife & I look forward in staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary New Year's Eve wedding locale!”
Reviews.Author: momNpop
Reviews.Content: As out-of-state parents, we were delighted by daughter & son-in-law's elegant, first-choice wedding site. Nooo comparison to other places they'd researched. Elysian's staff was incredible, from thoroughly organized on-site coordinator, gracious front desk and inspired chef to wedding night serving staff and doormen. Everyone seemed happily vested in providing the best possible service for our very special week. The Elysian ironed out details w/ the Chicago affianced so well that MOB had time to meditate, munch & sip tea in the spa lounge while bride2B & sis worked out in the spacious gym on wedding morning. Fine on-site salon allowed nails/ hair appointments w/out winter taxi rides elsewhere. Rapid repair of plumbing issue on night of arrival (no hot water to soaking tub) meant we could relax after long drive after all. Our suite was where extended family from each coast gravitated before and after the wedding. Room service provided munchies/ coffee/ tea so we barely needed to leave. The Elysian even provided kids games, but ring-bearers more entranced by television in bathroom mirror. 2011 was welcomed in best possible wayâ€”lovely ambiance for inspiring ceremony; wonderful food; balcony for fathers' toasts/ cigars overlooking city lights; dance space + sound sleep after it all. Thanks, Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “Superior accomodations”
Reviews.Author: histhort
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned this very last minute getaway and were ready to book at our favorite hotel, The Palmer House. Upon reading reviews for this hotel we knew this is where we wanted to be. Everything was outstanding, very upscale decor, service and an excellent location only two blocks from Michigan Ave. We felt very spoiled and decadent in our oasis, the fireplace was wonderful, the room very spacious. The only drawback was the bar located on the second floor. It was very dark and small. It would have been nice to have enjoyed piano music or some such. Overall we can't wait to find a reason (or not) to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away from your life and relax.”
Reviews.Author: nbottois
Reviews.Content: Modern and majestic modern hotel with amazing amenities. Very friendly staff. Great pool, gym, and spa. Very high quality food in retraunt. Overall excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elysian was a fantastic cocoon of total relaxation and peace from the outside world.”
Reviews.Author: karecc
Reviews.Content: Desperately needing a vacation and only dreaming about a spa I browsed through a magazine and saw an ad for Elysian. Curious as it was so close to my home 2 hours away, I inquired as to services on email and also called after shoveling through the giant snowstorm in the midwest of 2011. Though in my eyes it was a very expensive price for a massage, my husband had a day off and I encouraged us to go for it! We have had massages here and there for about 25 years and could give and take them as they were only okay. I knew in my heart I had never had a really good one and I had high hopes (really last hopes) for Elysian. Within 10 minutes of our arrival, I donned a luxurious robe and slippers, had a moment to explore an amazing eucalyptus steam room before entering a room to wait for my time. (I returned later) There was a lovely station of nuts and dried fruits in a beautiful tower of spoons with water spiked with orange slices. There were 3 women lounging together after their massages when I arrived in the elegant waiting room. We easily got talking-the Elysian experience does that to you! They have taken trips to spas for 15 years once a year as a girl trip and were amazed at the quality of massage they had just received. Then I got called and what I received in terms of deep tissue massage was nothing short of amazing. After my neck and back, I was thinking incredulously 'there's more!?! Loved the darkened room, quietness, no talking, sensitivity to my thoughts on pressure. wonderful heated towels covering my body in comfort. I received a massage I have only dreamed about in 25 years. Could barely walk out of the room but my massage therapist met me with a beautiful glass of water with orange. I fell into a beautiful chair with fruit and nuts in my lap and felt like a queen with not a care in the world. This kind of massage has stayed with me and I feel like it has provided healing to my soul.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite urban hotel, beautiful room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AliMurr
Reviews.Content: We came here for my husband's birthday for an extended weekend. The hotel is beautiful and has an excellent location - two minute walk from the Hancock tower, in the middle of the shopping area, yet not a noisy place at all, at least on a March weekend. The rooms are spacious and new, with beautiful marble bathrooms, spacious soaking tubs and glass showers. We stayed at a Gold Coast Suite for $500 a night which included brunch/breakfast every morning for two at their really nice restaurant and a bottle of champagne delivered to the room. Truthfully, we could have been fine with just a room vs. a suite, there was only the two of us and we never used the living room or the balcony. (I think the price for that with the same package would have been in 300s). Having learned it's my husband's birthday, they sent us a complementary chocolate birthday cake to the room. We ate at Balsan, which has the best, most creative and delicious brunch cocktail list ever. It turns into a trendy cool (but not noisy or crowded) bistro/bar at night, their bar selections and creations are superb and they make EVERYTHING in house, like jams, nutella, drink mixes, as well as serve great cured meat and crudo plates which they will cut and arrange right behind the bar which is a show in itself. We got a couple of massages at the spa which were great and the spa is relaxing and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service - one minor gripe”
Reviews.Author: areviewer
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a lovelly hotel. The service is fantastic, the decor is amazing and the rooms are spotless. My only gripe is the bar on the first floor lacks any atmosphere. Whilst the service was great - the bar is like an after thought - very small and dark - I therefore chose to have a drink elsewhere. There is a bar in the restaurant - but it is a part of the restaurant. Also, room service menu is very limited after 11.00pm. A simple request for a burger was met with "we can't do that as it is after 11.00pm" All being said - it is a great hotel - if it gets room service sorted out - it would be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Urban Retreat”
Reviews.Author: strgzy2
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 15th anniversary with a weekend in an Executive Suite. I was developing a terrible cold when we arrived, but the easy check-in, the champagne split the manager sent to our room and the cozy warmth of the fireplace helped keep the cold at bay. Although we couldn't enjoy the many facilities and services we had planned to, the location of the hotel made walking a simple exercise, even for somebody well under the weather. About the only amenity I could have wished for, however, was an in-room coffee maker, just to get me on my feet. There was simple coffee in the lobby and all kinds of stuff in the fridge, but if I had felt better, we would have picked up a cup and carb at one of the nearby patisseries to carry back to the suite. Lack of eye-openers notwithstanding, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether visiting the city for leisure or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience. Best hotel in the Midwest.”
Reviews.Author: indylady
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, elegant, comfortable, well located. Our experience was enhanced by their personnel. What a staff!! Restaurants were superb, worth the high prices. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Bwanderson
Reviews.Content: In 40 years of traveling to Chicago, I have never had a more enjoyable hotel experience. Service, friendliness, cleanliness, food quality can't be matched at any other luxury hotel. Truly marvelous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip gone awry; hotel saves the wknd !”
Reviews.Author: notaleg
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 24th wedding anniversary w/ a wknd. reservation at Elysian. The night before we were to leave, my husband became ill with a miserable cold and fever. We decided to make the 2 1/2 hr drive anyway and were so pleasantly welcomed by gracious and unassuming staff. They quickly checked us in, scheduled a spa apt for me while my husband slept and delivered a bottle of champagne to our room (which by the way was upgraded to a suite). Their compassion and help were welcoming for a couple who were trying to "get away" for a fun weekend but broad sided with illness. Thanks to room service hot herbal teas and rest, we truly felt we'd celebrated a blessed anniversary together "at home" with Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “Great Addition to the Chicago High-End Hotel Portfolio”
Reviews.Author: Dharmabum87
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is all that it is cracked up to be. Great service, great location, great decor, great rooms, great beds. Chicago has some great boutique hotels and the Elysian is another on the list (probably the best on the list). The rooms are exquisite -- fireplace, luxurious bathroom (with tv in the mirror), separate shower and tub, elaborate tile work. Had drinks at the bar which is small but quaint. I was looking for a particular type of scotch (oban) which was not displayed. I asked the waiter if that was everything they had. He asked what I wanted. I told him, and he said they'd get it. I don't know where they went, but about five minutes later, a staff member walked in with a brand new bottle of Oban. That's great service. And though it's expensive, it was completely in line with any other bar of that caliber ($15 for scotch, $10 for cocktails). The technology in the room is great. Free wireless throughout the hotel. We only hit the gym (which was nice) but the Spa is apparently very happening. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants this time though Ria gets two Michelin stars so must be outstanding. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kylekortland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. We enjoyed everything about it. Very comfortable accommodations. Very clean. Gotta love the bathroom TV. Nice touch. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “One word: Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Brad993
Reviews.Content: The best of the best in the best location. Service was perfect. Rooms are spacious, modern and luxurious. Attentive staff at every turn. Menu and fare are delicious conversation pieces!

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous”
Reviews.Author: loydhawkins
Reviews.Content: To the Staff, Our experiance was wonderful and exceeded our expectations in every way. We will be back soon and recommend you every chance we get. Sincerely Mr. & Mrs. Hawkins

Reviews.Title: “What a luxury hotel SHOULD be.”
Reviews.Author: AustinTich
Reviews.Content: Gracious and friendly, the Elysian doesn't bombard you with extra charges for internet, etc., but treats you as friends and lucky guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: southernboyinthecity
Reviews.Content: I surprised my girlfriend with a stay downtown for her birthday/valentines day. We have had an unbelievable time. From the moment we walked in, we were constantly catered to by all the staff. The check-in process was a breeze (the no tips policy was a pleasant surprise), and we were given a complimentary upgrade. The room was amazing -- roomy, comfortable and elegant with all the modern amenities we have come to expect. The in-hotel lounge, Bernard's, had a great menu of drinks and the most amazing potato chips. The staff there were more than happy to call for reservations for us at local restaurants and made the process so easy. On Saturday I proposed to my girlfriend (she said yes) and the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne for the occasion and asked how they could make the event even more special. All in all, the hotel was a wonderful experience and will definitely go back. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but didn't exceed my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Foodlover9
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off by saying that I have read a lot of reviews on places to stay for my hubby's birthday. I have heard nothing but the most outstanding reviews for this place and had very high expectations. Prior to my arrival I was asked the purpose of my visit as well as any special requests. I stated that it was his birthday and our valentines day get away. I made a couple of spa appointments and booked a deluxe suite. The hotel and suite were stunningly decorated and beautifully appointed. (Great location downtown) Im still unsure what the reason I was asked the purpose of our visit because nothing was really aknowledged other than receiving a piece of birthday cake that was incorrectly addressed to me instead of him. After we got to our rooms we had to call for the bags after waiting for some time for them to arrive. The cleaning staff is amazing and they work seamlessly. I had my favorite staff members while others seemed stuffy, cold and impersonal. I would definitely return to the Elysian and plan to but will know that while the hotel is beautiful they do not work to exceed your expectations but meet them. I have stayed at other hotels that when traveling for a special occasion they go out of their way to make sure that their guests feel special, I just did not get that from the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Wonderful Stay at the Elysian”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Elysian last weekend; it was her first time there and my second. We had a beautiful suite, which was absolutely perfect because we each had our own sleeping space - the bed in one area and the sofa bed in the other. The room was perfect for us, and the amenities wonderful (including a handy microwave oven). It's also very quiet and restful. We love the location for shopping and dining; and so appreciate the very friendly and helpful staff. Best of all is the marvelous spa and fabulous treatments we enjoyed. We also greatly appreciated the fact that we don't have to worry about tipping...gratuities are included in the bill at the restaurants, room service and spa - and other personnel do not accept tips. One minor complaint about room service that was rather slow and a clock that had a dead battery; but all in all a perfect experience and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: edithgreenberg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; great service and ammenities and top of the line furnisihngs - We highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “What else can be said?”
Reviews.Author: PaulFarley
Reviews.Content: The Elysian thanks you for your business, but i thank them for their service. If only every hotel you stay at could provide a stay as high quality as the Elysian, the world would be a much happier place. I guess i would like to start by saying ive stayed at every fine hotel Chicago has to offer, if you are an ambassador, maybe stay at Sofitel, they have amazing security. But if you are a traveler that wants a 5 star experience, or a local looking to get away from home for a few days, The Elysian redefines that option. They make me feel at home without even trying. I stayed at the Elysian last november on what happened to be the day after their Year anniversary. Just to get away and do some early christmas shopping . The experience was so enjoyable that i decided to book a couple days for my birthday recently knowing that id be able to relax and unwind. I was sent up extra bath amenities to my room which provided me with the best soak i have ever taken. I also had an amazing chocolate truffle cake waiting for me when i arrived. By the time i had to leave i was ready to book another weekend, or move in, definately move in, if i could afford it at least. I have stayed at a couple 5 star hotels in NYC, San Francisco, Denver, Miami and the only other establishment i can recommend as highly as The Elysian, Is The Grove Park Inn of Asheville North Carolina, because of their Spa. Its worth going to just because of their spa. While i havent tried the Spa at the Elysian yet. The Elysian hotel is almost a reason to come to Chicago. Once you stay at the Elysian you will be happy to have business in Chicago. its that good, i kid you not. Everything positive review you have read is true. Everything about the Elysian exceeds my expectations, especially if you get a room with a fireplace. The only issue i experienced was an in room dining meal i dont really feel was a great value. "The Steak" The deserts i had were amazing, i just felt my entree could have been better. it was delicious and tasty but i just expected more for the price. There is amazing food within the hotel, although i have not been able to try the 2 michelin starred restaurant yet. i look forward to dining there. i will make sure i take advantage of the actual restaurants next time instead of ordering mains for room service. i just felt lazy that night. plus i was alone and dining out alones gets old sometimes. But Chicago has the best restaurants in the country, so your not here for room service, right. There is no question about it, stay at the Elysian. Its intimate and low-key, but opulent and luxurious at the same time. the Staff and service are incredible and the no tipping policy is something that makes me feel really safe. i feel like they care about me, not the tip i have for them, i am sure they do. Whoever designed the philosophy of this hotel is a genius, a 5 star experience is constantly redefined wherever i stay, i just wish i had an Elysian to stay at wherever i travel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly exceptional service, quality and overall experience”
Reviews.Author: c2p2c
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quiet, indulgent and local getaway for 24 hours, my wife and I considered the many amazing options we have in Chicago, and we chose an unknown (to us) but enticing option for our experience. Wow, did we make the right choice. Pulling into the secluded courtyard off busy Walton Street immediately changes the mood and begins the experience that is first class at every turn. Every single person we encountered - in the drive, at the door, at the desk, at the spa, in the bar, in the room for dining and housekeeping - was attentive, friendly and accommodating. Every aspect of the hotel and our room felt luxurious and welcoming. Every memory we have now of our weekend makes us eager to return again very soon. Thank you, Elysian!

Reviews.Title: “Finally found it!”
Reviews.Author: ccumhau
Reviews.Content: We've been looking for the perfect hotel in Chicago for frequent trips there. We have found it. Perfect experience... amazingly personal service from the staff. Beautiful. Comfortable. Beyond the call of duty. Not pretentious but elegant. Ideal!

Reviews.Title: “get away weekend”
Reviews.Author: leahey09
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we about a mile from the hotel and scheduled a nice vacation weekend at the elysian. It was fantastic... amazing break from just down the street. The staff was down to earth and did not mind my holey jeans and t-shirt. The room was amazing too- We'll be back. Just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kimyrom
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e took me here for Valentine's Day for a quick little get away. From the moment we arrived, everyone was extremely welcoming and accommodating. Our room welcomed us with chocolates and heart-shaped brownies with a note wishing us a "Happy Valentine's Day". The in-room iron wasn't working properly and someone from housekeeping came and pressed my fiancÃ©s shirt for him and shined his shoes, although she did get polish all over the silver bits on his shoes she came back and fixed it and the GM offered a lovely "relax" set-up when we returned from dinner. They have a house car available, but it's not guaranteed to be available. Unfortunately, it wasn't available any of the times we went to leave and even when we called down to make sure it would be available, it wasn't. We also had a little miscommunication about the ride from the airport. When the reservation was made, we were told that a car would pick us up, which it did and it was comfortable and start out our experience right. It was when we got back home and checked the bank online when we discovered an extra charge from the hotel for $155! When we called to see what this charge was for, we were informed that it was for the ride from the airport. Needless to say, we should of made sure of what we were getting charged for. All in all, it's a beautiful hotel and has a very friendly, efficient staff. Which they must pay very well, because no one accepts tips.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel that combines perfection, professionalism and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn765
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights recently at the Elysian and were captivated from the moment we made our reservations. All the employees, from the moment we arrived to our departure, were polite, professional and, best of all, warm and friendly. Our room was upgraded to a suite, which was exquisite, and perfectly appointed. The bed was the most comfortable of any we have experienced in any hotel room. The food in both restaurants was prepared and served excellently. This is a hotel which makes it easy to run out of superlative adjectives when describing it! We are looking forward to our next long weekend in Chicago and our stay at the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “By far truly a gem !”
Reviews.Author: DebiAndy21311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the most luxurious, pleasant, accomodateing hotel we have ever had the priveledge of staying at! The furnishings, the bathrooms, the linens exceeded our expectations. The hotel personnel was so overly anxious to please it was refreshing! The no tipping policy is a welcome to any traveler! We even had the pleasure of using their private chauffered car for a short joust to a nearby restaurant! The room service is quite pleasant and presentation was awarding! We are planning a weekend this summer at the Elysian and cannot wait to return! The location puts this hotel over the edge! Spectacular !

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Great Lakes Region”
Reviews.Author: asubich
Reviews.Content: Make up a reason to stay here if you have to. Just stay there a night and you'll understand. The rooms are worth every penny you'll spend, and the location, and attention you'll receive are as good as it gets in the Hospitality Industry. Add the complimentary access to their spa, and you get an experience that literally makes this place one in a million. Can't say enough... Don't even bother shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay...a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: golflady4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a Valentine's Day treat. We loved this hotel. We try a different hotel every year (Four Seasons, Park Hyatt, Peninsula) for our night away from the kids. It is tucked away on Walton Street and walking distance to all the great shopping and restaurants. We checked in and was upgraded to a lovely room with a separate living area with a fireplace. The hotel is sleek, very clean and quiet! We did not eat in the restaurants there but they looked wonderful. We were treated to complimentary drive by James to a nearby restaurant for dinner.
