We did head into the bar on Saturday night but could not find seat so headed back to the room for a nightcap by the fire! Room service was delicious and very quick in the morning. We would highly recommend this hotel..a bit smaller than some of the other 5 star hotels but that's what we liked...more intimate!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Greytdoggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there while visiting family at the University of Chicago. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are clean, spacious, and practically brand new. We got a great rate to begin with and they upgraded us to a suite as well. We were very pleased with the accommodations. Overall, this was probably the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at. That said, a couple of things could have been a bit better. The rooms have no coffee pot or anything of the sort in them. The only option is to order room service for a $14 pot of coffee which we wouldn't have really minded except we had to wait 45 minutes for it to arrive. And, when it did arrive, they only brought one cup (must have though my wife or I drink a LOT of coffee!) and only one of the two bagels we ordered. The second day we ordered the same thing and that time we were missing the butter and jelly for the bagels. So, the room service could use some improvement. The one other main item is the shower, while huge, was painful. Yes, painful! The jets from the shower were almost dangerous for any private areas. I'm not sure why they just don't replace the shower heads with something a little bit more pleasant. While we had originally planned to try out the restaurants in the hotel, we ended up opting for other ones right nearby that were a bit more reasonably priced. Overall though, we would definitely stay there again and highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Resorttestors1
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at the Elysian was very relaxing. No tips are accepted, which was wonderful. We went out for dinner and a hotel car and driver (Benny) took us to our dinner at no charge. It was very delightful. The bed was very luxurious and most comfy. The room was luxurious and only a few details were missed, like the remote in the living room did not work (no big deal as we didnt want to watch tv anyway). I sent ahead my request for Flowers on Friday and rose petals on Saturday. The flowers were in the room upon arrival, but no rose petals the following nite. This was dissapointing. The breakfast was very over priced and only average in quality. All in all it was a wonderful weekend. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent service, perfect rooms”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. The hotel is 14 months old with a very Euro feel to it. Excellent restaraunts, great service, good location that is close to Michigan Ave shopping. I upgraded when I got there to a 1 bedroom suite that was spacious and comfortable. The Spa has a great steam room, sauna, and whirlpool, and the workout room is clean with excellent machines. Breakfast was fantastic and prices were high, but reasonable. The staff was polite and very helpful. I enjoyed this hotel much more than the Four Seasons in Chicago. My only gripe was that the pillows were a little hard on the bed. The bathrooms, particularly the shower and bathtub were awesome. Internet was free, and the bellman would not accept a tip per hotel policy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: BringAHeater
Reviews.Content: My fiance surprised me with a night away from reality for our anniversary in January. The hotel is amazing - the exterior is kind of French Provincial; the rooms are lovely, including the bathrooms with the large walk-in showers and deep soaker tubs; the doors use proximity sensors; and the light switches include any and ever setting you could possible need and with labels, so you know what you're doing. The hotel ordered a cab and gave the directions for our dinner without my ever knowing where we off to. The staff are exemplary. When we returned from dinner, the hotel manager sent up champagne and a very nice card. I have stayed at other top 10 Chicago hotels, and the Elysian is far ahead of any of the others.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: keeptravelin7
Reviews.Content: All of the positive reviews about this hotel are absolutely true. This place is fabulous. It is not huge and does not have a big lobby but if you enjoy a discreet private hotel than this is for you. The staff was very pleasant and made you feel very welcome. This hotel has a no-tipping policy and they really mean it. We used the car service to go out to dinner and the driver did not even accept a tip. The car was great as well, a new Lexus LS460 to drive you around a two mile radius in Chicago. Fantastic! The room was great as well. You felt as if it was your private residence. The rooms are done up in black and white and grey with some color in the pictures if this turns you off then maybe this hotel is not for you. Everything was new and sparkling clean with Italian cotton sheets on the bed. The bed was extremely cozy and comfortable. The only problem we encountered was a slight natural gas smell when the fireplace was turned on. Management says they are working on it. Parking is $50.00 per night but it is worth it considering everything else that they hotel offers complimentary. If you are going to Chicago stay here you will not be disappointed. The area where the hotel is located is the nicest area in downtown and the best shops and restaurants are all within walking distance. 900 N Michigan Ave where Bloomingdales is located is right next door, and Water Tower Place is just across Michigan Ave. We will only stay here in Chicago. Oh and the hotel bar is small but it has a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...I now know why they are ranked as the best”
Reviews.Author: econnor
Reviews.Content: Absolutely phenomenal place. I felt like I was staying in a friend's mansion rather than at a hotel. Room was incredible - fireplace, newer furniture, incredible bath/shower. Service is over the top responsive but also friendly - sometimes at other hotels there is an air of snobbery with the staff. This is NOT the case at Elysian although the place is certainly luxurious to warrant it. They upgraded our room and provided all kinds of extras (teddy bear for our baby, extra bottled water, champagne/chocolates on arrival for our anniversary, etc., etc) There were even hand written notes from hotel managers welcoming us. Best hotel experience I have ever had - HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: AMPTOC
Reviews.Content: Travel is extremely important to me and my husband, and when we couldn't take the time off from work to get away for a much-needed long weekend, we decided to stay local and try the Elysian, based on the recommendations in Conde Nast Traveler magazine. We were not disappointed. We spent two nights there this weekend and the room, service, amenities, and general attitude of the hotel were exactly what I would expect from a high-end hotel. The rooms were gorgeous and spotless, the staff was friendly and effective (scoring a prime dinner reservation with only one day's notice) and the health club was much larger than I would have expected for the size of the hotel. We plan on staying here at least annually and will recommend this hotel to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but beware of website and employees who don't quite get it”
Reviews.Author: blewis1041
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive, which is pretty much everything. The room was very nice, the on-premises food was fantastic, and service was great. Our room, although 16 stories up could hear a fire engine roaring at 3:30 AM, but to some degree, that's what happens when you stay in a large city. The bad: when I booked, it appeared that my room was a smaller suite with breakfast and a $25 credit included. However, when I went to the confirmation page, the breakfast and credit were nowhere to be found. In the "special inquiries" or the equivalent area, I asked for confirmation that same was included. Of course, when I went to check out, they said it was not. For 5 minutes, it was clear I was not going to get any relief, but this was $75, so I was not simply going to go away, especially since I felt I was right, and they never responded to my request. Finally, the woman gave me a $50 credit. While that was nice, I believe the website was unclear, and the fact I attempted to make it clear should not require me to haggle for a final bill in a hotel such as this one. Once I made my explanation (and she could see my booking, I assume), it should have been a quick apology, a reduction in the bill, and a note that perhaps I misunderstood, but they'd make an exception this one time, but with no further issues.

Reviews.Title: “They don't make hotels like this anymore...”
Reviews.Author: Kersti
Reviews.Content: From reading all the reviews on TA, my expectations were quite high, and Elysian didn't disappoint. The hotel is just beautiful...lovely courtyard/driveway, sparkling lobby, dark and cozy bar, gorgeous guest rooms with fireplaces. I prepaid online $195 for a deluxe King room (600+ square feet), and we were offered an upgrade to an 1100 sq ft 1-bedroom suite with an extra half bath and balcony for an additional $55 per night. I had to pinch myself when I saw the suite we paid only $240 a night for. Peaks at the lake, balcony, tasteful and comfortable furnishings, soothing palette of taupes, grays, black, white and cream, working fireplace and gorgeous carrara marble bathroom with awesome soaking tub and Asprey bath products, a quite impressive B&W sound system, and some of the most beautiful linens I have seen anywhere. Service was attentive and friendly. When we checked in, we asked if my husband's black driving moccasins with white top stitching could be polished. After half a winter in the mid-west, they looked like they had had a salt bath. (I had taken them to a local shoe repair place where we live, and they just couldn't do it without turning all the stitching black and "it would take at least 2 days to get the salt out"). Elysian returned his shoes within hours, looking almost brand new, top-stitching still white, and NO CHARGE. I kid you not! We stopped by Bernard's, the hotel bar, for cocktails before a late dinner reservation, and it's a total departure from the rest of the hotel: very dimly lit; cozy and masculine. Exactly how a bar should be...I felt like I was in the men's bar of a country club that had been there forever. The bartender was very busy whipping up some pretty elaborate cocktails for diners in one of the restaurants, but he still made time to chat with us. Very pleasant, friendly guy. They serve wonderful homemade potato chips and mixed nuts too. We didn't visit the spa or exercise area but we saw the spa lobby....also lovely. We also didn't visit the restaurants. The only thing that fell just a bit short was in-room dining. The menu in the room has a limited dinner selection, but when we called we were told that we could order anything from Balsan's menu which we had to look up online. I'm sure they would have brought one to the room if we had asked, but it would have been nice if one was already there. Maybe it changes too often to put in each room. My starving husband ordered Pasta Bolognese and for $20, he received about 1 1/2 cups of penne with sauce. He complained, ordered a burger (awesome), and the hotel took the pasta off the tab. I had the chicken club which was also great. They sent a bread basket up that had some of the best bread I've had, ah divine! I only have two very minor suggestions based on our stay: (1) I would increase the portion size or take the pasta off the menu; I've since seen other reviews that mention this. (2) I would have bath salts by the tub when guests arrive. (I asked for more conditioner and they brought salts as well.) Our check-out experience was terrible...only because we had to leave. My husband and I live about 3 hours from Chicago and visit often. We've stayed in most of the hotels in the Gold Coast. Not one of them even comes close to the Elysian. I HIGHLY recommend you book your stay in Chicago here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: doctorwink
Reviews.Content: Wow! Not only is this hotel in a great Chicago location but the staff has been trained to provide the best customer service I have ever experienced. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious especially in a big city. The rooms were extremely clean and the bed was so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me. Their hotel bar Bernard's was a great place to hang out with other out of town friends. I would highly recommend staying at the Elysian the next time you visit Chicago. Note: I felt the hotel rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, exquisite rooms, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December for one night before catching a flight to London. I got a great rate and when in arrived the staff was friendly, helpful and offered me an upgrade to a suite for a nominal amount. The rooms are AMAZING -- beautiful furniture, lighting system, fireplace, great balcony with a view and truly luxurious bath -- I felt like I was in a private spa! The staff was very friendly, courteous and the bellman refused my tip! He told me tips "were included in the Elysian experience" wow! I cannot wait to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could move in there!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaKat58
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the best hotel experience my husband and I have experienced. It far surpassed other hotels, including the Four Seasons we have stayed in, in terms of both ammeneties, and, at least as importantly, the attitude and kindness of the staff. The entire experience was wonderful, the suite was amazing, the food from Balsan was delicious and imaginative, and the spa was excellent. I can't say enough great things about thihs hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, but minor disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Davooda
Reviews.Content: Mrs. D and I booked Elysian for our annual trip to Chicago when we celebrate the anniversary of our engagement, do some shopping and dining and catch a show or two. We booked an Executive Suite via the hotel website and were upgraded to a Gold Coast Suite upon arrival - how nice! The front desk staff acknowledged the anniversary correctly, but later that night a complimentary dessert was delivered to our room, along with a note from the general manager, wishing us a "Happy Birthday." The first of the minor oversights. Our suite was very nice with a northerly view up Rush Street. The bed was very comfortable and the bath large and inviting. Closet space was generous and the in-room wet bar a nice amenity. Though it was cold outside, I enjoyed stepping out onto the balcony for a breath of fresh air in the mornings. Turndown service came on our first night - but then not again. The second of the minor oversights. We dined at Balsan on the first night of our stay and it was really very good. Make sure you order the tarte flambe - rich, crispy and delicious! We returned from the Chicago Boat Show on our second night of the stay and wanted to share a bottle of bubbly in the room before going to dinner at Girl and the Goat (thanks Peter, Chef Concierge!) but Housekeeping had failed to re-stock our room with glassware. There was not a glass to be found, so we had to call for delivery. The third of the minor oversights and one that would be repeated the following day, too. On the final night of our stay, it took about :30 minutes to get our glasses and ice delivered to the room. We were not able to use the car service described in previous posts. One time the car had just departed and the other time we were told McCormick Place was too far for them to oblige us. I enjoyed use of the magnificent workout room and locker/spa facilities and enjoyed a Spa shave with Oscar (a nice indulgence) that left me feeling pampered. We ordered breakfast in-room one morning and the entrees were delivered barely warm to cold. We used the in-room microwave to warm them and they were edible but not very good. The coffee was hot and strong, which I enjoyed. And for $18 per entree, I would have thought toast would be included. Nope - it's offered as a side for $4. Apart from the minor oversights of the Housekeeping staff and the in-room dining experience, this was a wonderful mini-vacation for us and we are sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moiraf43
Reviews.Content: We did not want to leave! This hotel is really gorgeous and the details are so brilliant! Our room was beautiful and the tub was fabulous. My husband and I were with our 6 year old daughter. The pool is small but she enjoyed it. There are two restaurants in the hotel and we ate at the casual restaurant and it was delicious. We had had lunch there months ago and dinner on a Saturday night was lively. We had a drink at the bar and it was cozy. The formal restaurant was closed. We had a tour of it the last time we visited and it is beautiful and I hope to eat there someday! Every morning we had room service. They did not leave the cart - they just come back in an hour! No cart in your way. And you do not have to call to have it picked up! Also, before we arrived I asked for a movie for our daughter. It was waiting at the front desk when we arrived. We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at Elysian”
Reviews.Author: BSKND
Reviews.Content: We had a basic room for a get-away weekend in Chicago and couldn't be happier with our stay. The prepaid rate of $195 was an extremely good value, given the room quality, service, gym, and use of the BMW (we got a ride to brunch one morning). Our view was not good, but I presume those rooms are part of the upper pricing tier. I have absolutely no doubt that we'll stay there again if this pricing continues. If it increases to Peninsula-levels, we'll probably re-evaluate.

Reviews.Title: “For one brief shining weekend I knew life was good”
Reviews.Author: itsatribunal
Reviews.Content: Every review on this site heralding the virtues and the beauty of this hotel are 100% true. I wouldn't have believed it for myself without having experienced it this weekend. I planned to stay one night however several hours in I knew it was not going to be enough. I called in sick to work (shh...don't tell!) bought another airline ticket home to stay but one more night; all the while loving every minute of my time at Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars doesn't do it justice”
Reviews.Author: Ravingfan_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get out of the restaurant I would reccommend the Ralph Lauren restaurant. While the restaurants at the hotel are great I need to get out of the building occasionally no matter where I stay. Loved the room, workout area and everything else. I didn't realize they had compimentary BMW service for guests so I would reccommend taking advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BES-OC
Reviews.Content: Could not have been better..although getting an Executive Suite helped. Perfect quiet location...hotel was great for a smaller, non-crowded upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, extraodinary service”
Reviews.Author: DewieGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked a special internet rate. When we arrived we were given a beautiful suite which consisted of sitting room with a partial wall that contained a fireplace on one side and the bedroom on the other side. The bathroom was large with separate shower and bath tub. This hotel was unusual as they did not accept any tips. The hotel employees were remarkably friendly. Parking was $50/night; but you could pull out your car at anytime - and again no tips were accepted.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elysian for New Year's Eve. We had the Miracle on Walton package, and it was worth every penny. We were greeted by the most wonderful staff - in the rain, everyone had a smile and a warm hello. Our room was spectacular - separate cozy living room with a fireplace, dual sinks in the bathroom with a huge, soaking tub and separate shower, and a beyond comfortable king bed. One of the greatest amenities was the television in the bathroom mirror - disappears when not in use - perfect for my wife when taking a long bath. The Elysian was as comfortable as our home with all of the upgrades we wish we had - just perfect. The staff and service made the stay. We had a hot chocolate bar with our package. The hot chocolate was literally that - melted, liquid chocolate with a touch a milk, homemade marshmallows and whipped cream - it came with pepermint bark that was outstanding. It was the best hot chocolate my wife and I have ever had - you must get it if you stay at the Elysian. Additionally, the hotel gave us complimentary champagne for New Year's Eve. They came to the room with champagne flutes and a wonderful note wishing us a great New Year's. In the morning, we had breakfast at Balsan. This too was part of the package, and it was amazing. The breakfast sandwich with chorizo, goat cheese and red peppers was nothing short of perfection. Above all, the staff is warm, kind and exceedingly helpful. Complimentary car service made getting around downtown easy. The staff had umbrellas ready for those of us venturing out in the rain. As we checked out, we were given water for our drive home. There is nothing the Elysian hasn't thought of. This is the best hotel in Chicago, and we are already planning our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay; world-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: klmil1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. We have travelled all over the world; this place rivals any hotel we have ever stayed in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Srewc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Elysian was a perfect choice for our one-night romantic getaway from our teenagers. From the moment we entered the elegant courtyard, we felt like personal guests at a refined European manor. We stayed in a mid-priced "executive suite." The room was comfortable and spacious. We enjoyed the sitting area and the fireplace, and loved the large tub. Throughout our stay we were impressed with the courteous staff, eager to help and politely declining our tip each and every time. We look forward to coming back for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Night Of Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Jody777
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Elysian was extremely relaxing and enjoyable. Upon entering the Elysian, you pass through an elegant courtyard which eminates a Parisian feel. After which you are greeted by gracious and friendly hotel employees who hold the door, start the revolving door for you and check you into your room. The ambiance in the lobby is exquisite, with a beautiful lounging area and fireplace. The room itself is totally amazing with all the immenities of home, such as: microwave, stove, fireplace,stocked refrigerator/freezer, giant size bathtub, extremely comfortable bed and pillows and the overly impressive television which appears in your bathroom mirror for viewing while bathing. Since we only stayed for one night on a Sunday, we only experienced dining in the Balsan which was truly delightful. The staff is extremely friendly and gregarious, and the food is out of this world. Most of all we enjoyed our visit to the spa. My husband was pleased with his pedicure, and he said, "I have traveled all over the world, and I have never had a pedicure quite like this one." I had a massage from Tarra, and it was truly the best massage I have ever experienced. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wish my place were as nice as my room was!”
Reviews.Author: adrianmeli
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal here during a trip over the summer as I think they are a condo/hotel that had trouble selling off a lot of their condos. My recollection is that they were asking very high prices for the units so the hotel part was discounting rooms to cover overhead, etc. I can't tell you how nice the room was as it was nicer than any apartment I hav eever rented. I would love to move in! Great service to boot so nothing to lose here. Don't know how much it usually costs but if you get a good deal, do not pass it up :) - Adrian Meli

Reviews.Title: “It resembles a stately manor and it feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: HappyChicagoan
Reviews.Content: The Elysian Hotel is an elegant hotel on the outside. It resembles a stately manor rather than a hotel. It's tucked away and set back far from the street so that it's away from the hustle and bustle of the neighborhood and seems as if it was your private residence. As a Chicago resident, I can say there is no hotel in Chicago that rivals the Elysian in its appearance. Most hotels frankly look like hotels. Its location is an easy walk to busy Michigan ave and after a busy day of shopping is a great retreat to come back to. Our room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. We had an excellent nights sleep as there were no street sounds-and in Chicago this can be a problem. Additionally, you do not hear any sounds coming from the adjacent hotel rooms-also a problem in Chicago. The real fireplace in our room was appreciated after a cold day. The staff was remarkably attentive from arrival to departure-never has a staff been so friendly and accomodating and we asked for help from every hotel department- front desk, housekeeping, room service, concierge, spa. It literally felt like we were the only guests staying there. I especially appreciated receiving complimentary bubble bath and lotion within minutes when I decided to take a bath at 10:00 pm and inquired about buying some. The hotel offers complimentary BMW car service for guests taking them within a 2 mile radius of the hotel and we took advantage of it several times with no more than a 15 minute wait. The room service from the Balsan restaurant was quick and the food was quite good. I wished I'd had more time to eat at Ria because it is a beautiful looking restaurant. The spa is fabulous and takes up one floor of the hotel. It almost feels like it is your own personal spa the way the facility is constructed. There are separate spa facilities for men and women with many areas to relax in privately-wonderful women's only and men's only spaces where you can relax in the hot tub, dry and wet saunas, receive spa treatments.. The lap pool and is heated and again, fabulous. It seems that a lot of attention was given to the hotel's layout designed to make the guests feel at home. But when you add the personal attention from the staff, there is no hotel in Chicago that rivals the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomARF
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a weekend getaway, based on the reviews we had read, and It did not live up to our expectations. Our room was not ready when we arrived, and we were offered the choice of a room with no fireplace, or waiting an hour. We have an infant, and we had just driven down from Michigan, and the man who helped us at the front desk was downright rude when I expressed frustration with waiting for our room, especially as they checked in other people who arrived at the same time as we did. The room was beautiful, the bathroom was amazing, and the concierge was very helpful, giving me a charger for my blackberry as i had forgotten mine. We ordered room service in the evening, and the 20$ hot chocolate was cold, and they only brought one cup, even though i asked for two. The waiter said that he would go get another cup, but he never came back. We asked to check out late, but were told that they were booked, so we couldn't be accommodated. Even though we got a good rate, it wasn't worth the embarrassment we felt at having to change a diaper on the floor of the lobby, because our room wasn't ready and they didn't have a changing table in the bathrooms. We were really looking forward to a weekend away, and this hotel really disappointed us. We were expecting a lot from this hotel, but after this stay, we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Elysian Raises The Bar on Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DTC
Reviews.Content: The Elysian has raised the bar on luxury accommodations in Chicago. The hotel decor is elegant, but not stuffy or pretentious like the Peninsula. The staff is extraordinary. Many defected from other luxury hotels in Chicago to be part of something special. The rooms are warm and inviting, filled with enough tech to impress even the most jaded traveler. Rates are pricey, but you get what you pay for, and factoring in the no tip policy (nice touch) the Elysian is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully luxurious”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: From the moment you set foot into the Elysian hotel, you feel surrounded by luxury, both in terms of the design/decor and the very accommodating staff. My husband and I recently spent one night here and I would happily return. We stayed in a Classic King room which was very spacious and tastefully appointed. The bathroom has a nice soaking tub plus a stand-alone shower and plenty of vanity space, complete with TVs built into the mirrors--very cool. Our room had a small wet bar including a microwave and spacious freezer/refrigerator--bigger than most you find in hotels. The room itself was really nice--again, very spacious and had a desk, flat screen TV, sitting area with a comfy chair and a large closet with drawers. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we were treated to yummy cookies from the turn-down service when we returned from our night out. We took advantage of the bar, one of the restaurants and the health club during our stay. I was slightly disappointed in the health club. The amount of equipment is more than sufficient with five treadmills, three ellipticals, bikes, plus weight machines, free weights, etc.--but it felt crammed. There wasn't really any open floor space for stretching. Also, don't mistake this for a hotel gym that guests don't use. When we got there early on a Sunday morning all five of the treadmills plus one of the ellipticals were already being used. We had an after-dinner cocktail at Bernard's (the bar) and found the service to be a bit slow and the prices to be a bit high, but it was convenient to not have to leave the hotel given the cold, rainy weather. And in their defense, the bar was packed. It's got a warm, cozy vibe going on but it felt a lot like a typical hotel bar to me--nothing special. We brunched at Balsan and found the prices to be a bit much, again, for what it was. The food was very good--I had poached eggs with prosciutto on grilled sourdough and it was really rich, delicious and satisfying--but that said we still found the bill to be a bit excessive for brunch, especially when it didn't involve mimosas or bloody marys! The service was great. We didn't have any special requests while we were there nor did we need to leverage the concierge, but all of the staff seemed very helpful, attentive and eager to please. We never had to wait for a taxi and the staff graciously escorted us to the vehicles with umbrellas. Also, they were able to accommodate our early check-in request with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: puffinsrock
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for two nights of "me" time (I am a stay-at-home-mom with two small children). I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and the Trump on past visits, but liked the reviews the Elysian got so I tried it. The lovely tucked-away courtyard was a lovely surprise upon arrival. My room was ready before noon. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was LOVELY. The only complaints were the view (essentially a brick wall), and the hallway was HOT. Like nursing home hot. My AC was on all night as a result (I like to sleep at 65 degrees). I had lunch in Balsan -- fabulous. I used the fitness center (they had REFORMER PILATES machines!!!) I ordered room service: prompt and good. Had a drink in the bar: cozy. All in all a wonderful break.

Reviews.Title: “The Pinnacle of Service and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bizinbluejeans
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my husband and I stayed at Elysian Hotel in downtown Chicago. The hotel is located on East Walton, and is quite close to Oak Street, the Magnificent Mile, and State Street. It's also located a short distance from the highway, so it's a fairly simple process to get in and out if you're driving. We actually chose Elysian because we were shopping for a bed and Elysian is a partner hotel for Chicago Luxury Beds, offering a few rooms with VI-Spring beds, so you can try out the bed for a night or two before making a purchase. While we didn't fall in love with the bed (it was slightly too firm for us and we ended up going with a Hastens instead; FYI, most of the Elysian rooms have regular mattresses), we absolutely adored the hotel. Elysian is the place you dream about when you wish for a hotel where the top priority is impeccable service. The staff take wonderful care of you to the point where you don't even have to move the revolving door yourself. And they won't accept tips, either, something that's slightly awkward when you initially try handing some cash to your bellman, only to be refused. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out, my husband and I experienced warmth and friendliness from the hotel staff. They made sure that our every need was accommodated with a smile- a REAL smile. Staff members introduced themselves and each other by name and regularly engaged us in pleasant conversation. And after recommending a restaurant to us for dinner the night before, the concierge remembered us and asked how we enjoyed our dining experience. As for the hotel itself, it's gorgeous and stunningly appointed. We stayed in a King room and it was the largest room I've ever had in Chicago. The room had a fireplace, LCD TV, and a TV that was actually embedded within the bathroom mirror. Everything was impeccably clean and we wanted for nothing. They had robes and slippers for us (one small pair of slippers for me, a larger pair for my hubby), and bottles of Evian were delivered with the turndown service. Elysian has BMWs with drivers that will take you anywhere in the city within a 2-mile radius. Our driver took us to Gino's for my husband's first Chicago pizza, and when we discovered a line outside the building, he quickly changed course and took us to a second Gino's location, where we had no wait at all. I have to confess that I wish we'd ordered in-room dining more than once. My husband and I enjoyed an in-room breakfast that was impeccably prepared and absolutely delicious. We'll have to try the dinner menu (and make restaurant reservations!) during our next stay. I have absolutely no hesitation about recommending Elysian to anyone and everyone I know. In fact, even after only a mere two nights there, I feel like somewhat of an ambassador for Elysian. More often than not, my husband and I stay in Marriott-owned properties when traveling around the world, because I inherited some timeshare weeks that yield a useful amount of reward points. But Marriott lacks customer service, and I've always imagined that there must be hotels out there where the staff cares about their work and provides an exceptional level of service. And Elysian delivers the kind of service I've always dreamt of- solicitous and helpful without being overbearing or false. You really get the sense that the staff really cares about their work and wants to do the best job possible. In short, Elysian takes the word "hotel" to a completely different level- it's more of a home away from home, but the home you wish you owned in downtown Chicago, where the people know you and make you feel totally welcome. Elysian delivers the kind of service I've always dreamt of- solicitous and helpful without being overbearing or false. You really get the sense that the staff really cares about their work and wants to do the best job possible. In short, Elysian takes the word "hotel" to a completely different level- it's more of a home away from home, but the home you wish you owned in downtown Chicago, where the people know you and make you feel totally welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Indyrk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a long weekend in December, and loved every minute! My wife indicates 'we have a new hotel'. Arrived very late at night after a very long and stressful drive through the snow. Matt @ the front desk was very helpful getting our belongings out of the car and up to our room. The room is gorgeous. Simple, elegant, spotless, comfortable. Fireplaces in every room. Matt noted that the pilot light was out on ours -- there was someone up in the room fixing it with 3 minutes. All the furniture is extremely comfortable. Really enjoyed breakfast in the room each day in front of the fire! The service was fantastic. For one thing, the no-tipping concept is real and genuine, and it does just make every little interaction with staff a little. . . . nicer. . . easier? More comfortable. My wife and I are vegan, so when we received a call two days before our arrival they asked for any special requests. When traveling, we never can get anything but oatmeal from room service for breakfast. So. . . .since they asked, we asked if they could come up with some options. . . maybe some vegan pancakes. We had delicious, vegan pancakes for breakfast every morning! Was really a great touch. Spa is very nice. Well appointed, again very clean. Pool is just a lap pool, and no whirlpool outside the spa. Would have been nice to soak with the wife. . . . .but we soaked alone in the spa! Then spent some time in the sauna and steam-rooms. The staff was great. Any request was handled very quickly. We never waited more than 2-3 minutes for our car to be brought out. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: kmboulet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The room was beautiful, with a firplace. The customer service from staff was over and above. I couldn't ask for more. I will definately be staying here again if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: cobramax
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Peninsula when we visit Chicago, but one of my partners saw the hotel under construction last fall and got a tour and then my son stayed there this summer on business. Based on their recommendations, it was with some trepidation that we made our reservations for the Elysian, forsaking the incredible Peninsula Hotel. We were upgraded upon registration to a Suite with a fireplace and a tiny balcony (but a balcony, nevertheless!). The staff was outstanding, from the building engineer repairing the fireplace that wouldn't light, to the housekeeper that came by to check to see if everything in the room was fine. When my wife asked for a coffee maker and some decaf coffee, the pot, coffee,and fresh cream were delivered in a matter of a few minutes. We were impressed by the rapid responsiveness of all of the personnel. The individual treatment surpassed the incredible service at the Peninsula, which is hard to do. I was personally escorted to the ATM machine in the business center when I asked for one. I was not about to just be directed there. The Elysian also has a "no tipping" policy, with the staff politely saying "my pleasure" when offered a tip, and holding their hand to their chest. They mean it when they say no tipping. In addition, the staff seemed less formal but equally professional as compared to the Peninsula. I preferred this attitude, although I am not complaining about the Peninsula staff. My wife said they just seemed more "enthusiastic", whatever that means, but I understood. I commented that it was absolutely quiet, even though we were on a lower floor (12th). The room was very spacious, well laid out and the bed was exactly what I prefer. The bathroom had a gigantic shower, with a nifty little niche in the wall where you could place your foot so that your leg was at the perfect angle for washing. Amazing attention to detail! My wife did comment that the absence of hooks for towels and washcloths near the shower was a mild annoyance. My only complaint was the alarm clock was a elegant old style battery driven clock which could not be seen with the lights off, and no way to see it without turning on a room light. Each floor of the hotel seems to only have 8 rooms, so it is very quiet. In addition, getting in and out of the hotel and on your way takes about 1 minute, as opposed to the circuitous route to leave the Peninsula, as elegant and interesting as it is. We didn't sample the restaurants, but we were informed that Via, the main restaurant, just received two Michelin stars in November, not too shabby! My wife used the Fitness Center and commented that it was the nicest she had ever used. It has a lap pool, sauna, and the latest equipment. The high speed internet was free (it really irritates me when a luxury hotel charges for internet when the Days Inn across the street gives it to you free) and very easy to log on to. My compliments to the staff and the management. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RBS5512
Reviews.Content: My nephew gave me a gift certificate that he had received from the hotel while in New York during fashion week. I live in Chicago and had no idea that the hotel was here. My husband and I stayed for a night and I had a massage in the spa. What a wonderful experience!! Our room was very nice but what I really loved was the spa experience. My massage was great, and I could easily see going back again. My only problem with the bed is that it isn't a Sleep Number, which is what I'm used to. Other than that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: happygolucky83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Elysian for an early holiday weekend with family on the recommendation of this website. It was the absolute best hotel experience I have ever had. If I had to summarize the stay in one word it would be: magical. Thank you truly to the entire hotel staff. We will be returning soon

Reviews.Title: “All around wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: ChiGetaway
Reviews.Content: Just a truly spectacular hotel. From the front desk to the fitness facility, everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. When our room wasn't ready at check in, they upgraded us to an available suite without a moment of hesitation. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the decor throughout the hotel was magnificent. And to top it off, the donuts and hot chocolate/cider offered outside in their courtyard as an afternoon treat on a cold Chicago November day will keep me coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience of my life.”
Reviews.Author: AlibobCK
Reviews.Content: This was truly the best experience I have ever had at a hotel. My fiancÃ© proposed on Friday morning and surprised me with a trip to Chicago to celebrate. He chose the Elysian based on the excellent online reviews, and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable. Everybody who works at the Elysian is so friendly and warm, which is sadly often not the case at other upscale hotels. During our stay, we did not come across one staff member who provided anything less than excellent service. Upon checking in, Nicolette, the Guest Services Manager, asked whether we were celebrating a special occasion, and we mentioned our recent engagement. When we returned to our room later that evening, there was a chilled bottle of champagne and delicious macaroons waiting for us, which was such a classy and nice gesture. One night, our carbon monoxide detector went off because the batteries were low, and when we called the front desk, they had someone at our room in under a minute, I kid you not. They were also profusely apologetic for the inconvenience. When we were leaving to go to the airport, we mentioned that we were going to take the El to Oâ€™Hare, and before we knew it, somebody at the front desk had called one of the house BMWs to whisk us to the Chicago blue line stop. We also signed up for the deal where we got free breakfast each day (room service counts), which was incredible. These are just a few examples of the little touches that occurred throughout the weekend and made what would have been a great trip an incredible one. I would be remiss if I didnâ€™t mention how gorgeous this hotel is. From the moment you walk through the front door, you are greeted with perfect dÃ©cor, and it just gets better and better. Every single area of the hotel that we visited, from the courtyard to our guestroom to the spa and gym â€“ even the hallways, elevators, and public restrooms â€“ was simply stunning. Our guest room (we stayed in an executive suite) was gigantic and amazing. It had a total of three flat screen TVs (one IN the mirror in the bathroom), a fireplace, a huge bathtub, and so many other great little details I canâ€™t even mention them all here. On top of everything else, even though our room was directly across the hall from the elevator, it was so quiet and relaxing. Honestly, I am not kidding when I say this was the most amazing hotel either my fiancÃ© or I have ever been to. We are even looking into having our wedding there. Even though it is by no means inexpensive, we both feel that we got a great deal given the level of service, the amazing environment, the location, and the free breakfasts. I would recommend it to anyone, from business travelers to couples to families. Please visit this hotel, I promise you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The best intuitive service we have ever received!”
Reviews.Author: akhjm
Reviews.Content: I was sincerely surprised several times by the staffs' intuitive service and care at this hotel. The staff thinks on their own and doesn't refer to a "corporate" manual. Very refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “Highest marks”
Reviews.Author: Houtis
Reviews.Content: The rooms are models of restraint and elegant design. The staff is exceptionally courteous and extremely helpful. The restaurants can hardly be topped in Chicago. So what's wrong with the Elysian? Easy. one day you have to leave

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: kenjr
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend. The room was outstanding the staff was very friendly and helpful. Look forward to return again next year. The courtesy ride in the BMW to dinner was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant. Genuine. Gracious. Stylish. Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: Bowdoin1
Reviews.Content: The Elysian sets the standard for which all other hotels should aspire. It is, quite simply, among the elite hotels not only in Chicago but in the world. My wife, myself and our three boys (8, 5 and 3) stayed 4 nights in a deluxe suite while I was in Chicago on business. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 a.m. and were promptly met and assisted by no less than 4 members of the incredible staff. Within 5 minutes we were checked in and in the suite with the sofa bed already made up, a roll-away set up, a handwritten welcome note from the general manager and stuffed monkeys on the beds for the kids. There was also a bottle of Evian next to each of our beds (including the kids) which was a very nice touch. The suite was exquisite. The color scheme is dark gray and white and is very elegant but exceedingly comfortable. The suite was about 1200 sq. ft. with a living room with working fire place, sofa bed, desk and small dining table and wet bar. There is also a 42" tv over the fireplace. There was also a balcony off the living room. There was a powder room off the hall and then master bedroom. The master bedroom has two very large closets, a set off drawers, and very comfortable bed and a chair. There is a 42" plasma tv on the wall and plenty of space for luggage and storage. There is also an ipod docking station on the dresser. The master bathroom is huge. Separate tub and walk-in shower (the shower is huge), separate toilet room and a dual vanity sink with an LCD TV built into the mirror. There were plenty of towels and the generous sized Asprey amenities were great. The room was very quite and one could control all the lights from various panels as well as request privacy and that the room could be made up. There was also a large closet at the entry. Our view was o.k.--not great--but from the living room one could look straight towards the Hancock Tower. The furniture was also substantial and very comfortable. The room had free Wi-Fi which was had both a strong signal and fast (unlike many hotels) and did not require logging in each time. Everything worked and it was truly spotless. Dirt, dust and fingerprints were simply not tolerated as every day when we returned to the room it was spotless. While the rooms are incredible, it is really the service that sets the Elysian apart from its competitors. Having had the privilege to have stayed at various Four Seasons, Ritz-Carltons, Mandarins and Peninsulas, I found the service at the Elysian to be the most genuine service anywhere. The staff strike a perfect balance between being helpful but not intrusive. The service is not obsequious like it is in some Far Eastern Hotels nor formulaic as you sometimes get in the bigger chains. Every single interaction we had with members of the staff--whether it was check-in, check-out, room-service, the spa, the concierge or getting a taxi was memorable for one reason or another. The no-tipping policy is real--every time a tip was offered it was politely but firmly refused. (The only exception was in the restaurants and in-room dining where an 18% tip was automatically added. While some reviewers did not like this practice, we thought it was great and, based on our experience, totally warranted since the service was always excellent.) The staff were wonderful with the kids and really went the extra effort to make them feel welcomes--whether it was the stuffed monkeys on the bed, crayons and cards to color in the restaurant or simply holding the door and letting them enter while mom and dad still scrambled to get out of the taxi they really treated them as guests in their own right--to me this says something about how the hotel values all of their guests no matter how old or, in this case, young. I could go on and on about this hotel. Suffice it to stay, we have found our new hotel in Chicago and recommend it to everyone. While the hotel is not inexpensive, it is a great value. The location is perfect and it provides a great base from which to enjoy Chicago. It is an elegant, genuine, gracious, stylish and perfect hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsQuiteARide
Reviews.Content: The Elysian has thought about every detail before you do. The rooms are luscious. Perfect linens, perfect robes, perfect bathtub, perfect pillows. Room service was delightful. The gym equipment is terrific (and it doesn't hurt to be handed an Evian bottle while you're in the middle of a run on the treadmill). It's a small fortune, but if you have a big fortune or if you're celebrating something big, it's a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good to be true but you'd be forgiven for thinking that it is!”
Reviews.Author: thegirlmiller
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay purely on the basis of the fabulous reviews on trip advisor and kind of expected to be disappointed as every single review was saying this place was incredible. We are very well travelled and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and must say the Elysian has stolen the number one spot for us! Where do we begin? The service is absolutely outstanding. However, what makes a really refreshing change in USA is that the staff actually refuse tips so you don't get the feeling that all the smiles and friendliness are so the staff can make an extra buck. They GENUINELY want to help you have a more pleasurable stay and that counts for a lot. The room we stayed in and the decor of the entire hotel was beautiful. The attention to detail was evident everywhere. From providing hair straighteners in the gym changing rooms( women will get me here) to having ice in the fridge with space to store your own drinks if you want to buy them from elsewhere rather than pay hotel prices. The concierge team couldn't do enough for us. We got fantastic seats for a Chicago Bulls game with a couple of hours notice and they recommended some great daytime activities and great jazz clubs to visit. We didn't dine at the hotel but we had our breakfast there every day. The service and food was fabulous. We were sorry to leave and will definitely be returning. Don't be put off by the fact that the hotel is new. They have got everything right. I think having a team of staff so committed and passionate about their job and the company they work for makes the main difference to other places we've stayed. I hope when they get even more recognition the prices remain as reasonable as they are now. It's not cheap but very good value for money when taking into account the 5 star level of everything on offer at the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel with marvelous staff.”
Reviews.Author: GregoryJW
Reviews.Content: This was the finest hotel I have ever stayed in. Fabulous electronics including a TV embedded in a bathroom mirror. (How do they do that?) Gas fireplace was electronically started. Furniture was very comfortable. The substantial staff was wonderful and attentive. Tips were not allowed for staff. No details were missed. The bar and restaurants were great. Drinks were made from scratch. No ready-mix here. The Spa/Healthclub was amazing. It had the finest equipment, service by attendants, perfectly temperatured whirlpool, sauna, and steam room. A great comfortable man-room. The food was fit for royalty. It was seasoned perfectly with sauces that amazed your taste buds.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Chicago, why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and would happily have extended the visit just to enjoy the hotel. The staff was very attentive. The rooms were beautifully appointed and the spa was lovely. I can't think of one thing that wasn't perfect and we have stayed at many luxurious hotels before but this one was definitely one of the best. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5th stay in this hotel, and it is always fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: HarryBudge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have chosen the Elysian as our first choice in Chicago. We have stayed in many other high end hotels in the city, and have found the Elysian to be the absolute best. The service is 5 star plus in all areas, and the rooms are impeccably clean and very comfortable. Great location, convenient to shopping and great restaurants. We visit the city frequently, and always stay at the Elysian and will continue to do so! Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top luxury hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: rdl44
Reviews.Content: The Elysian surpassed my expectations. From the beautifully decorated, comfortable and thoughtful rooms to the service where the answer was always "yes" with a smile, the Elysian delivers on all of its promise. We were greeted warmly, given a complementary upgrade to a suite, and treated to a surprise birthday dessert when we returned to our room at night. I have stayed in many of the best hotels, both chains (Four Seasons, Peninsual, One & Only) and boutique hotels around the world, and I can say that the Elysian is as good or better than them. I certainly think it is equal to or maybe even better than the Peninsula here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, service is top notch as are the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Couple1025
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The staff made our anniversary weekend truly special, they were very friendly and even upgraded us to a suite with a terrace. My wife loved the fireplace in the room and the attention to detail regarding the personalized service. The spa was fabulous as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: MaireadWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Elysian. The hotel is new, quiet, staff is lovely, room was luxurious and beautifully appointed. Bed extremely comfortable, and though our room was across from elevator, absolutely no noise from hall or elevator. Room very intelligently designed, lots of space, fireplace was fabulous. Breakfast from room service, very timely, delicious and beautiful presentation. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BellaStyle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight at the Elysian where I opted to stay with two girlfriends for my 40th birthday celebration. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels all over the world and this one is my new absolute favorite! I honestly will not stay anywhere else when going to Chicago! The staff was beyond helpful and nice...and not fake! It was genuine and not over-bearing. Being an Interior Designer, I had so much appreciation for the gorgeous surroundings from the lobby to the room to the hotel bar and restaurant! This is one of the best things to hit Chicago in the last year by far! Thank you for a wonderful stay...especially to Martin at the front desk and Levi whom was our server in the bar..they were fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in North America.”
Reviews.Author: reggierayray
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe this hotel: romantic restrained elegance. The rooms are incredible (the standard king comes with a fireplace). the service is great. The spa is great. Even the fitness center is excellent. The hotel is beautifully designed down to the smallest details (like the in room menus, envelopes and key card). And none of the staff accepts tips. even housekeeping. The Elysian has 4 house cars (two 5-series and two 7-series BMWs) that will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius. The hotel resturant Balsan is very very good. I've eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner there. The Elysian is my new favorite hotel in all of North America. I highly recommend staying here for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elysian!”
Reviews.Author: Liebchen
Reviews.Content: My family lives in Chicago and we venture up there to visit at least once or twice a year. This year, it was me, my husband and my 9 month old daughter. I am, admittedly, a hotel snob and the Elysian was wonderful. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and it was spacious and gorgeous. The bathroom was amazing -- all carerra marble and wonderful, huge shower. They even set up a beautiful wooden, full-blown crib with nice linens for my daughter -- well above what I was expecting. The service was perfect -- everyone was incredibly gracious and sweet. They even offered to drive us to close locations for dinner etc .... This is a non tipping hotel, which felt SO awkward, but it was actually refreshing since we would have spent a fortune on tips getting our car every day. They will not let you tip, even if you try. So strange for me... It is also a perfect location -- right by all the shopping and fun. Beautiful spa and indoor pool, so plan for that as well. I will DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: andrewlim7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels over the years in Chicago, but this is by far the best. One small caveat, I've never stayed at the Ritz Carlton or Peninsula but I've stayed almost everywhere else. So what do I like about it? In a word, everything. I arrived after a long-delayed flight at 1:30am. The manner of the reception almost melted away the stress I had built up on the flight. When I got into the room, I was near fully relaxed. The room was a junior suite so had a separate living area and bedroom. The furnishings etc. are very classic and stylish, without being old-fashioned. It was also really comfortable and sitting on the sofa with a great half-bottle of wine (reasonably priced) took away any remaining stress I had. The next day the meetings rooms were great - good size, great equipment, lots of light, comfortable, etc. The food at the meetings was also the best I've had anywhere, anytime. Also, the staff are fantastic - help in every way they can. Lastly, this is in a great location for everything in Chicago. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: I visit downtown Chicago often, and have stayed at several very nice hotels including the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton. The Elysian opened about 11 months ago and so I thought I would try it this time. It's a beautiful hotel inside and outside, and absolutely immaculate; the staff is extremely attentive without being overbearing; my room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed, great lighting, beautiful, spacious bathroom (with a television screen in one mirror), and a wonderful gas fireplace. The bar area featured a microwave, ice, and a small refrigerator drawer. The spa is wonderful. I had the best "age-defying" facial I've ever had. The hotel is very quiet and serene, and in a good location just west of Michigan Avenue, near high end shops on Rush, Oak, Michigan Ave. and Walton, and close to a lot of nightlife on Rush Street. Breakfast and lunch at Balsan restaurant was also quite good. Overall, it was the most pleasant overnight stay I've ever had in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations of a hotel experience elegantly received in every category.”
Reviews.Author: Annetta Jane
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Elysian Hotel while surfing the net and finding an article on a hospitality blog rating the Elysian Hotel as one of the top 10 for 2010. As all the reviews express,except for a few people, the hotel meets all expectations in every area of hospitality and the hotel experience. The entire staff wants your hotel experience to be wonderful and it was exceptional. By the way, thanks to the staff for a job well done. Thanks to the GM for the complimentary champagne sent to our upgraded room with the delectable beautifully arranged sweet treats. I would consider this exceptional service. And you????

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, fabulous hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: PassportInPurse
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Although it is new, the service is flawless, unobtrusive. Unless you order from room service, the staff will refuse tips. They are discrete, yet friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is a bit austere, but is still lovely. My room, which was upgraded without asking, was a one bedroom suite with fireplace and terrace. It was quiet, and beautifully appointed, and huge. The bathroom was very large, with separate bath and shower and dressing area. As a business woman, this hotel had everything that you would want. Did not get a chance to use spa or fitness center, but will next time. Close to great shopping, too. I felt as if I were in a hotel particulier in Paris. I will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: loudfan
Reviews.Content: First, an important note: I did not stay here on my own dime. I was in town for a family wedding and a relative was kind enough to pay for my room. If you're willing to splurge, though, the Elysian is truly an exceptional hotel. Luxurious linens (I don't think I have ever slept as well), a HUGE marble bathroom, great amenities like an iPod dock and a TV in the bathroom mirror so you can watch the game while you're shaving. If you open the window, you'll hear the noise & bustle of the city, but close it and enjoy complete silence. One kind of weird thing: we checked in on a Friday and there were two wine glasses on our mini bar, which we used that evening. The dirty glasses remained on Saturday, then disappeared and were never replaced with clean glasses! I guess I could have called down and asked for new glasses, but it seems like that's the kind of thing that should have been done without having to ask at a hotel of this caliber. Also, the lock on the front door to our suite was broken and the maintenance person wasn't able to fix it, so we had to leave it propped open all weekend (we had locks on the doors to our individual rooms, so it's not like anyone could have come in, but still, it was a minor inconvenience).

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: jezzie78
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is a glorious hotel â€“ stunningly beautiful and well located within Chicagoâ€™s best neighborhood for shopping and dining. What truly sets this property apart from the others, however, is the attention to detail and unmatched level of service provided. From the moment you enter the majestic courtyard, you know you are in for a treat. Staff â€“ from the doormen to the front desk to the cleaning service â€“ goes above and beyond to make you feel like youâ€™re the most important guest. Staff will take a request and, instead of simply providing information to satiate that request, will proactively think of ways to make the interaction and answer memorable. Some of the hotelâ€™s main luxury competitors â€“ say, the Ritz or Four Seasons, Iâ€™m sure, also provide reputable service. But, I always find their approach to be almost cookie â€“cutter corporate like. Itâ€™s as if the focus is on ensuring staff is following protocol or brand guidelines, as opposed to making it about the guest. Staff at the Elysian, it seems, are allowed the freedom to interact with each guest in a more personal and intimate way. The rooms, meanwhile, are gorgeous and provide ample room. Yes, itâ€™s true. Each room has its own fireplace! The bathrooms are huge. Everything in the room is completely updated and luxurious. With any hotel, itâ€™s the little details that matter, too: Tips, for instance, are politely declined as staff will constantly remind you that itâ€™s unnecessary as itâ€™s their pleasure. And, the claim ticket they hand you when leaving luggage with the concierge after checking out? Itâ€™s not some basic numeric ticket. No. The Elysian hands you a whimsical ticket stating â€œWe will treat your luggage as if it were our ownâ€�. Nice. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. Before staying here, my expectations were incredibly high based on the #1 Tripadvisor rating. I can easily say that the hotel surpassed what I hoped for and envisioned in every way. Not only is the Elysian undoubtedly the best hotel in Chicago, itâ€™s also one of the nicest properties Iâ€™ve ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious escape”
Reviews.Author: stlgirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysian for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. Everything about our stay was fabulous. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room felt like our own private apartment in the city for the weekend. The room was elegantly decorated. The fireplace and soaking tub were wonderful additions to the room. I have stayed at both the Ritz and the Four Seasons in Chicago and I would recommend the Elysian over both. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Shirley12LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian for a wedding. We had the great surprise of being upgrade to a suite by the Bride and Groom and could not have been more pleased. The hotel made the extra effort to make sure we had a great stay, the first night we arrived they sent us a plate of french macaroons. I'm not sure if they knew french macaroons are my absolute favorite, and these were very good. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous, modern art deco is how I would describe the decor. The furnishings are high quality and the bathrooms are simply amazing. I don't think we ever enjoyed taking a bath as much as we did at the hotel. We ate at the more casual restaurant two times, breakfast and lunch. The hotel also served the dinner for the wedding. All of the meals were fantastic, focusing on the quality and flavors of the food.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay or dine anyplace else.”
Reviews.Author: BWolt
Reviews.Content: Service and dining are exceptional. It's simple elegance. Staff attentive and service personalized.

Reviews.Title: “All around exceptional”
Reviews.Author: duffster17
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel before my trip and found it hard to believe a hotel could be so perfect so I took it as a personal challenge to find a problem with the Elysian. I hate to lose but in this case I happily failed and couldn't find any flaws--the hotel lived up to the hype. Each time I returned to the hotel, I felt like I was coming home as the staff always greeted me with a since and warm reception. They catered to my every need, it was evident they cared and had a passion to go above and beyond guest's expectations. The design ambiance of the rooms was really well thought through and executed perfectly. The fireplace in the rooms was such a unique touch, especially for a big city hotel. How do I get the name of their interior designer? It's a stretch but if I had to make one suggestion, I'd like to have an iron and ironing board in the room. I called the front desk and one appeared in a matter of minutes but it's amenity that's nice to have. My only regret is that I didn't get to experience the bar and restaurant this trip, just a good reason to return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: TDelMar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notche. All the reviews hit it on the nose. Superior service, there were so many staff around to help and be of service, they were almost imposing. Not there to intimidate you, but they were just everywhere to help. It seemed to be an insult to offer a tip. They did not accept tips. The rooms were some of the best I stayed. The "sweet" suite layout was very comfortable for privacy and guests. Guests came to visit, in the living room with the fireplace, and my travel partner was resting in the bedroom. The weather didn't really warrant the fireplace, but with the sliding balcony door, it gave us the breeze of CHI with the warmth of the fireplace. Having a separate half bath was also convenient, and thoughtful. One of the coolest things was the TV, within the mirror in the bathroom. You see the remote and know it goes to something, so i clicked all around the bathroom and WHOA! there it was behind the dual sink mirror. Walked to hugo Frog for dinner, walked Oak Street, Michigan Ave high-end window shopping. Just a great stay! This hotel is a MUST. And we didn't even get a chance to visit the whirlpool/suana/steam rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply...the best hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: DieBroccoli
Reviews.Content: Wow...i mean un-be-lievable. The Elysian has come as close to hotel perfection as i could imagine. From the moment you pull up and the doorman/bellmen greet you, to the front desk in an amazingly beautiful lobby, to the stunning rooms, and the prompt room service, this hotel has instantly become my gold standard in the industry I stayed for only 1 night on a business trip and almost didnt want to leave the hotel at all. The location is pretty good, within walking distance to Navy Pier, a number of fine restaurants, good night life (check out the underground Wonder Bar directly across the street), and also very close to the hancock center/shopping area. But back to the Hotel experience itself. I am not sure how to even express in words how incredible the experience was. So, i'll just list out the positives: - Impeccably clean. not even a drop of dust anywhere. The floors in the rooms had obviously just been vacuumed. not even a fingerprint on any of the glass tables -Tremendous Service. the entire staff was genuinely friendly and helpful, but without being pushy or making anything seem routine. - Free internet. THANK YOU! There is no reason for 5 star hotels to charge for internet access. - Free Bottled water at check in/out - After a long day on planes and in airports, that was actually just what i needed - Terraces in every room. With the recent warm weather in Chicago, it was so nice to sit on the terrace and have a few drinks and then in the morning, have breakfast outside - Spacious bathrooms, with plenty of space for tall people like me - Ipod/iphone dock with speaker. I plugged in, tuned in to the free internet, and i had sirius radio playing while sitting on the terrace - Private Bar. note that this was a wet bar, not just a fridge with little bottles in it. Stocked with great liquor, interesting non-alc beverages, and tasty snacks. - Quick room service - i ordered a pizza for a mid day snack after check in, and breakfast the next day. Neither meal took longer than 25 minutes to arrive. They even brought up a large carafe of purified water with the pizza (didnt even ask for it) I could honestly go on for pages on the positives. Lierally at every turn, every minute, there was another positive Cons...cons? okay, there has to be some right? These are completely nit-picking, but i guess the Elysian would want to know so they can inch ever closer to unattainable perfection - Breakfast size - delicious, but small. maybe i just ordered the smallest option, but i was left a bit hungry after the meal. - OJ - there was no orange juice in the private bar. would've like to have some as its tough to make screwdrivers without OJ - Doorbell - Yes, the room had a doorbell, but it could barely be heard once inside the suite. maybe have a way to turn the volume up/down on it - service - absolutely not a thing...don't change anything about the service.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a 10”
Reviews.Author: duluthian
Reviews.Content: Yes- believe the accolades written here about the Elysian. We experienced glorious, gracious customer service from each staff we encountered. Our suite on the 21 floor was beautiful and had a large balcony overlooking the city. It is located a few steps from the wonderful restaurants on Rush Street. We would especially like to compliment Carrie - who was our first hotel contact.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat within the city”
Reviews.Author: Forsley
Reviews.Content: Everything people have said about this hotel is true. The staff are very friendly, the hotel is beautifully appointed and the location can not be beat. We stayed in a deluxe suite and it felt like a home away from home. We had a separate living/dining room that had a fireplace , wet bar (which included the ice maker which we used quite often as Chicago experienced record breaking weather over our stay (October 8-11th) with one day reaching close to 90 degrees!), and a nice large desk that you could use to plan out your stay. Down the hall way there was a separate powder room. You then had a separate sleeping area that could be closed off to ensure privacy if you were having guests over or if you felt like adding an additional layer of quietness - although the rooms were very quiet so this is not necessary. In your sleeping quarters you had a lovely dressing area with two separate closets and a bank of drawers in between. You have a lovely large bathroom with a separate shower and soaker tub and a separate wc. The bedroom area has a nice king sized bed and two night tables and another chest of drawers. You really could live in this suite there is plenty of storage for all of your things. The suite comes with three televisions: one in the living room, one in the bedroom and one in the bathroom mirror. It is the perfect place to retreat to after a long day of sight seeing, shopping, dining and walking. In case you forgot a lint brush and shoe horn they are also provided in the room as well as standards such as robes and slippers. One of my favourite things about the room was the balcony off of the living/dining room. My husband and I live in a condo in a busy city and we do not have a balcony so this was a real treat for us. We had drinks on the balcony each night and listened to the city go by. Finally in terms of location you can find some great things within minutes of the hotel. For those of you who like Starbucks - there are two within a few minutes walk of the hotel - one on Rush Street and one at the corner of Delaware and N. State street (one street south of the hotel). There is a Sprinkles cupcake store a few minutes away on Walton Street as well (50 East Walton). An Einstein bagel just past the Sprinkles store on your way to Michigan ave (for the days you want something quick, easy and inexpensive) and as others have mentioned a Walgreens across the street from the hotel which is great if you have forgotten anything at home. Also close by is Pizano's Pizza a great place to get deep dish Chicago style pizza (it takes 30 minutes to make but it is well worth it). It is at 864 N. State Street, just south of Delaware. For shopping East Walton Street is one block south of the Oak Street which is like 5th Avenue in NYC or Rodeo Drive in LA. Michigan Ave is a 5 minute walk away from the hotel and you will find malls, independent boutiques and chains with the "Magnificent Mile". Enjoy your time at the hotel and the wonderful city of Chicago - a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalEngineer
Reviews.Content: We were staying as a family of 4 in one off their suites, which I highly recommend because for less than the price of 2 rooms, we were able to all be together to do whatever planning and whatnot we needed. The kids took the sofabed and a roll away. The room was great. Fireplace, balcony, great bathroom, side extra halfbath. Very cool feature was the electronic lightswitches such that from one button you can turn all the lights on or off with a single touch. The hotel is new, and everything felt new and most upto date. Great wifi access with no hassles or annoying surcharges. The staff was over the top with helpfulness. At the front desk, at the front door and housekeeping, everyone was proactively helpful and energetic. One example is we walked out the front door into their courtyard, looking for a taxi to Union Station and one of the staff immediately offered to whisk us there in the hotel limo. That was nice for us, but it also really showed initiative, care and energy for the driver to know he had a free block in his schedule and to happily offer, rather than hide in the background out of fear or apathy. On the drive, we chatted a bit and he said that everyone working there is thrilled to be creating a new hotel. I think it shows. The location was ideal. Just near the 'Water Tower' at the pinacle of the 'Magnificent Mile.' It makes a nice walk down Michigan Ave to the river area (thumbs up for the architectural boat tour). We were there on a warm fall weekend and the people of Chicago were all out and about enjoying themselves. Since the hotel is relatively small and new, I wasn't sure whether the taxi drivers would know it. Not all did, so remember the cross streets, but most knew it and raved about it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in a building”
Reviews.Author: miwohl
