Reviews.Content: Yes, it was a little intimidating to pull my rental car into the driveway and see 7 Rolls Royces, but the Elysian is amazing and if I had a Rolls I would want to park it there. But there is nothing pretentious about the hotel staff. They are incredibly friendly and attentive and truly seem to like working there. My local friend who came up to meet me in my room suggested we find out where the staff got their happy pills so we could indulge. They engage you in friendly conversation when you're in the lobby and it feels very genuine. There is attention to detail in everything they do - - from the turn-down service to check in and check out. The rooms are decorated the way I would like to decorate my parlor, if I had one - gray walls, a fireplace and a lovely seating area. The bed is incredibly comfortable. Big white fluffy towels and a huge bathroom complete my vision of the perfect hotel. Unfortunately I was only there for a night and didn't have time to check out the restaurants but it's on my list for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel you will ever stay in!”
Reviews.Author: sandimann
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, this hotel will exceed your expectations! Everyone on staff makes you feel like part of the family. The no tipping policy is great, you dont feel as if everyone has their hands out, and if you dont tip them they wont be back. The rooms are elegant and extremely clean, every detail is included. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel that has ever exceeded my expectations,a breath of fresh air.”
Reviews.Author: HSGESQ
Reviews.Content: Whatever the travellers goal,staying at the Elysian will ALWAYS be the best choice.We stayed with kids ages 10 to 20 years old,all loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Elysian has raised the bar in Hotel excellence way way up!!”
Reviews.Author: randybruce
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt and without question the best hotel my wife and I have ever stayed in by every metric and I have stayed in countless 5 star hotels.The rooms are indescribably beautiful with every up to date convenience you could ask for. is. Furthermore, the hotel staff will not except tips for any service. This includes luggage handling and valet service among others. This made me feel uncomfortable as they were deserving, but they acted insulted the more you insist. We were loyal and frequent guests of the Princess Hotel, a 5 star property, no more. This hotel is far better and I didn't think I would ever find another hotel to come close. The Elysian exceeds the Princess in beauty, customer service and every other metric you can imagine. Whoever is behind this property, congratulations and I hope you build more. You get and your hotel is the only holet we will now stay at when we visit your fine city.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: chagrinfallsoh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in at least 10 of the better downtown Chicago hotels in this is far and away the best. The hotel itself is lovely, clean, spacious, quiet and very tastefully decorated. Every employee we encountered during our stay was pleasant, helpful and went beyond the call of duty. This is my first review as I have never had an experience so over the top as to merit taking the time to do so. When in Chicago again, I wouldn't even explore another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karijo888
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I live in Chicago and booked this for my wedding weekend and I didn't want to leave! The decor of the common areas and rooms are stunning from the moment you pull into the English-style courtyard. You don't lift a finger in the hotel as staff is very attentive and detail oriented. We had an instant upgrade upon arrival to a 1200 square foot suite with a balcony. The bed is the best bed I've slept in and the bathrooms are very luxurious. The spa is gorgeous and relaxing and I had the best massage of my life there. The staff also had homemade pastries, champagne and rose petal on the floor as a surprise on our wedding night. They accommodated any special request we had.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better.”
Reviews.Author: dignatuk
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star experience in every way. The rooms, service and food are all as good as it gets. I have stayed at the best all over the world and can't remember better. I was shocked when the valet that delivered the bags refused a generous tip and said that their aim was to spoil us during our visit. The same thing happened several times during our stay. Needless to say we were spoiled. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: travelbug90587
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elysian for our anniversary and I only wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel is beautiful, the decor is interesting yet understated. The service was outstanding. Every person there wants to help you in any way they can. We felt very pampered from the moment we walked through the doors. Our room was large and opulently furnished. There were 3 TVs in the room, including one in the mirror in the bathroom. The towels, robes and slippers were of the highest quality, as were the toiletries, sheets and other amenities. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: Supersonic001
Reviews.Content: It was during a business trip that I was recommended this fairly new hotel and I was deeply impressed. The hotel is outstanding because of the location, the service, the rooms, the kindness of the staff, and much more. The Spa is a haven in itself, an island of tranquility and relaxation, with most professional staff. The spa bar with dried fruit was an ongoing temptation for me... I hope to be able to come back to this wonderful hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Posh rooms and staff wishing to exceed your needs.”
Reviews.Author: sullyhr
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at the Elysian as part of a surprise trip to Chicago for my husbands 50th birthday. After we arrived, a desert was delivered to the room from the GM wishing my husband a Happ Birthday. Very nice touch. The room was simpl gorgeous. The tub was a true oasis, one that my hubby wishes I hadn't seen because now I am dropping hints about a possible bathroom remodel!!! Timo was a great help and directed us to a very nice place to eat near the Second City theater. A car is availeable to use within a two mile radius, but it is on a first come first serve basis. Unfortunatley it was never available during our stay. I did see a Peddycab with the hotel name on it, but am not sure if this was something offered through the hotel or just advertising. The staff was always very willing to help in any way that the could. We did have to call for glasses to be brought up though because they were not replenished when the room was cleaned. One block from Water Tower shops, so the proximaty to shopping GREAT without being right on top of it. Everything is close enough so that the highest cab air we paid was less than $10.00. That was to Wacker St. and Mihigan Ave.. There is a microwave and refrigerator in the room to keep some suplies on hand. Also there is a freezer with ice that was a savior to my husband during the unusually hot weekend. There is a Walgreens across the street for any needs. I would suggest this hotel to anyone wanting a nice weekend away and to feel pampered. The no tipping thing was awkward for us. I felt guilty and wondered if I really shouldn't tip or if this was just what was said and the staff really did expect tips. I suppose this would work out fine or those visiting from Europe and not used to our way of tipping, but I felt cheap not handing over a tip. If you are going to the hotel by cab make sure ou have the address, not one cabbie knew the hotel by name because it is so new...E. Walton between Rush and N. State. Overall great stay though, and I thank the entire Elysian staff for everything.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! It is brand new, in a great location, and absolutely beautiful. They were so welcoming, the service was absolutely the best I've ever experienced. The staff even refused tips! It was expensive, but I feel it was worth every penny! The only complaint I have is that the room service food was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “A World Away Just 15 Min from Home”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel-CHI
Reviews.Content: My husband I live in Chicago (just North of downtown) and wanted a night away from home. We chose to stay at the Elysian based on a recommendation from a friend. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would definitely return. Pros -Rooms- they are BEAUTIFUL and new! Each room has a fireplace which the staff happily turned on for us in the middle of July. The bathrooms are huge, beautiful and clean. The soaking tub is so great! The layout of the bedroom and sitting area is wonderful and cozy. The entryway provides lots of storage and wetbar, plus is a barrier from noise. - Lobby and Entryway- Beautiful and secluded from the main street. - Location- perfect for Michigan Avenue shopping, walking to State Street restaurants, or heading to any number of hip hotels. - Value- reasonable rate for a beautiful hotel. Cons - Inexperienced Staff- 1) when making the reservation, the reservationist told me to ask for an upgrade at desk due to our affiliation and low occupancy rate for that weekend. The man at the reception desk told me that they could not accomodate an upgrade but they gave me a room with fireplace. I pointed out to him that "all rooms have a fireplace. don't they?!" That type of attitude is just not acceptable to me from those in the hospitality industry! 2) when we made the reservation, I also ordered a cheese plate (no meat) and bottle of champagne to be sent to room at check-in. The plate arrived with 2 pieces of cheese and 2 pieces of salami and no bread,crackers other. We obviously had to send it back. and 3) we called down to concierge to see if they could recommend a restaurant and indicated that we live in the city so looking for somewhere new, trendy to try. The concierge started recommending places equivalent to the cheesecake factory and not even in the close downtown area. I asked him if he was just looking on OpenTable and he said yes. I chalk experiences 2 and 3 up to a new hotel and staff, and hopefully that will be rectified soon. - Pool- very small. - Bar/ Lounge- was not open during the day and there is no outside terrace like Peninsula, Conrad and many others. Overall, the stay was great b/c the rooms are so luxurious and you feel pampered. The location is perfect and the rate reasonable. The hotel is new so it seems they were still working out some kinks. Definitely check it out if you like trendy, luxurious hotels, but don't expect the staff to provide you with insight on what is new and hip in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate in Luxury.”
Reviews.Author: stoutman
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here for a Chicago Cubs/Milwaukee Brewers game. It was also my Fiance's birthday. This establishment was extraordinary! I have stayed in world class hotels in NY and LA and this is above them all. The design touches and the level of service is awesome. Also the lunch I had at one of the hotels restuarants was one of the best tasting meals in recent memory. Everything is top notch- plush bedding, Bowers and Wilkins sound system on and on. I was also offered a free upgrade to a larger room upon check in (which I gladly accepted). Finally ,a nice personal touch was when we stopped back into the room after shopping-the GM Kevin left a personal note wishing us a great time at the Cubs game. Highly recommend this establishment and look foward to using the spa facilities next time!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury plus Service: Perfect match !!”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I can have enough words to describe the Elysian. It is a luxury hotel, very well located and full of beautiful details. Before my arriving date, the Concierge (the best service I ever have received from a hotel) organized and schedule for me segway tours, restaurant reservations, theather tickets and transfers in/out ariport.The rooms are spacious, they have a fireplace, cashmere blankets, leather inside the drawers, state of the art tecnologhy. One of the things I have been complaining about luxury hotels is that over the high rate they charged you for everything (WiFi, bottle of water, etc), this is not the case at the Elysian, the rate covers all this things and more !! the hotel has complimentary fitness classes, BMW`s ride for free is you need to go to 2miles or less distance from the hotel, amarettis, juices and fruit at the gorgeous spa and fitness center. I have lunch and dinner at both restaurants, and food was very good and not more expensive that dining outside the hotel. Other detail that I loved was that the complimentary slippers were actually my size (7) and my husband`s also were his size. So I can go on and on...I will like to thanks Peter Strandquist and his team Edward, Timo and Marc for making my stay at the Elysian unforgettable and for all their help.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched Service”
Reviews.Author: HinghamPonch
Reviews.Content: Concierge help very strong. Abundance of staff around lobby take care of everything before you can ask. Rooms are beautiful. Only hiccup was over-priced breakfast and charging 4x for my son's OJ refills. There's an Einstein Bagel within footsteps that solves that problem. Will definitely be the hotel we stay in for future Chicago visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TVbou
Reviews.Content: Good services, location. Peter in concierge very kind and helpful. Neet property.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This Place was FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: JRBChicago
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet and it looked good, but you're never quite sure until you get there. Talk about understated elegance, this hotel was the cat's meow!! I planned a day in Chicago for my wife's birthday and it turned out to be the perfect location and the perfect place for the occasion. For example, she loves to swim so we spent the afternoon in their spa and lap pool. The lap pool is sterilized with saline, NOT chlorine. No bloodshot eyes. While we were at the spa, they delivered a piece of birthday cake and a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice to the room. Wow! We were blown away!! The room was very spacious, and the bathroom was palatial. For example, the LCD TV was built INTO the mirror above the sink. The room was exceptionally quiet regarding outside noise, as well as the A/C. I just can't say enough about this place. It was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: we had an elysian dinner for our Board members, the food service and price were excellent, the flowers stunning. Friends from Chicago were amazed, as too are the staff friendly, polite,caring. The concierges all 4 are polite , intelligent,helpful, and the service in town car in and out of town amazing, we have made it to every early morning meeting!

Reviews.Title: “the premier hosts”
Reviews.Author: austin_TexasLkd
Reviews.Content: Met the general manager Kevin Robinson, he couldn't be more hospitable and inviting.he exudes warmth,and welcomes you as if you are home.The executive Chef Jason, was as proud of his spotless kitchen and wood burning oven, he is quite a talent and the food reflected his attention to quality,locally sourced fresh food.The somlier,Dan, was equally as informative and was eager to share his knowledge about the vast wine cellar.he was a charmer.our waiter Paul, was helpful,pointing out the pizza,the fresh heirloom tomato salad,that ranks as one of the bests.all in all, i would highly recommend the 2 restaurants.Balsan ans Ria to anyone visiting or living in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Facility Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: mcbr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in June another night in July and will be staying again in August for one week. I had a suite and it was outstanding. Furnishings are contemporary, room sizes unusually spacious. I had a fireplace, a balcony and a dressing area. Also a lovely bar area with a bar sink as well as a microwave and two burners for reheating or preparing snacks in your room. The bathrooms have separate walk-in showers and large bathtubs. Everything is clean and beautifully appointed. Exceptionally nice linens and towels as well. Service is always with a smile, but many times the front desk seems untrained. However they always are pleasant and willing to help. Also the room service menu is rather slim. Not usually important as there are so many wonderful restaurants in Chicago, but it matters if you must eat in for any reason. Also the pay per view movie selection is terrible. They must have had some complaints about that as they do have DVDs and players available through the concierge. Another area that is less than perfect is the lighting system. I never got the hang of it, nor did my travelling companion. Lights would go on and off at odd times and were hard to adjust to our preferences. But even with these small "complaints" I would rate this as a wonderful hotel. A little polish here and there would make this surpass the finest in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury defined, with wonderful rooms, location and service...”
Reviews.Author: a-traveling-I-go
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. I was upgraded to a suite upon checking in (without asking) and it was beautiful and well-appointed as all the other reviews suggest. Extremely quiet in the room, the terrace was noisier as it overlooked the building's air conditioning systems but still bearable. Everything was very clean and in great shape. Staff was attentive and said hello and welcome back whenever we came/went. No tipping policy is a plus. Only one minor complaint, really. The hotel's facebook page announced this week that there was now free local BMW car service, but this wasn't mentioned while we were there despite needing taxis on several occasions. I felt a bit uncomfortable asking about it since it wasn't 'offered', so ah well. Overall, a nice experience and I'd be happy to come back next time I'm in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: hopelands
Reviews.Content: check in - friendly , quick and efficient room - huge , very comfortable , large seating area with fireplace and flatscreen tv , separate area with desk facing balcony .....views out to the lake between the surrounding buildings , great comfortable bed with excellent quality linen facing a second flat screen tv and ipod docking station over large chest of drawers , large bathroom with separate shower , toilet , big bath to soak in and good quality toiletries which were replaced daily service - always friendly , staff were never intrusive but always around and ready to help, advise etc food quality - good value and always well presented , only problem was room service was a bit erratic location - excellent , very short walk to all the best shopping

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is beautiful but it's all about the service.”
Reviews.Author: DLSolomon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had two Gold Coast Suites and were traveling with a teenager and another child in her mid-twenties. We have lots of family in town and are renovating a house in the city. The staff was suberb, opening car doors, whisking our bags or purchases to our rooms, parking and delivering our car without ever a wait (and we went in and out constantly). With the "no tipping" policy it was such a pleasant departure from constantly digging for dollars that it provided a level of relaxation not normally felt when traveling. Unlike other reviews, the food and service in the restaurant was equally wonderful and the food quality was fresh and flavorful. We travel internationally and domestically with great frequency and I can say that the overall experience was the best I have ever had in a hotel. My only complaint was the air conditioning vent which was blowing right on the bed. Kudos to the owner who clearly gets the importance of competent service with a smile and none of the 5 star attitude!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: sorgio
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Chicago in as many years. The first time we stayed at the Intercontinental which was very good, but It could not come pair to the Elysian. The Elysian location is outstanding. A microcosm of fine and causal dinning, night clubs, and shopping. It is easy access to the airport on public transportation and a block away from the main intercity bus lines. The staff was more then accommodating in making dinner reservations, suggesting things to see and times of operations. We had an Executive Suite, which was over the top when it comes to, size , amenities, and pure luxury. Our room was equipped with a VI- Spring mattress which provided such an extraordinary nights sleep, that we went out the next day and bought one. Our last two stays were at La' Residence, Seim Reap, Cambodia in December 2009 and The Kempinski Ishtar, on the Dead Sea, Jordan in April. Both 4/5 Star hotels. The Elysian is a true 5 Star in every way. Thank you staff for a most pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hotel in a pefect location”
Reviews.Author: phiflyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night to see the Philadelphia Flyers take on the Chicago Blackhawks in game one of the Stanley Cup Final. We checked into the hotel and were pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to suite on the 18th floor. I had a suite to myself and would definitely say that 4 people could easily stay in one due to the enormous size of them. There was a separate living room area with a pullout sofa, fireplace, and patio. The bedroom was very spacious and the double vanity bathroom was enormous. There were a total of 3 high definition TVâ€™s in the suite and was surprised to find that there was even a TV behind the mirror in the bathroom. Another person that was traveling with me pointed this out and it was one of the neatest features that I have seen in a hotel. There is free wifi in the hotel that was very easy to connect to and very fast. The bed was about as comfortable as a bed can get and made for a great nightâ€™s sleep. There was absolutely no noise in my room from the outside or from other rooms so expect to get a great nightâ€™s sleep in complete silence. The lighting control system was start of the art and might be a bit of a learning curve for some people, but innovative none the less. We had included breakfast at the restaurant to be just â€œokâ€� as the food was alright and the service was pretty slow. However, since the hotel is relatively new this is something that they can work on to make the hotel outstanding. Overall, if you are staying in downtown Chicago and want to be close to Michigan Avenue but away from all the craziness that surrounds it than definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Linmac893
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with my two adult daughters. I have travelled extensively around the world and stayed at some very good hotels but this has to be one of the best ever. The staff were kind and considerate. They did not hesitate when I requested to keep one room until 2.30 p.m. on the day of checkout. Although hotel food is not always the best, the 2 restaurants ( one casual , one fine dining) are as good as you find anywhere with amazing menus and terrific knowledgeable wait staff. Fabulous spa and lap pool, great workout room. This is 5 stars all around!

Reviews.Title: “perfect...”
Reviews.Author: cantdrive55
Reviews.Content: stayed one night at the elysian because the hotel we own in chicago was sold out for the night... i wanted to see what i had heard so much about on a first hand basis... i've traveled to numerous hotels around the country at the top of the food chain and the elysian easily stands next to the very best of them... very elegant... very cool - but not THAT kind of cool... loved everything about the hotel from the people greeting you when you arrive in the courtyard to the beautiful room with a fireplace and lcd tv that magically appears in the bathroom mirror to the out of the way perfect little bar on the 2nd floor... from one hotel owner to another, you have a great hotel on every level imaginable - perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Virtually Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is absolutely incredible. From the beginning of our stay, and straight to the end, the service was very attentive and graceful. The property itself is very beautiful with its contemporary take on art deco style. Our suite was on the ninth floor, had a separate living room and bedroom, a large foyer with a kitchenette (with microwave), two large closets, and a fabulous marble bathroom. The decor was all in soft tones of grey, the only hits of colour being in the art on the walls. All of the furniture and materials were fresh, luxurious, and comfortable, and the suite was kept meticulously clean. The bathroom had some very stylish features such as the marble mosaic, frosted glass-walled shower and lavatory, and the mirror with a concealed plasma screen. The Asprey amenities were also a stylishly luxe touch. The only downside of the suite was the view. We did call ahead and asked for a room with a panoramic view, but as we were on a lower floor, the only view we had was of the "900 North Michigan Self-Park". Though this was offset by the fact that the suite felt like a luxurious cocoon. Other than that, the suite was amazing with the working gas fireplace in the living room and the desk in the window alcove. The food at the Elysian was also surprisingly good and far above average hotel quality. On our first night at the hotel we dined at Balsan on the third floor. The food was classic bistro (roast chicken for two- perfect!), with discreet service, elegant ambiance, and was surprisingly affordable. We also ordered from in-room dining several times, as the food was very good quality (including beautifully presented charcuterie and cheese), the service was prompt, and again, it was more affordable than most five-star hotels. The spa and fitness centre at the Elysian were also stunning. Though the lap pool was narrow, it was quite large and was new and clean. The design was light, bright, and airy and was a refreshing respite from the unusually hot and humid May weather. In other reviews, there have been complaints about the Elysian's location. We actually found the location to be quite decent, and wished we had had time to wander around the surrounding area. The area was far quieter than right on North Michigan Avenue. Though there is a deteriorated half-block of brownstones across the street most of the surrounding area was decent at worst. There were several upscale shops in and within a couple block's radius of the hotel. After all, Marc Jacobs has a boutique on the ground floor of the hotel, Diesel is on the opposite corner, and Tory Burch is a block away. The Elysian also has a no-tipping policy in place, therefore we were not required to tip the staff, though an eighteen percent service charge is added to all food orders. Other reviewers on this sight have deemed this service charge outrageous, but generally you would tip the same amount anyway and the service was worth it. All staff, including those at reception and the concierge were friendly and immensely helpful, and gave many good recommendations. The weekend we stayed there was also the Chicago restaurant convention. The Elysian was at nearly ninety percent capacity, and they did not miss a beat. We travel extensively, and the Elysian Chicago really is a special experience. I loved the Elysian and I would rot hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service!”
Reviews.Author: rtpaige03
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Elysian for a girls' weekend, we were treated like royalty. The concierge was so friendly and helpful. Everyone was smiling all the time, and the no tipping policy was great. The hotel was beautiful and well insulated from city noise. They allowed us to check in early at 9 am which enabled us to freshen up from our flight and enjoy a wonderful day shopping Michagan Avenue. Our only complaint was that we couldnt stay longer. Thanks to Elysian for giving four Southern belles a wonderful stay in the windy city!

Reviews.Title: “FLAWLESS”
Reviews.Author: Lduxler
Reviews.Content: I wish to extend my sincere thanks to the Elysian team for the assistance you provided in making my stay in Chicago comfortable and enjoyable. Every member of the staff whom I came in contact with was not only friendly and approachable but very efficient, too. Better still, they all seemed rather "cheerful". I've stayed in many top luxury hotels and the Elysian provided me with the best service, the best room and the most helpful staff. LARRY DUXLER

Reviews.Title: “Lux hotel that still needs work”
Reviews.Author: hockessin1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and nice staff, but food service is a problem. Room service arrived cold...45 minutes to get breakfast served in the restaurant AND they have the gall to include a 18% tip on parties of all sizes. Even a single who waits forever to be served. And they had reserved seats in the bar. WTF There are plenty of other posh joints in Chicago. You can avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: TravellersAB
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at some fantastic hotels around the world, e.g., The Milestone Hotel in London, England, The New York Palace Hotel, NY & Hotel Okura, Tokyo, Japan - and I have to say the Elysian Hotel in Chicago, IL, is in a class by itself. From the moment you drive into the surprising and beautiful courtyard (you cannot believe you are in the middle of a major urban centre in America) and are greeted warmly by professional, (unpretentious), welcoming staff - you know you are in for a wonderful hotel experience. The Elysian opened in December '09, so everything is new; but, the property has an 'old world', classic feel with beautiful, contemporary detailing. The fabulous amenities (e.g., restaurants, spa & fitness centre), location (!) and the staff are all tremendous and you will feel at home here. We encourage you to visit their website to see for yourself. Elegant, comfortable and impeccable. It is a MUST-stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaM2
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I married at the courthouse on a Friday and decided to have a mini-honeymoon the rest of the weekend at a luxury hotel in town. I do a great deal of event planning with hotels in my job and wanted to stay away from any hotel that made me feel like I was working. I wanted a smaller, boutique-type hotel. I had heard of the Elysian when it was featured on the 190 North TV program and that it had been the site for Jennifer Hudson's Christmas special, so I decided to check it out. It's just beautiful! A mix of contemporary artfulness and classic elegance. The courtyard makes you feel like your pulling up to a small European chateau and the lobby is gorgeous with beautful light fixtures and cool art. The service was superbe, with a courteous and attentive staff greeting you as if you were royalty. I booked a king size room based on an internet special of $345 per night; and for a stay of more than one night, the hotel provided a $100 credit! So we stayed two nights. Prior to our arrival, the hotel called to ask if there was anything special we needed for our stay. I explained we were to be married. They automatically upgraded us to a suite and provided a complimentary plate of first quality charcuterie and cheese as a welcome. The suite had a gas fireplace, two flatscreen TVs, a spacious carrera marble bathroom with a huge shower and soaking tub, lush bathrobes and plenty of closet and drawer space. The best part was the amazing B&W ipod station that is one of the best sound systems I ever heard. Thankfully the rooms were soundproof because we used the ipod station to its (almost) full capacity. The service was impeccable. When the pilot light when out in the fireplace, an engineer was up within a few minutes of the call to fix it. The maid did not take the tip we left the first night. I had read on Trip Advisor that the Elysian has a no-tip policy (beyond gratuities already included), but nothing was said to us about that. We enjoyed a drink at the bar, Bernard. My husband inquired about the ginger beer he enjoyed in the room but was not on the bar menu. The server without skipping a beat got him the beer. Nice touch! The health club is immaculate and has a separate, full pilates workout room! I've never seen that in a hotel before. The Elysian is perfectly located within short walking distances from some of the best restaurants and nightlife in Chicago. With the exception of an evening of live jazz music two blocks away at The Backroom and dinner across the street at the fabulous Le Colonial, we barely left our room. It was the perfect choice for our mini-honeymoon. I'm thrilled we chose the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Chicago, will not be a secret for long.”
Reviews.Author: OnOurList
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is by far the most exquisite hotel we have ever visited, including Four Seasons, Trump Tower, The Luxury Collection, St. Regis and other leading hotels in the U.S. and Europe. If I ever moved to Chicago, I would want to live in this building. It is grand in its finishes, amenities and service. We expected luxury when we made our reservations, but luxury, service and comfort do not always coincide to such high levels. Every aspect of the hotel was meticulously maintained. The other positive reviews on this website are accurate to date, as are the photos on the hotel's website. Our wonderful experience far outweighs any minor weakness that we encountered (yes, they need cotton swabs and shower caps in the bathroom). The soundproofing in our standard king room on the nineteenth floor provided protection from city and guest noises like we were sleeping in our own bedroom. If you have never slept in a bed with perfectly pressed linens, you are in for a real treat. The free wireless internet access was lightning fast and allowed me to work easily from anywhere in our room. The food and service at both restaurants was the best we experienced during our five-night stay. When the chef learned that we did not eat pork sausage, he ordered chicken sausage for our next breakfast. Mark was the most helpful and proactive concierge that we have ever encountered. He left nothing to chance and followed up on every detail. We visited the spa three times during our stay and each had a 60-minute massage. The spa areas, exercise room and lap pool were open to hotel guests for use without reservation. My wife is a swimmer and enjoyed swimming in the warm salt water of the elegantly tiled lap pool. The staff of the Elysian routinely greeted us by name as if we were residents. The location of the hotel is next to Bloomingdale's and the Four Seasons/Ritz Carlton; and two blocks from the Hancock Tower and Water Tower Place mall on Michigan Avenue. Even in the 20-degree weather, we enjoyed the short walks to shopping. The circular vehicle entry courtyard is unique and works well with its doorman and bell staff who jumped to offer assistance each time we arrived. When we requested help with our boarding passes for our return flight, the staff printed and delivered them to our room in about 10 minutes. The phones had one button for any service need. Whoever answered, helped with any request. We were never placed on hold or asked to wait. There is more to say, but I suggest that you stay at the Elysian and discover it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl41184
Reviews.Content: The Elysian is unbelievable. My boyfriend took me here as a surprise on valentine's day and I was blown away by the beauty and elegance of this hotel. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated like royalty. The fireplace was so romantic. The towels and bathrobes were plush and comfortable (and I am picky when it comes to this). The soaking tub and gigantic shower were fabulous. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud... I could go on and on. We've stayed at most of the top hotels in Chicago (James, Sofitel, Conrad, etc.) and this is my absolute favorite! I did not want to leave and I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: lpqmember
Reviews.Content: I surpised my husband with a Valentine's Day overnight and wish we could have stayed longer. What a beautiful hotel---huge dreamy bathroom with tons of room, tons of carrara marble and bizzaza tiles, separate tub, toilet,and shower. Lovely fireplace. There's plenty of closets, a great bed, plush towels and the push button room controls are easy to use. The only gaffes were no cotton, qtips or shower cap in the bathroom, constant knocking on the door from housekeeping (a no no). Room service forgot one of the items ordered. But the kinks will probably be ironed out soon as its brand new. We had dinner at Balsan which we truly enjoyed. The food and service were terrific. Bernard's Bar was cozy but not enough selections by the glass. The work out facility is a mini East Bank. I've seen lots of luxury hotels but this tops them for this. Spa looks small but upscale. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “No detail overlooked! This hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: travelzalot22
Reviews.Content: We had 8 rooms for our family over the weekend of 1/22, and staying at this hotel really added to our experience in Chicago. Not only are the rooms absolutely beautiful (with a fireplace in each room), the bathrooms and all of the amenities are fantastic too. The spa is gorgeous. The gym has all of the best equipment. It is really hard to find something that was forgotten here! The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. None of us wanted to go home and we all want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller10Ohio
Reviews.Content: We took a flier on this newly opened hotel and are so happy we did. It is a beautiful building - no expense was spared in the public or private spaces. The spa is beautiful, top quality fitness equipment and stunning pool and hot tub/steam room facilities. The hotel staff are extremely service oriented and the no-tipping policy really makes you feel like a welcomed guest. We ate twice at Balsan and loved it - great food and service at reasonable prices. The only bad thing about our trip is that we are ruined for future trips - no place will ever equal the Elysian.

Reviews.Title: “How long can they keep the doors open ?”
Reviews.Author: FUJIMO
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the appearance of a 5 star facility but when we stayed for 2 nights recently there were so many small glitches that I would have to consider it 3 star max - How can they compete with the truly great hotels in the city - Trump - Penninsula - Ritz Carlton Four seasons are well established luxury brands and the Elysian seems to be a minor league team against a magor league - We paid less than half of rack rate for a std room and were upgraded to a 1 Bedroom suite and still left feeling that it was not a good value - We would rather pay more and get 5 star service - The "fine dining " restaurant was the worst dinner I have had in recent memory [ I can't even remember the name but it is one to AVOID ] The Bisto restaurant was better but still not a choice that I would return to - Too bad Charlie Trotter pulled out of his agreement to run the food services but they definitely have a long road ahead - Room service breakfast is usually a good barometer of how well a hotel is on their game and my omelette was so undercooked that I could not eat it - What a shame but these guys are going to price their rooms equal to Sheraton - Westin - Hyatt because that is the level of service being provided - My bet is that within 6 months the hotel will be in enough financial trouble that it will be taken over by an experienced hotel operator and only then will I consider returning . Even then it might be tough to forget that the views are basically straight into a building across the street or if you are unlucky straight into the parking garage across the street .

Reviews.Title: “Most fantastic hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: mardollar
Reviews.Content: The fireplace, the velvet couch, the big flat-screen tv! The soaking tub, the tv in the mirror in the bathroom and the room service - amazing:) I ordered room service one night, and my chocolate torte was delivered with a candle! I ordered coffee service one morning, and it was delivered with a beautiful dark purple lily in a vase on the tray:) Their attention to detail is spectacular, and the "no-tipping' policy, makes everyone so much more at-ease. Loved the hotel, hospitality & food!

Reviews.Title: “Unlike Any Other Hotel We Ever Stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: eppyhow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the fortunate opportunity to spend a couple of nights at the recently opened Elysian and it was a most memorable stay. The hotel itself is stunning, from the cobblestone driveway to the art work in the towering lobby. Our room (actually a 2 room suite) was unlike any other that we ever stayed at. There was a great living area with a fireplace, balcony overlooking the Chicago skyline, comfortable furniture and an LCD TV. The bedroom had the highest quality linens imaginable, and a bathroon that words can not adequatley descibe. The deep soaking tub was amazing and the shower area was so large that you felt that you were in an elegant spa. There was even a LCD TV in the bathroom mirror. The service and hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and gracious. Throughout our stay, the staff often greeted us by our names. We had dinner at one of the 2 restaurants (the more casual one) and it was not only chic and trendy, but the food was as good as any that we have had in recent memory. The quality was on par with the best restaurants in the City. The spa facilty was the nicest that we have seen. My wife spend an entire afternoon just hanging in the sauna, hot tub, lounging area, etc... We tend to stay at high quality hotels (4 to 5 start hotels) and the Elysian is by far the most impressive hotel that we have ever stayed out. If you are traveling to Chicago with your spouse and are looking for a romantic stunning place to call home for a few days, the Elysian is it.

Reviews.Title: “In a word exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Fancifulone
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull into the courtyard, you feel as if you are arriving somewhere in Europe. Beauty can be subjective, but this is truly lovely. The artwork, chandeliers, flowers, textiles, and textures, and are true candy for your senses. The guest representative that greets you is yours from check-in, to escorting you and your luggage to your room. The rooms are luxuriously oversized, with features that will surprise you. A sophisticated lighting system, stunning lamps and sconces, beveled mirrors, an unbelievable mini-bar with, upscale treats, and a microwave discreetly hidden from view, a marble bathroom retreat with two sinks, soaking tub, separate shower, in mirror TV, IPOD dock, Juliet balconies, all rooms with gas fireplaces, luxurious bedding, textures and colors, from champagne, and platinum, to crown molding and Chanel style furnitureâ€¦did I say artwork and a sparkling chandelier in the sleeping rooms, too. My husband and I were celebrating his birthday this weekend in anticipation of the official opening on Wednesday, December 9th. We did see the lovely spa, yes, more stunning sights for the senses, with twelve treatment rooms, a lap pool, menâ€™s and womenâ€™s Jacuzziâ€™s, steam, and dry sauna, classroom, and a large and very impressive selection of equipment. We did experience room service, which was quite reasonably priced. The two restaurants Balsam (European bistro), and Ria (upscale dining, â€œwhere land meets seaâ€�), and bar named Bernardâ€™s were lovely. In Greek mythology, the Elysian Fields in Elysian were the final resting place of the souls of the heroic and the virtuous. I could tell you more, but there are some things you will just have to find out for yourself. Unconditionally recommended for all guests, both coming into town and celebrating a special occasion. I hope you get to see, hear, touch, smell, and taste for yourself soon.
